reviews: I love this book and hated to see it end.  I grew up in Chicago and am 5 years younger than Michelle letting me really relate to the environment of the city.  Michelle and her husband are my heros for all they accomplished in the White House and he could have done SO much more if the Republicans compromized. They both are so open, loving and sharing, I've always felt I could just walk up and hug them.  I liked her personal views and experiences on race inequality as I was raised on the north side of the city in a white environment but their was never prejudice in my home. Ive always wanted the true feelings of black people and they both have inspired people of their race  to open up and share...,I'm SO ashamed of my race for keeping racism  alive and cant believe how shallow they are .... Trump is the devil himself making everything worse and we despise him God bless you, Michelle....I really look forward to more books by you and your husband.  You are true inspiration to me and your mother is awesome!

reviews: I have admired Michelle Obama since she first came on the scene during her husband’s campaign.After reading her memoir, I love this marvelous woman. From her childhood to the present time, I couldn’t put the book down.Michelle is a woman whom I would love to have as a friend. She has had a remarkable life.I love, love, loved this book.

reviews: I found the autobiographical pre-Barack portion of the book to be a little too sweet. I can imagine for Michelle Obama reliving and writing about those days was a personal joy, but not nearly so interesting to me as the time after meeting Barack. I understand a critical part of her message is based on knowing where she came from, I just think it could have been more concise. I was fascinated by her White House years -- the challenges of parenting in a fish bowl and the unfolding of her FLOTUS programs. I appreciate her candor in mentions of Donald Trump. I finished the book inspired, confident that even at 80 years old, I still have something to offer -- I can mentor and encourage the young women in my family and in my life.

reviews: I think we all can relate to Michelle. She is so inspiring and I  so wanted to get into her mind and learn what is really like living in the White House and campaigning with her husband.  I related to her need to achieve to find the best job, attend the best schools but in the end it was not really following her passion and leaving her fulfilled.  She's honest about how brutal politics is and why she wants no part of it, and even when she is honest about her feeling for Trump it was done in the most classy way.  I plan to see her book tour this year and I can't wait. If you love Michelle, you'll love this book.

reviews: This was my favorite book of 2019. I learned so much about Michelle Obama and the Obama administration. It was amazing to learn about her childhood and what brought her to where she is today. She is so inspiring and makes me hopeful for what this country can be if we can get back to being kind and descent to one another and not worrying about race, gender or party lines. I give this book 5 stars and think everyone should read it and take it's message to heart.

reviews: Michelle Obama writes the way she speaks. She has a casual tone and a no nonsense attitude that keeps you interested in every word. I liked how she takes us on a journey from growing up on the south side of Chicago to spending 8 years in the White House. Her message is one of hope for the younger generation, but she doesn’t preach it, just shows how we can keep on growing.

reviews: I smiled, I cried, I fell in love. I liked the honesty about the family dynamics, work and political struggles and triumphs. "Becoming Me " started off a little slow paced for me but a necessary part of the story to prepare the reader to understand "Becoming Us". A story about balance; balancing personal values and work values, family life and political life. A story about finding one’s voice and maintaining one’s voice. A story about being authentic. An intriguing and inspiring story, well worth reading.

reviews: First Lady Michelle!! This is one of the most enlightening bios that I've come across thus far! Michelle seems to never stray from her expressive beliefs and thoughts, endlessly and elegantly reflecting on where her life began and how this awesome journey has catapulted over the years...what a beautiful and historical path to experience; as an avid reader, I completely appreciate honesty, and a bit of motivational therapy along the way! Excellent and Thank you for being true to you!

reviews: Michelle Obama, in my opinion, is one of the greatest First Ladies the USA was ever honored to have. She is a superwoman who generally cares about people, especially children. She worked hard to protect her children, support her husband and accomplish so many things to help people. It was really interesting walking in her shoes. Her story was very compelling from where she came from to where she is today. It was not a page turner, but a memoir of a great woman. I can’t wait to see what more she will do for our world. We need people like her.

reviews: Michelle Obama believes with conviction that if she can make it in America, then anyone can. “Becoming” is her testament to her core belief.We are a better country for the Obamas tenure in the White House. As important as the specifics of their tenure is the fact of their tenure. Understanding the full ramifications of that is the most important reason to read this book.Read more at bookmanreader.blogspot.com

reviews: An excellent book, honestly portrays what that period of time was like in her life. The origins of her family values, the experience of losing her father and how she managed to hold on to those values with daily challenges.Michelle Obama is a woman of grace with many lessons to teach. Her writing on grappling with a career that starved her soul, was among the best blueprints I have encountered for making a difficult decision, responsibly.

reviews: Becoming by Michelle Obama will inspire you to think about who you want to become, no matter your beginning & no matter your (or others) perception of how your life will ultimately end. Becoming is much bigger than that. It's potential in you, in other's, and leaning toward an uncommon life because you can choose that. Develop that. Grow into that. "Become" that unique person only you can reach for.  Michelle Obama takes us on a journey to "go high" - to aspire to achieve , and take others with us. In doing so,  our world is a better place because of our endeavors. We "become" better people because of it. Becoming is heartfelt, beautifully written, personal. It calls us to value ourselves, one another,  & subsequently build a better world. And who does not want to become someone who takes part in that adventure!

reviews: It’s a decent read but nothing particularly enlightening or exciting.  I generally don’t like autobiographies and this kind of confirms my own preference.  I am critical of people when reflecting upon their life, apply too much meaning after the fact to probably thoughtless actions of a child.  Don’t get me wrong; I love the Obamas. But the reciting of a list or accomplishments feels too self-congratulating to me and also inflating. A lot of the initiatives - did they really have any lasting impacts? I doubt it.  Not that she was not a great FLOTUS, but I feel that some of these initiatives, without regulatory changes, don’t have lasting impacts.  Anyway, this critique is only on the book, not on Michelle Obama as a person or as the FLOTUS.

reviews: A good book makes its story seem real and honest. This is what Michelle Obama's book does. I was right there feeling and living what she went through. Her empathy and caring for people really struck me. That she married a man who deeply shared her capacity for caring for others is no surprise. They are amazing people and this book helped me see what shaped them and made them so. I miss their classiness and humbleness sooooo much.

reviews: Let me start by saying the beginning was a little slow for me, but it was so necessary to have the back story for what it truly meant to become Michelle Obama. It is a must read for all women of all backgrounds. You can find a piece of you in the pages or motivation for your journey.  I am an educator and a president of a non profit. I chose to use my Christmas break reading this book. Some of my teachers and friends are having a book club meeting to explore the various themes and nuggets tucked in the pages of this book. Teacher salaries don’t lend itself to purchasing the tickets to join the book tour, but we can participate at a grassroots level by holding our own discussions. The Obamas gave a lot to show the world the best of us and not the exception but what a lot of our families look and feel like. They did it with the dignity and class that my grandmother always expected from all of us. This book gives you enough information to understand the sacrifice and know that it deserves for the benefits to outweigh the cost. That can happen if we continue to support and do the work described in these pages. “Let’sMove in more ways than one!

reviews: Personally Michelle has been a model to me, I am in awe of her strength and resilient in a world that wants to shut down women and diversity. This book tells her story from childhood to her experiences as FLOTUS. I am glad I am among the many so people that are able to see the truth that she presents. I believe this book is a means to let the legacy that we are united people regardless of our backgrounds. To shun the hate and promote diversity, to help the vulnerable and stand for what is right despite the odds. Thank you Michelle Obama for this book. It was a true inspiration.

reviews: This was the best book I read in 2018. Michelle Obama is not only a beautiful storyteller, she is a host. Mrs. Obama invites the reader into her life and into her living rooms as she moves from Euclid Avenue on the south side of Chicago to the White House. Her powerful story, vulnerability, humor and strong emotion read as if she is sharing an afternoon teatime with the reader who opens her book.Her perspectives on education, romance, becoming a wife and mother, politics, and wearing the mantle of First Lady will inspire. The tribute she pays to her own mother shows a grace-filled honor paid to the woman who set her daughter on the path to make American history. Every word is riveting.Thank you, Mrs. Obama.

reviews: I’m not finished reading the book yet but I enjoy the stories of growing up, her family and meeting her husband. She is candid and she is confident with herself. She is down to earth, unashamed of not growing up wealthy, and she is proud of her parents and realizes how much strength she has gotten through their example. She understands the significance of having been the First Lady, and she has contributed much to Country. She is beautiful of course and she has withstood the hatefulness of some of her critics. She has earned the respect of many people. I look forward to reading the rest of the book, and I hope that someday I will have an opportunity to meet her (and her husband). I did see the President when he came to my hometown as a candidate in 2008, and I watched him make his pivotal speech as a Senator. Both of them are excellent speakers and writers.

I admire her courage in revealing so much. The book must have taken a tremendous amount of soul searching and research.  However, I couldn't help but think that some people must have been a little upset about some of her portrayals. I, for one, found it an inspiration

reviews: I found in the reading of this book that in most of it I felt I was looking through the First Ladies eyes and hearing her voice tell the story. I sometimes felt I was with her on some of her trips and walking beside her. As I stated in the headline, it is not political. It is simply a story of a young girl from So. Chicago growing up in a dignified way through much tribulation and bigotry to become a wonderful woman that has done so much for the youth of our country and the world. This review comes from a 76 year old white man moderate!

Discriminatory ,mean, nasty, ugly etc.  should be a real good eye-opener for those who do not live or work in diverse environments and think we have come a long way since the civil rights act.  The inside behind the scenes view of the White House made me appreciate my privacy .  A truly informative and enjoyable book .

reviews: This memoir is a delightful reflection of our former first lady Michelle Obama. I love how smart, determined, and graceful she has remained. She is passionate about education, children and nutrition. I wish I had the opportunity to meet Mrs. Obama in person. I am truly appreciated of the time she spent as our graceful first lady along with her husband (former president Barack Obama). Their dedication to this country will be felt long after their leave from the White House. We are living in a time of uncertainty defined by narcissism, bigotry, racism and fear. Thank you for this thought provoking book!

reviews: This book was well written and taught me a tremendous amount about being Black in America. I had a visceral reaction to the drive and talent it took for our former president and his wonderful wife to make to the White House. Also a visceral reaction to the care they took to avoid offending the delicate sensibilities of our heavily racist culture. I sure wish our current first family were something other than uncouth slobs. My heart goes out to people of color in this society as a result of reading this moving book!

reviews: I cannot even begin to describe how beautifully this book was written and how inspired I am after reading Michelle’s story. Everyone can read it, yes, but if you’re black you can relate to her story on a personal level. Must read for sure! Highly recommended! You could also check out the documentary with the same title on Netflix. It basically sums up the book.

reviews: Michelle Obama's Becoming is a fascinating account of her life growing up on the South Side of Chicago, her education and her career in law until she met and fell in love with Barack Obama, and how their lives changed as he entered politics and ended up in the White House. You feel as if you are hearing her story personally and honestly, with a lot of heart and good humor. You always feel as you read her book that she wanted to live a meaningful life full of love for her family. After the births of her daughter Sasha and Malia, the book is full of stories about them growing up in the White House and becoming young adults in extraordinary circumstances. This is a rare look behind the scenes at a remarkable family and an amazing life.

reviews: I thank her for writing this book. I love that she gave a personal and up close vision of what it meant to be Michelle, wife, mother, first lady and African American in the White House. In my mind I always visioned it would all be peaches and cream. Thank you for the the truth. For all those readers do not rush through this book. Take the time to read every syllable, adjectives, verb and pronoun. I found myself rereading paragraphs to try and get an understanding of what she was trying to tell me. And when I finally did it was wonderful. I also gave to other books as a Christmas gift to my girlfriends. And we'll be passing this one down to my daughter. I say thank you to her again.

reviews: Becoming is a honest and energizing book.  Like so many of us, Michelle lives to find who she is.  She is inspiring in that she came from a less than desirable locale, leaving it only physically with education.  Inspiring because she left it by taking advantage of public education.  More than that, her heart never left the area in Chicago where she hung her hopes.  Michelle Obama is rooted in Chicago, sprouted through her education and career choices and is still sprouting branches that flower insight, hope, and encouragement to anyone ready to face their place in an ever changing world.

reviews: Michelle Obama's candor and authenticity made this book both easy to read and inspirational. I thought it was unusual for a First Lady to have been so open about her thoughts, emotions, and opinions  - shedding light to an otherwise closed off world and bringing people to understand her own vulnerabilities as a human being. What i appreciated the most was how consistent her tone was throughout the book - I felt that her stories were told lovingly and with a goal to reach out to people, connect, and relate, rather than to propagate any specific political view. The stories show her unwavering optimism, commitment to humanity, and a genuine dedication to inspire those around her with worldly values - Michelle, what a strong woman! I only hope Michelle Obama would publish more books so she can continue to inspire and share the warmth of her love for this world and humanity!A must read for anyone who wants to leave feeling hopeful, warm, and optimistic about the day in age we live in. Thank you Michelle for making me believe that goodness, fairness, and generosity still exist in the world of politics we are experiencing today!

reviews: Michelle provided an engaging insight into the life of an ordinary girl (next door woman) who became extraordinary! It was fascinating to watch her evolve from a box checker (her words) to a world leader, innovator and thinker despite the pressures of racism she confronted. Our book club talked about this book for a long time, beyond our usual book club discussion. I highly recommend this book to any person interested in Becoming their best self.

reviews: I really enjoyed reading this book.  Michelle Obama is a great story teller. She walks the reader through her childhood in Chicago and paints a vivid picture of her early experiences, the family that impacted her and the doubts and insecurities that would drive her all her life.I gave it 4 stars because it seems to run out of steam along the last few chapters and feels rushed to an ending. I would have loved to see the same detail on the last aspects of the book (her life in the White House) as she painted in her early childhood.  However, overall, wonderful read and gives you great insight into her life, family, marriage, and the many challenges she navigated along the way.

reviews: I had no clue what I was getting into when I started reading this. The memoir is refreshingly  honest and heart-felt, giving an intimate look into her hopes & fears, vivid flashbacks into her childhood and connecting throughout the book to these core events and people who she credits for who and where sshe ended up. Revealing and fascinating nuance brought to President Obama and her family and friends that makes you feel like you almost know them personslly. This book is so REAL and entertaining, a page-turner too, providing an uplifting read. Thanks to her philosophy on life and her candour, Becoming reinforces that women are valuable and bright and strong, and yet we don't have to be perfect. Women of color please read this and start leading - we need more Michelle Obama's in this world!!!Mrs. Obama Thank you for inspiring me, a young woman to pursue community organizing and gift White supremacy in my own circles in the Bay Area and San Diego. Your book is outstanding, thank you for this gift of vulnerability.

reviews: Well written book, plus fascinating life story.Some places feels sketchy and superficial tho (at least for me), maybe because I’m living in my own bulb 💡 far away from America-world :) OR maybe because she is “the First Lady” & it’s forever!I love the title “Becoming” and structure the author used. It goes thru the whole book as a gold line: becoming isn’t about arriving somewhere, it is a MOTION, process/evolving with no end. And this girl never stops!Enjoyed reading about childhood and family stories.The most interesting info - about differences (as personalities/character/likes) with Barack. But still...they stayed together, with each year stronger than ever. Love conquers everything “wink”!

reviews: I absolutely loved this book.  I read it on Kindle, so if there were pictures in the paper book, I didn't have them, but the writing and recounting the details of her life were so vivid, you don't need pictures.  In these horrible, stressful times we're  living in the USA now (beginning 2017 and on, and on, and on), it was such a welcome return to real people, nice people, in fact, people like my family, was a big part of my enjoyment reading her story.  If only all people in the news, in all the country, in all the world, could be as eloquent, wise, good, and grounded as Michelle and Barack Obama, . .. . think of what a great life this would be.

I knew it would be good, I knew it would be truth, I knew it would be authentic from a true American Hero. My daughter loves her. The trolls hired to spam these reviews motivated me even more not only to purchase one to read, but to purchase several more as gifts. America will survive this 2016-2020 stain.

reviews: It's a lovely book.  The first section on her childhood in south Chicago is particularly moving.  I'm impressed with the extent to which she thought through her role as first lady and concentrated so heavily on providing opportunities for women and children.  The differences between her family expectations and her husband's and how she worked at bridging them are admirable.  Her mother claimed that Michelle and her brother were not unusual--that there were many other children just as gifted.  It's hard to believe because Michelle's gifts are remarkable.

reviews: I loved reading this book because it felt I got to know the Obamas on a personal level.  It was so endearing to read about how Michelle and Barack met and started dating, how he proposed, how their girls took to the roller coaster of being First Children, etc.  I was so glad that Michelle also wrote about the difficulties of being a successful woman who expects equality and partnership and how she came to terms with a role that expects you to smile and support your husband's dreams and successes, and how they navigated through that and made it out the other side.  It felt like a really human and real story of two ordinary people who ended up leading extraordinary lives.

reviews: Extremely L-O-N-G book!  Yikes!  But, that being said...it is still good.  I enjoyed her writing style.  She gave soooooooo many details about EEEEEVERYTHING from start to finish.  Hence, this is why the book is so long.  I read it because all of my book reading friends told me I had to check it out.  So, I did.  I enjoyed it but honestly, it could have been 2/3rds of its length.  Really.If you are an Obama fan, you should definitely read this book.  And, it definitely is historical in my opinion...so that alone is a good enough reason to read it, even though I have never been a fan of much history (sorry).

reviews: I initially thought the book was about the things that happened in the White House. Anyway, I loved this book. She was so candid and I especially loved that. You can tell she is very down to earth, and her writing skills are remarkable. While reading certain parts I would get the chills. The words make you think you are actually experiencing what she was trying to get across yourself. The fact that she kept it real about how she felt was everything to me. Most people would not be so open for fear of what others would think. Will definitely buy other books that she has written.

reviews: Michelle is the real deal. It was heart warming to read of her humble upbringing and the love of her family. Michelle worked hard to get good grades, to find her way through racism and struggle. Her can do spirit and reluctant decision to embrace her husband's political trajectory meant she had to give up her VP position with 22 staff in order to support her husband's political path. The rest we know from her as First Lady but all that came before is a story worth reading.

reviews: One of my favorite passages in this book comes toward the end “For me, becoming isn’t about arriving somewhere or achieving a certain aim.  I see it instead as forward motion, a means of evolving, a way to reach continuously toward a better self.  The journey doesn’t end.”  This is one of the most remarkable, yet completely ordinary, stories I’ve ever read.  And what it did for me is to help me remember to own, as well as write our own stories.

reviews: This book gives me hope in our world and our country and democracy that there are actually a generally ordinary man and a woman who rose to the most powerful couple in the US who had great visions for change, equality, respect, dignity and opportunities for women, children and all human beings. I believe their legacy will become historically remembered. I amHappy to have been a witness to their greatness. This book was exceptional and spoke to me in many ways.

reviews: For me, Becoming adds another meaning to the phrase"the grass is greener on the other side." NOT! !!  I have the book a five star rating because I believe that it depicts the true scenario of what being the first black president and first black family in the history of the United States of America was like, not only for Mr. Obama, but specifically for Mrs. Obama and their entire family.  The glamor and the glitz is what one generally sees, what the media and society chooses to focus on.  The behind the scenes anxieties and their impact on the family are rarely highlighted.  The honesty with which Mrs Obama highlights the behind-the-scenes tensions that existed was also refreshing to read.  It makes me wonder why any person of color would want to subject themselves to this type of pressure.  Would we be better off trying to affect change in smaller, more measurable ways.  Will the United States of America ever be ready for a person of color who has visions and principles and a sense of oneness for alk.  I wonder sand I wonder.There was nothing about the book that I did not like.  Reading it felt like anticipating the emergence of a butterfly from it cocoon.  It felt good inspiring for someone like me who has also felt that invisible sense in a room is people who should already know who you are and why you are.  The book is a testament to why education is important; it may not make you a millionaire in that monetary sense of the word, but it could make you a billionaire in many other respects. I would recommend this book to everyone but most assuredly to young black women everywhere.  Becoming is a process that one has to be equipped and prepared for; a process, as we can see by Mrs. Obama's examples, that is never completely done.  WOW!!!

reviews: This book is detailed in many personal moments in Michelle's life. I wanted to read this book to get to know the private struggles Barrack and Michelle went through in achieving something no one has.  This book did exactly that for me. Four stars instead of five only because, in my opinion, Michelle went into too much depth in parts of her life such as the charities she was involved in. Saying this, however, I now understand Michelle is an incredible person and how she became an incredible, influential first lady of our country.

reviews: It is a wondrous truth of this book which helps us to see that we each and all are “becoming “ every moment of our lives.It is also wondrous to have been given such entry into another person’s life; few would allow that let alone one so much in the public eye.This is a story to be read and understood and taken in by men as well as women/girls/children.  It’s a life of learning who one is, the importance of one’s Being, acceptance of Self, and the courage to Be.Would that we each have that “knowing” that allows us to embrace one another as worthy of love and acceptance just as we are, to recognize the innate goodness within us from birth.  Should we accept that truth of Self in each of us, this can truly be a world of Becoming.

reviews: I always knew I like Michelle Obama, now that I have read this book, I like her even more. What a strong, intelligent woman and a wonderful role model. Her journey has really been remarkable. For a woman that has never liked politics, she certainly made the most of her tenure as First Lady; she is a hard act to follow! I loved reading her honest insights about life in the White House, campaigning and raising her daughters in that environment, not to mention her love of her husband and the incredibly strong bond between the two of them.

For a woman that has never liked politics, she certainly made the most of her tenure as First Lady; she is a hard act to follow! I loved reading her honest insights about life in the White House, campaigning and raising her daughters in that environment, not to mention her love of her husband and the incredibly strong bond between the two of them.

reviews: The book was ok.For the positive, it was interesting to get reminded of the important carreer Michelle had before becoming the 1st Lady, it was very impressive.. The chapters about how she met Barack and later relating the start of their married life was fun to read as well as the beginning of their stay at the White House. In some parts I couldn't put the boo down and wanted to know more. I did learned a few things.Negative:A lot of it was as well very boring. Especially as she talked about her youth, even though I understand it was essential to know where she was coming from but, gosh... It was tedious !Regarding the way the book was written... Well if you are looking for great literature, this book isn't for you. I found it badly written, sometimes even hard to read.Even though I know it's her biography it's very self centered and sometimes feels like a self praise book. I did this, I did that, I am great, me this, me that...Lastly, I found her quite resentful all through the book. I get that living in the White House was hard on some level but come on... You don't spit where you eat. Every job comes with downside but it seemed like hers was only that.Conclusion; watch the documentary on Netflix and save yourself the time.

reviews: Marvelously readable. Fully human throughout. Strongly inspirational. A valuable personal story that can connect each of us to our own stories and to each other’s.

reviews: A wonderful read. Michelle Obama is a very good writer and speaker. One feels like she is in the room having a personal conversation with you about her life. I find the book fascinating and have a hard time putting it down. I am really getting a lot out of her discussions of what it was like to grow up black in one of the poorer neighbors in America and what propelled her to achieve all that she has so far.

reviews: As I read this book, I heard the voice of Michelle Obama in my ear. I heard hope, struggle, victory, strength, and at last resignation without cynicism. I read a role model. I read a First Lady’s heart. Thank you.

reviews: Coming from the midwest & just a little older, I connected with a lot of her childhood memories. There are some insights from the campaigns & white house I've never even thought about. I listened mostly during my commute so was able to do a couple chapters per day. It's well written & well read. She also is gracious in giving credit where credit is due, regardless of party affiliation.

reviews: I loved Becoming. It was honest, unapologetic, humorous, thought-provoking and at times a tear-jerker. Michelle Obama speaks through her writing as though you are good friends chatting in the kitchen over a cup of hot tea. I finished this book in two weeks and might have completed it sooner if didn't have so many obligations. Just as you hate leaving a long overdue visit with a good friend, you will not want to put down this book.

reviews: This was an excellent book. It was personal, inspirational, and yet managed to not fall into that trap of being "cheesy and overwrought". Michelle Obama is a treasure, although according to her, she's just a typical girl from the South Side of Chicago. This was a wonderful insight into what it's like being a normal person who gets swept up into the fascinating and often frustrating world of politics because she married a man who "saw his way of giving back to his commmunity" by becoming President. But make no mistake, this is HER story and it's one that needed to be told.

reviews: I have always admired the Obama family, but there was a lot that I didn't know about them. This book was inspiring and very interesting to read about the life of their family. I would definitely recommend.

reviews: Written with heart, humility and honesty.  I wish everyone could read her book, especially those who are against the Obamas.  The values, openness and kindness she was raised with are a window into a world few of us have experienced... more's the pity.  Lastly, the humor... gentle and endearing.

reviews: I loved this Book. It was a frank and respectful insight into who Michelle Obama is, many social issues connected with her life, the reality of experiencing a political campaign, and living at the White House (while trying to maintain personal and family identity and boundaries). Wow! I have a lot of respect for this woman. I really enjoyed looking up events on the internet that she discussed in the book while I was reading it. I especially enjoyed viewing on YOUTUBE the Rap in the car she talked about. So cool. Being able to watch these things as I read about them from her perspective made me feel like I had an inside seat to history happening. Amazing! So glad she shared this with us. Thank you Mrs. Obama.

reviews: Loved this book! Great price for a good quality book. I thought it was well-written, and I enjoyed the many anecdotes and unique lens into the White House. Would highly recommend purchasing and reading.

reviews: I rarely, if ever, write reviews, and definitely not on Amazon, but MY GOD. . .this book is so smartly and beautifullywritten. It, just as my Forever First Lady, is brilliant! I broke out bawling a good three times. Your emotions will run the gamut. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll bask in this galvanizing woman's triumphs and achievements! Michelle Obama's tome was perfected by seeing her, whom I refer to as #TheLastFirstLady, in conversation at the Capital One Arena on her Becoming tour in Washington, DC. The lines flooded out to the streets and traipsed down sidewalks. You will not regret buying or reading this! It was even more impactful hearing Mrs. Obama read HER story in HER actual voice.  It is so very poignant and moving.

reviews: Inspiring, uplifting, most of all, honest. This book changed my heart in ways hard to explain. So many takeaways but the simplest, most basic one will perhaps stay with me longest. It is the profound power of parents. This remarkable woman was shaped and guided by the devotion and fierce advocacy of her parents. She pays that forward in ways large and small. She reminds us that it is the nurturing of children that ultimately changes the world. Thank you for this book.

reviews: Although we think we know the first family, reading Michelle Obama’s memoir,  I learned so much. Michelle Obama obviously set high goals for herself yet meeting Barrack changed her perspective. Achieving was no longer enough, but having a higher purpose took over. It was enlightening to read about life in the White House through the eyes of a person who probably never expected to live there. Her passion for children, their well being, their education is clear. By the time I read the epilogue, I had tears in my eyes. There is much to admire and inspire us.

reviews: I just love Michelle Obama, and her memoir does not disappoint. Her life story is inspiring and interesting, and she writes in a straightforward, honest voice. Getting to hear her side of the story of President Obama's political ascent is refreshing: how she tried to balance work, family and staying true to herself while supporting the husband whose goals and abilities she supports, and protecting her daughters from too much public scrutiny is fascinating. A woman from truly humble roots who never forgets where she came from, and appreciates some of the luck she had that others do not, her story is a must-read for young women making their way in the world.

reviews: There's was a great deal of information in here that if you've paid attention to the Obamas, you already know. That being said, I loved learning about President Obama's rise from Michelle's perspective. She showed that there was a great deal of hard work, sacrifice, and sometimes disappointed through it all. She demonstrated the difficulty in being a career woman who suddenly has to change up her plans and life when her husband reaches one of many pinnacles in his career. She showed us that even though they were POTUS and FLOTUS, they are still human. They had to grow both individually and as a unit to ensure that their family flourished.

reviews: Michelle Obama and her team have managed to do excellent work over the years, lifting up everyone whom they encounter on their journey. Even though the ultimate outcome of that last election resulted in a massive racist, misogynistic backlash, I feel like this telling can help us preserve hope for a future where America relearn to embrace the power of our strength when we celebrate our diversity. Even though the White House took a sharp alt-right turn in 2017, companies that drive our economic engines have learned that our diversity is our strength. Keep hoping and dreaming...we've only just begun to Become the nation of freedom our Founders envisioned over 243 years ago.

reviews: As fascinating, intelligent, and charming our Late First Lady, “Jackie O” was, Michelle Obama is all of these - and more - as she relates the story of her life - as of now - in this very well-crafted autobiography.  What comes through most clearly is her love - for everyone who has touched her life.  And her embrace of her womanhood.  What was a bit of a turn-off were some repetitive grammatical errors, as demonstrated in the previous sentence beginning with “and”.  Most distracting was the frequent use of “me and (whomever)...”  I could have best enjoyed the book had I not been privileged to have a very strict grammarian for a seventh grade English teacher.  But I loved the enthusiasm Michelle Obama, J. D.  expressed for her life throughout its story, and for her unending hope for an even brighter future.  One truly hopes it finds her and all of her excellent family.  This is a book I’d recommend to all women, especially young women; and to all men who want, or already have, a woman as a life partner, and want to find one who is ‘Becoming’ or whom they can support in becoming all that she can possibly be.

reviews: Michelle Obama is an amazing woman and excellent role model. I really enjoyed reading about her childhood and her life and career both before and after she met Barack as well as their courtship, marriage, becoming parents, campaigning, and becoming the first family. Her determination to personally contribute and make a difference as the First Lady is so admirable. I have a great deal of respect for the Obamas and enjoyed a glimpse into their lives.

reviews: I usually don't prefer the genre of autobiographies, but I'd always admired Mrs. Obama and seen a lot of her interviews and appearances on TV as the book was released.The book is selflessly written and very telling as to the early life and upbringing of Mrs. Obama. Seemed very honest and forthcoming, even in some very personal and intimate areas. A very easy read yet worthy of reading again...and again. I truly feel I know and understand the Obama family and those that surrounded them throughout the course of the time frame of this book.I would recommend this book to anyone, regardless of political belief, gender or race. It is truly a telling story and a deep personal revelation of one of this centuries most dynamic women and her background and family.

reviews: Through the first part of this story, I stopped reading, set it aside for other things. And then somewhere along the way, I was hooked. Michelle Obama’s passion for living, her commitment to children and women and her belief in humanity overwhelmed me. I could hardly read the last hundred pages for the tears in my eyes and the connection I felt to her truths. Thank you for sharing your life. Ac a memoirist I know how hard it is to put yourself out there to be judged. But there’s a Higher Purpose that propels the work. And that makes it all the more beautiful.

reviews: This book gives incredible insight into the life of Michelle Robinson Obama. Beginning with a loving family that provided a safe haven in a solid faith  with communication, determination and motivation along with firm foundation, she was able to succeed through education to overcome any obstacle that she perceived would hold her back from achieving her highest goal  as a woman, wife, mother  or First Lady with courage, integrity and character.

reviews: This book was enjoyable from start to finish.  It was well written and so thought provoking.  I'm not at all surprised because Michelle Obama is one of the most intelligent women in our world today.  She and her husband are truly a gift to our country and I am so proud that they were such a wonderful example of class and intelligence.  Our country was well represented by having them as President and First Lady.  It was so hard to put down, and I hope that she will write other books in the near future.  This was truly money and time well spent.

reviews: I have been an avid reader all my life - devouring fiction and nonfiction alike. But rarely have I enjoyed  reading a story so beautifully told as this one. I read it in two days - literally unable to put it down.  I confess I too am a South Sider, growing up about a decade before Michelle - heading to Rainbow Beach in the summer and Bowen High school during the school year from 92nd and Paxton Avenue. This book made me yearn for those Obama years again and along with them, the thoughtful, intelligent, compassionate and caring dynamic duo that lived in the White House for eight years. How desperately we need their wisdom and guidance now! Thank you for this wonderful peek into your world - it offered  a fascinating behind the scenes perspective!

reviews: Our former First Lady was very honest in her recollections.  From the time she was a child until the present, she relates her experiences without directly blaming anyone.  She worked hard to achieve greatness only to realize that what she thought she wanted might not be what she really wants in life.  She now realizes that she is still in the process of becoming her true self.  What an inspiration she is to young women!

reviews: An amazing memoir written by an amazing woman. She is so honest, authentic, observant and sentient anyone has to admire her. Her humility shines through but so do her intellect and determination. I loved this book.

reviews: Every woman should read this book. Michelle’s journey to becoming the most influential and admirable Fist Lady is inspirational. It is a testament to the power of good parenting for the success of every human being, despite adversity, sex, and social status.I listened to the audiobook and bought a copy to gift one of my friends. I will soon introduce it to my 13 year old, hoping it will sharpen her critical thinking and it helps her discover herself and always think big, with a compassionate heart.

reviews: I absolutely loved this book!  It was well written and truthful!  It expressed feelings, good & bad and also revealed things about the writer and her famous family that many may not have been so truthful in sharing.  It showed me that you can be a born without many advantages and work hard to make your life have meaning and be happy.  I recommend this book to anyone who loves to read biographies.

reviews: I have always been a big fan of Michelle Obama, but now after reading her book, I see her as a bright star, offering us hope in this time of unprecedented destruction of our democracy. Her writing is personal and intimate: I felt as if she were sitting across from me, telling her story, as if I were a close friend.I learned much about Obama as father, husband, President. It was very comforting reading about a president who is a gentleman, caring, compassionate, a man of integrity and high moral character. The way a president should be. (Sigh)

reviews: There is a big difference between a good writer, and a good story teller —Although it is easy to love both. A good story teller keeps you intrigued throughout the narration. A good writer makes you delight in every sentence; savor each word. Michelle Obama is both! One minute you are mesmerized by accounts of historically important events, the next minute you travel on her shoes through a crowded store; thinking about how to keep your children covered and warm and rejoicing in finding a pink winter hat, even if a little oversized.

reviews: Michelle Obama shared her personal story of her life as child in Chicago’s South Side, her close family, her support to get a great education and hard work to accomplish her goals. After meeting, then marrying Barak Obama, and helping him win political races in Illinois, living in Chicago. While she was in Chicago, her husband was elected President of the USA as began as First Lady.  It was a major move with two young girls. I was taken by the book, it’s an emotional history of the White House years. I highly recommend reading this superbly written book.

reviews: I so enjoyed Michelle Obama’s story and the way in which she told it.  The author painted a vivid and engaging portrait of a life I couldn’t know, yet one that often felt so familiar.  I enjoyed the glimpses into her thinking, her self-talk, her motivations, her family life—as a daughter, a young professional, a woman in love, a wife and mother.This is a book for someone who enjoys historical biographies. However, Michelle Obama is not a Donald Trump fan and lets readers know that.  I found the occasional references to be honest and civil, but  suspect that some Trump fans may be put off by this—which would be unfortunate. This is a very interesting and inspirational autobiography of a modern American woman. I highly recommend it to all, particularly young women.

reviews: All I can say is that Michelle Obama is a very talented writer with a great story to tell about her journey.  Born into very modest, loving family she really defied the odds against her, graduating from Princeton and Harvard Law and then working in a top Chicago law firm, where she was asked to mentor a young man named Barack Obama.  Their growing love for each other is one of the best parts of this book.  It's just such a pleasure to read because Michelle's voice is heard  in her wonderful use of language.  I highly recommend this book.  You'll really enjoy it.
text: All I can say is that Michelle Obama is a very talented writer with a great story to tell about her journey.  Born into very modest, loving family she really defied the odds against her, graduating from Princeton and Harvard Law and then working in a top Chicago law firm, where she was asked to mentor a young man named Barack Obama.  Their growing love for each other is one of the best parts of this book.  It's just such a pleasure to read because Michelle's voice is heard  in her wonderful use of language.  I highly recommend this book.  You'll really enjoy it.

reviews: Giving the horrible state of affairs in our county under the Trump administration, I reached out for uplifting, optimistic books to relieve my depression over what was happening to our democracy.  Michelle's Obama's book helped me gain a more hopeful perspective.  Her story and their story of what was a perfect administration made me not only relive those wonderful days, but encouraged me to not give up on the promise of our country.  It was a good read especially for this moment,

reviews: I loved the early parts especially of this book about Michelle Obama and her growing up years and her remarkable parents.  This book is very different from what I expected and the way she reveals personal information is unique - it honestly feels like by telling her story, she is trying to help others tell theirs and not feel ashamed of their troubles and failures in life.  I loved it.  Very well-written.  I was a fan before the book and I am an even bigger fan now.

reviews: So refreshing to read about lives spent striving to succeed without a sense of entitlement. Impossible to ignore the stark contrast of intelligence, grace and dignity of the Obama's to the current White House inhabitants.
text: So refreshing to read about lives spent striving to succeed without a sense of entitlement. Impossible to ignore the stark contrast of intelligence, grace and dignity of the Obama's to the current White House inhabitants.

reviews: I love how this book is not a political story, it's an American tale. It's an engaging, down-to-earth look inside the world of transforming from regular people and a regular family to the First Family! Most of us will never know what this life is about, but former FLOTUS Michelle Obama gives you a rare look behind the scenes that has you smiling, laughing and feeling as if you are with them while also sharing  their complex family histories and the whirlwind love story that is hers and former POTUS Barack Obama. This is a must read for the young and old alike!

reviews: The Autobiography of Michelle Obama gave me an insight of her life before, during and after living in the White House. I really was pleased on how she showed that her parents did the Leave it to Beaver scenario, which how many women in the 60's,  did the best to make a home for their family. That is to say it was a simpler time where only one car, and one TV was in a household. Therefore how Michelle chose to be an advocate for less fortunate instead of accepting a high paying job gives you an insight how she was raised with family and community values so of course I was not surprised when she chose a job to help the less fortunate instead of the high paying job she was offered and to me says a lot of a person.

reviews: I just completed reading this book, and I was intrigued. This is the best book I have read in 2018-2019. I read many books, and I am impressed.I now understand the Obama's and their journey to and from the White House. This book is detailed and masterful biography of a fantastic woman. I enjoyed reading such an evolution of words that gave me hope and freedom.I recommend this book to everyone---it will educate you on the trials and tribulations of life. It will also make you smile. This book deserves 20 stars and more.

God Bless America

reviews: My admiration for Michelle Obama and her exemplary grace as First Lady was increased tenfold by her literate and moving account of her journeys from childhood through middle age adulthood.  Her recollections are inspirational and sincerity abounds.  There is no posturing and  there is humility.Her passionate support of education and fitness  and her dedication to family  and treasured friends is noteworthy and the novel is well worth the time it takes to read it.

reviews: I love the book,,, I have read a friend's, so bought one for my mother in law-- it came dented on corner which is just annoying as it is a gift. But I am sure she will love Mrs. Obama-- as we all do.

reviews: Excellent. I loved reading her and Pres. Obama's story from her point of view. I loved hearing how she grew up, how their romance bloomed, how the decision to run any race came to be and everything it took out of them and their family. I loved hearing about their lives in the White House and what it was like. Michelle is much more relatable than I expected and I couldn't read it fast enough.  It seemed almost devined that they should be in the White House at the point that they were, for the way it all had to come together to happen. It's too bad our country can't use the work they did to move forward. Everything wasn't perfect, but it was forward movement. I miss their class, their humor, their realness and their heart.

reviews: This book did something magical for me..it made me think how I can better serve and do more. This book made me smile and laugh and at each milestone get very teary eyed. I don’t know if it’s just me but you can tell Michelle wrote this book, literally reading it i can hear her voice. This book will definitely sit beside Coretta Scott King! I hope this book becomes training aids for classes across the world.

reviews: Whether you agree with her politics or not, you have to really admire Mrs. Michelle Obama for such a poignant portrait of your life, family and philosophy on success.  Her journey shows that we all have it within ourselves to become who we inspire to become if we live by certain principles.  One of the things that really affected me emotionally was how she grew up with doubt about herself and how she was impacted of the hateful, racist things people were saying about her after she became First Lady.

reviews: Just finished listening to Michelle Obama’s “Becoming”. 19 hours in one week. It was revealing and human. I learned so much about the White House. At some points I was like “The Obama’s are #relationshipgoals” and then I’d think “How could he/she stay with her/him?!?” Sometimes she was kind of whiny or boring but that set her up as a foil to Barack. Their relationship is pretty interesting.Mostly I’m left with the feeling that we had it so good with such a devoted eloquent wonk at the helm and what we have now is even more deeply appalling.

reviews: Well written and intense, ’Becoming’ is more than a recounting of political experience.  For me, it seemed as though I was sitting right next to Michelle Obama while she was telling me her own story, from struggling with the requirements of her role as First Lady, caring for her family and the community, and all the while facing often dark sides of political behaviors. Becoming is the story of a woman who has found herself and continues working to improve lives in our country and internationally, all the while remaining true to herself,

reviews: I enjoyed this book of her journey into the person she has become. All of the doubts, lessons as well as how different races, religions and ethnic groups are treated anywhere. How people spread hate as well as friendships.  How she had to show how she has to handle all of these things plus try to be an individual that she wants to be as a woman, mother, daughter, sibling, wife and friend. A lot of her early years were a lot like the  lifestyle I lived. Even though I did not have to go through the racial issues she had to.  I am glad I was able to read her book.

reviews: I loved this book by Michelle Obama.  She really puts herself out there and tells her truth in a courageous and honest way.  Some slower sections, but mostly a good read and very informative.  I think she is the most perfect wife for Barrack Obama, and she has been a wonderful nurturing mother to her girls.  I am a Republican, but I find the story of the Obamas rise to fame very compelling.  They are very upright and good people, of that there is no question.  I am grateful that they are in our world!!  Highly recommended!

reviews: Michelle Obama continues to present as a thoughtful and genuine leader in these perilous times. Becoming gives us some insight into what she was thinking and feeling as her story unfolded - very relatable and not all that different from the way most of us would have reacted.  She gets a GO GIRL from me when she realizes during the inauguration of 45 that she didn't have anything to be smiling about about and being true to herself, and us, she stopped!

reviews: This book has been reviewed by many people. While their opinions matter nothing like reading it for yourself.Having lived through so many of the times recorded in this book and witnessing, this young woman's growth and maturing is awesome.I hope all who read this book, especially women and girls, will see that everyone matters.Thank you Michelle Obama, for all you have done to help others and all that you have yet to do.

reviews: Thank You for this book! Thank you for sharing your life with us and for being a Beautiful, Smart, and Amazing First Lady! Thank you for giving hope to Women all over the world. I love this title because I too agree, we are constantly “Becoming” You are simply amazing! I love your Zeal and Zest as well as your compassion. This book has really inspired me in so many ways and I thank you for the hope and inspiration. I loved how you dealt with all the critics and the love you have for your family and friends is awesome! I would recommend this book to my close friends and family, my mom actually finished this book before me and we could not stop talking about it. You made me laugh you also made me cry. May God continue to Bless you in your journey and thank you because I have a  new motto - I am enough

reviews: I have a better understanding and appreciation of this woman and the President we had before the one we now have.  He couldn't accomplish much due to locking horns with Congress and the Senate but at least he was a very good, clean, moral man who NEVER cost the American people a ton of money with investigations and NEVER embarrassed the American people all over the world.  We have a big mess to clean up now!  Her voice held my attention while she read each chapter and could easily lull me to sleep as I listened to her chapters while I sat in my chair after my afternoon lunch.  Best Audio book I've purchased.

reviews: I am so sad that I have come to the end of this book. I read it very slowly so that I could treasure and taste every section. Michelle Obama’s life so far, is not only interesting but very meaningful and worthwhile to learn from as she goes into the depths of her soul to share who she is, and how she expresses her purposeful being. At times her story is riveting and with perspective, she brings humor and always a graceful kind presence. I have already told eight friends they must read it and there will be many many more.

reviews: Can't remember the last time I read a work of nonfiction that I enjoyed as much.  All that she and her family endured in and out of the political arena. Michelle is truly an inspiration to all of us. I remember watching the inauguration and thinking how much class she was bringing to the White house and to the worlds'  perception of our first family. Endeavor to persevere Michelle.

reviews: I had always admired Mrs. Obama's sense of style and substance as First Lady, but this autobiography gives you an amazing insight into what a tremendous leader she is. Coming from humble beginnings, seeking the best education possible, giving up work for a huge paycheck to produce work that provided her satisfaction. I have a newfound respect for how much she worried about her relationships and her family as her husband entered the most cutthroat political environment possible, and I'm grateful that she was determined as First Lady to develop her own ways to make a meaningful contribution to our country. This is a must read for anyone, but I think it would be especially inspirational for teens and young women! "Yes, you can" resounds throughout this book.

reviews: I’m obsessed. I finished this book in two days. If I loved the Obamas before, after reading this I love them a thousand times over. Michelle is the epitome of class, education, and strength. I genuinely love and respect her so so much. The writting is beautifully done. Entertaining and so interesting to read their story. I joked with my husband saying I feel like I know her better now and I feel as if we were friends. I wish.

reviews: Michelle Obama’s openness, honesty, subtle humor and integrity are knitted together throughout this engaging “read.” Through her rich, descriptive vocabulary, the content flows seamlessly as the story unfolds about the First Lady To-Be’s early life growing up on the south side of Chicago, her academic preparation followed by her professional life, meeting her future husband/44th President To-Be, family and the White House years. Her love of her family/friends/staff and the values that contributed to her very being were beautifully expressed. The appreciation, thoroughness and respect for each project in which the First Lady engaged was detailed. High recommendations for “Becoming.”

reviews: This book is just exactly what I needed as the only woman working in my section in a government department. I was already so inspired by Michelle Obama but now... it feels like I have a friend who really understands what I go through. Reading Mrs Obama’s story has inspired, uplifted and energized me in such an enormous way. Thank you for sharing your story Michelle! And your marriage is serious relationship goals!

reviews: I purchased the book and the audio CD.  Just because at first.  Then it hit me.  Why don't I play the audio CD (Michelle Obama's voice, while reading the book.  So basically having her read HER story to me.  It was an amazing experience.  Not only was I reading her words, but I got to experience her emotions behind the words. It made that much more impactful.  What did I get out of the book.  The sacrifices, the compromises, the fears, the level of criticism, the danger and what never crossed my mind, the GUILT that comes with being POTUS and FLOTUS.  In order for them to just go out to dinner, the publics life was turned upside down.  Streets block, security everywhere.  Everyday people at the same restaurant being patted down before seated, etc.  The President and First Lady had feelings of unease, and guilt about what came with being who they were. Seeing their little girls faces in vehicles behind thick bullet proof glass as they drive off.  Quite a humbling and selfless memoir.  We are so quick to judge.  We have know idea what it really involves.  Not a clue.  Until you read...

I did not want to put it down. I have always loved them and believe that they are truly good people who only want the best for the United States.

reviews: The most intimate and inspiring memoir I’ve read. 5 enthusiastic stars! “For me, becoming is an about arriving somewhere or achieving a certain a.m. I see it instead as forward motion, a means of evolving, a way to reach continuously toward a better self. The journey doesn’t end. I became a mother, but I still have a lot to learn from and give to my children. I became a wife, but I continue to adapt to it be humbled by what it means to truly love and make a life with another person... it’s all a process, stops along a path. Becoming requires equal parts patients and rigor. Becoming is never giving up on the idea that there’s more growing to be done.” ~Michelle Obama #IamBecoming

reviews: What a wonderful memoir! I loved learning about Michelle Obama’s childhood, which in many ways mirrored my own, about her meeting and falling in love with Barack Obama, and their triumphant journey to the White House. I listened to the book as an audible book, so it was wonderful hearing about her life in her own voice. She gave us an insiders view of what it was like to be the First Family, the good, the bad and the ugly and what it was like to be such an important, pivotal part of history. Loved the book and would recommend it to anyone.

reviews: This is a beautiful memoir by a beautiful woman. I only wish that we had the position of “First Lady for life” but I’m sure that Michelle Obama would be horrified. This book should be required reading for every student and adult in this country. As we pass through these most turbulent times, with the Covid-19 pandemic and the realisation that we live in a racialised society with so much prejudice and discrimination, Michelle provides us with hope that we can make a difference. I know that she and President Obama will be in our lives for many years to come and that gives me hope for a better world in our future.

reviews: It is mind boggling the number of opportunities Michelle's parents were able to provide her while growing up in one of the most undesirable places in the country.  Everyone knows south Chicago and it's not a place anyone would willingly choose to grow up in.  I think Michelle's disabled father is the true hero in this story; a person who never owned a home or went to college but was able to put his daughter through Princeton as public utility worker.  I admire Michelle for having the courage to follow her heart and give up a lucrative career to do what she loved.  A truly enjoyable read.
text: It is mind boggling the number of opportunities Michelle's parents were able to provide her while growing up in one of the most undesirable places in the country.  Everyone knows south Chicago and it's not a place anyone would willingly choose to grow up in.  I think Michelle's disabled father is the true hero in this story; a person who never owned a home or went to college but was able to put his daughter through Princeton as public utility worker.  I admire Michelle for having the courage to follow her heart and give up a lucrative career to do what she loved.  A truly enjoyable read.

reviews: Let's give credit where it's due. Becoming is inspiring because it is about an everyday American who happens to be a black woman.  She didnt receive a handout. She worked hard and valued education like we are taught to do and on top of that, became First Lady of the USA. To the haters I say put your stupid politics and biases aside and "try" to be open to "differences." You'll be less miserable.

reviews: Read this is three sittings- and what a great book it is! Loved the writing style and the honesty of Ms. Obama. She lets you know her as she really is, as she was as First Lady. Loved reading about her family history, and her journey through life showing that nothing is handed to you in life- you do have to work for it. Loved that she went for what her passion was/is in life, and so appreciate all that she has done for others with her work. Great mother, great woman! Thank you Michelle Obama, for sharing your life story with us.

reviews: I can’t quite yet put into words how much I enjoyed Becoming. Michelle Obama is relatable, smart, gracious, and most importantly herself. I loved finding all the commonalities between us all...from working mom to wife. While I may not be a former First Lady, I am the daughter of a mama from the South Side. I am a mom, a wife, and a public school teacher. I’ve always admired Michelle for her sense of style, purpose, and fun-loving graciousness. For me, she was Jackie O for the 21st century, and  just like Jackie she left a legacy; one that will be remembered for her authentic self, her commitment to improving the needs she saw around her, and being a mom. My friend Aura used joke that she was an “Obama Mama”, but  that title belongs solely to Michelle, AND the team of folks who supported her 8 years in the spotlight. I am better for having read her story. And I am now quipped with a cool quote to work into next years’s narrative essay assignments. Thanks so much for the story, Michelle. I enjoyed it immensely.

reviews: If you didn’t already respect and admire Michelle Obama, you will after reading this. It feels like she is speaking to you as a friend or confidante.  Her voice sings!  She explains so much that I had never pondered - about growing up non-white and its many ramifications, what it really feels like to live in theWhite House, her fears, delights, aspirations.  A MUST READ!

reviews: Mrs. Obama's honest and inspiring book gives both insight into her life experiences and hope to everyone who reads her story. People of all colors, genders and ages see possibilities to overcome obstacles and become all God has made us to be. Thank you, Mrs. Obama,  for not only being a first class author, but also a classy lady of integrity,  intelligence and sincerity. I highly recommend this wonderful book!

reviews: This book is SO good. I can't put it down. It's a real look inside the mind of one of the world's most recognized women. You go on a true journey with Michelle, experiencing her thoughts on family, career, falling in love, politics, and discovery of self. Whether you're a fan of the Obamas or not, this is a story so many can relate to. Michelle opens up and speaks about losing her father, discovering her purpose, finding balance between her husband's ambition and her own, her deep connection with family, and the sacrifices she made for all of it. Throughout it all, Michelle holds strong to her values and shares her story in a clear, entertaining and touching manner. This has been a lovely read by a woman worthy of the admiration she receives.

reviews: Thank you for sharing your story and taking us through your journey.  I’d never considered all the family experiences getting into and going through political office.  I am very thankful for all the people of various cultures that you helped in your years in the White House.  I hold you in the highest esteem. You are the best First Lady in history. Your genuine caring for the health of Americans and all you accomplished is a wonderful legacy.  I wish I could thank you in person.  God Bless you, President Obama and your daughters for sharing your lives with us and working so hard to make America truly greater than ever.  Much Love and BIG Hugs!

What she, her brother, parents and her husband Barack 's true struggles, visions and hopes were/are not just for themselves but for their daughters and ALL the people of this great country we call home.  From joyous moments to truly, truly heart breaking events, this window into their lives inside the White House was mind boggling yet so very inspirational.  We all must remember to use our voice for GOOD to Become.  Thank you to you and Barack for a "job" well done.  God bless.

reviews: I gave this book a 5-star rating because I like Michelle Obama; but the fact is that the only part of the book that got delivered to my phone was the book cover and the table of contents.  If I go beyond that, I see an icon and a message "Waiting to Load."  I wish I could get the book delivered; but I have tried to figure out how to contact Amazon with this information and have been unable to do so.

reviews: Mrs. Obama and I are very close in age, so I was extra-happy to receive and be able to read this book. It's everything I wanted - feeling as if we are friends and she shared this with me alone (and a few million others, LOL). I learned more about Mrs. Obama through this book and I feel as if I know her better now. She's led an amazing life, raised a beautiful family, and been the primary support for the leader of the Free World. That's a resume any woman can be proud of, and I'm especially proud that I got to watch a lot of it happen. She's inspired me to continue working on MY next act with her current activities, and I love the influence she had. Bravo, Michelle!

reviews: When a beautiful and successful black woman shares her experiences, and you can relate.  That’s what makes me love this book.  One wouldn’t think the Former FLOTUS faced challenges and it’s easy to assume because she went to prestigious schools and had a prestigious career, she was born privileged.  She proved that all false.  She was given opportunities which she took advantage of and excelled.  Such a hero to all young women, black and white and all beautiful races.  We all have the same desires.  Let’s not allow skin color divide us!!!

reviews: Just found out this is the best selling book of 2018 already. It deserves it. I was riveted by it and couldn't put it down.It was so interesting to read about how she came a relatively poor family from the ghetto area of the Southside of Chicago. Her parents sacrificed so she could pursue educational opportunities, and she was very intelligent. This is a modern Horatio Alger story. This is why we need to spend more tax money on education for all children.I would highly recommend this book for all Americans. We can be very proud of this great human being!

reviews: Michelle Obama writes with such open ease, relating her childhood memories, her family interactions, her views on relationships, politics and the future.  One of the things I thought was particularly funny was that she did not want to go to certain little girlfriends' homes because of the way they treated their dolls!  She was very observant of others early on and made her life choices carefully.  I thought I would read the book in small sections but I could not put it down.  A great sense of humor.  Delightful.

reviews: There is not enough space to describe the  many emotions that I am feeling.  After reading President Obama's book about Hope, I knew that he was only person that our Country needed as President and not because he happened to be an African American.  After reading this book so tenderly written by a woman of substance, I seriously doubt that our President could have become as effective as he was without our First Lady by his side.  They were a team of two unique individuals  who brought wonderful changes for positive growth and vision to our nation.

reviews: This is a book with so many messages and ideas for high schoolers, college students, graduates, career planners -- everyone, male and female.  Granted, Michelle Obama is an incredible one-of-a-kind individual, but the book gave me so many ideas and inspirations, I have recommended it to everyone I know.  There aren't many books one reads that stay with you for weeks after, or that make you laugh and cry throughout ... but this one did.  Just an outstanding read ... and even Republicans would get a lot out of it!

reviews: Soaking in Michelle Obama’s memoir was like catching up with an old friend: you can’t wait to hear the news and you aren’t the least bit bored.  I understand now that this couple was more ethical than I thought, smarter than I thought and kinder than I ever knew.  She has made a lasting and indelible mark as the first black First Lady. No naysayer nor hater can ever dislodge her esteemed place in our nation’s history.  Thank you, Mrs Obama for overcoming your hesitations, supporting your husband’s big dreams and for using your platform to bring real change to schools, encourage girls and improve the lives of military spouses. In other words, thank you for being the best.

reviews: This book reads just like Michelle talks. I loved her background stories. She is always modest, personable and optimistic. She is the most direct and unequivocal when speaking about Republican viewpoints and crass behaviors. Like her husband she uses her words, displays enormous patience, and is always aware of how her actions affect others. She exemplifies today’s amazingly talented modern woman.

reviews: Michelle is an excellent story teller and it's one we all needed to hear. There were experiences she taught me about and there were others I could share. I admire her more, appreciate the intricacies of what our first family lived through, and have an even greater respect for their sacrifices. The Obama's are the best example of what our leading family should look like and they were not without errors. Upright, smart, with the responsibility to take care of the entire country. Plus, I love how Michelle was transparent about the ups and downs of their lives.

reviews: I had no idea what it was like to be in the public eye. I am so impressed by Michelle Obama’s successful struggle to protect, build, and preserve her ideals. What lucky girls her daughters are!  I wish every American would take time to read this book.  It is an easy read, very comforting during these Trump days, and certainly has given me hope that the best of America can still prevail.

reviews: I could not stop reading - it felt as if a new friend was revealing herself to me. Obama is so completely honest.She discusses her family's growth mindset, what forces shaped her, how she helped herself and how others helped her.As an adult, she wanted a simple home life where mom and dad come home every day and spend time raising their kids; she never got that. She talks about how hard it is to have a spouse whose #1 priority is something bigger than your family, house, and kids. She admits to sometimes feeling lonely and resentful (but mostly supportive of all the decision she and her family made). She gave up having her husband's time and attention daily so that all Americans could benefit from his mind, ethics, and work.This is a person who pushes herself everyday, in every job she ever had, to work as hard as possible, give it her all, and try to be the best. An excellent role model for all Americans, no matter who you are or what your background is.

Still don't want to accept it,  but I understand.

reviews: "Becoming" is a thorough and interesting account of a woman's life, from the south side of Chicago to a place few make it to: the White House. Michelle Obama's recounting of her life is fascinating, and nostalgic for those of us on the outside looking in during Barack Obama's campaign and presidency. I recommend this title to not only Michelle Obama fans, but history and political wonks interested in the inner workings of the role of a First Lady, and how she juggles family and her own needs in the public, and overly discerning, eye.

reviews: excellent read. very open and sincere. actually funny in spots. MO is a class act. clearly, her class is not bought...she was raised with it. she has fun. lets down her guards and hair and tells it like it is. reading this book made me miss her and President Obama soooo much more than I already do. fast read. written in human speak not all brainy sounding...easy to understand.

reviews: I already knew she's very intelligent and a loving mother, wife, daughter, sister, and friend. I was looking forward to learning more about her day to day life as the First Lady in the White House.  However the book is titled "BECOMING".....so I should have taken that as a clue.  I did enjoy the book very much and after making sure my friends paid more attention to the title than I did I highly recommended it to them. She is an awesome woman.

reviews: Michelle Obama writes about growing up in the South Side of Chicago, meeting and marrying Barack, becoming a mother, and then First Lady of our country. In each part of the book, she examines her interactions with others and , and strives to find her place in that world. She explains the challenges each First Family meets and adjusts to when living in the White House. This was an enjoyable read. Her responses to each situation were  genuine in each instance. In areas where a good sense of humor was indicated, she meets it and laughs right where I would if it happened to me.

reviews: I absolutely loved this book. I took a lot of time reading it, savoring and not wanting it to end. I learned so many things I had never known about Michelle’s beginnings, her education, early years with Barack on to become a Mother and our First Lady. She was and is a very classy woman which I already knew. Alas, I finished the book but also learned that it’s really not over. There is still hope and things I must do too in “Becoming” for the Country and our World. For my children and grandchildren.
