reviews: Enjoyed this book immensely! Most women who were brought up in a city (mine was Philadelphia, PA) in a tiny house and came from hard-working parents will identify with Michelle and her thoughts/feelings. I especially enjoyed the photographs which made her life jump off the pages and her personal insights concerning Barack during their courtship. She's a very empathetic, humble woman with concerns for all humanity and I love this closing note: "For every door that's been opened to me, I've tried to open my door to others." Bravo!

reviews: This book was very easy to read, well written, and provided a fascinating look at what it's like to be a political wife and First Lady of the US.  The book is very candid about Michelle's life, and I was very inspired by learning about her wonderful parents and Michelle's struggles to become the amazing woman she is today.

reviews: I already felt Michelle Obama was a class act, truly grounded and very intelligent.  She was so candid and honest in telling her story, really well written, interesting and I felt connected to so much of what she had to share as a working mom throughout my own career.  That lovely double edged sword we have carry is worth it.  We still have some work to do (women standing up for women) but we are going in the right direction.  Great job!

reviews: I remember laying on the couch in my living room in 2008 waiting on the results for the presidency to come in.  I fell asleep halfway through and woke up to the news that Barack Obama  was elected. The joy and sense of pride I felt as I watched them take the stage that night was indescribable. Not Just because they are African-American, but because of what they stood for. I didn't agree with everything the Obama administration implemented for our country, but overall, I  consider them to be the best administration this country has had. Reading Michelle Obama's journey sparked a new hope that better is possible. Will it be easy? No. But is it possible?  Absolutely.

Reading Michelle Obama's journey sparked a new hope that better is possible. Will it be easy? No. But is it possible?  Absolutely.

reviews: This book was an incredible look at the life and journey of former first lady Michelle Obama. I admittedly went into the book with a biased admiration for her, but the vulnerability and sincerity with which she tells this story was heart warming and encouraging. She discusses her early life and how her humble beginnings on the south side of Chicago shaped her character. She discusses her relationship with President Obama and how their life in politics chose them and not the other way around making for an intriguing and somehow relatable story. She talks about life under the constant scrutiny of the American people and having to navigate an already hostile space as a black woman. I certainly recommend this book for anyone questioning their life path, navigating the complications marriage can bring, or anyone curious about life in the white house.

Her transparency throughout the  book allows readers to feel better connected to her. She expresses her emotions of trying to balance everyday life in addition to life in politics. reviews: Remarkably brave book, honest with every “wart” on display. Once you start to read this autobiography, you will have difficulty putting it down. We all have situations in our past that we would rather not discuss . Michelle cherry-coats nothing to her credit , and let’s us all share in her inner thoughts, attitudes and vulnerabilities. Her honesty rather shocked me. And boy can she write and express her thoughts in an engaging manner. I learned a lot about relationships, life in the White House, and walking in another’s shoes. This book should be required reading for all ages.

reviews: It was wonderful to read this autobiography.  The Obamas are brilliant.  They have four Ivy League degrees between the two of them with Harvard Law degrees to top it off.  It was so plain to see was how articulate they both are, and how they truly cares about people.  They endured all the nasty attacks on their character, and all the falsehoods generated in that same vein but through it all, they remained classy.I really am not one to read (auto)biographies but I felt compelled to read this one.  I was so fortunate to have chosen to do so.  It was also a great trip down memory lane through the national and international events of President Obama's terms in the Oval Office.

reviews: I was already a fan of Michelle and Barack Obama when I picked up this book. The story of how they made it to the White House has made me even a bigger fan.Mrs. Obama grew up on Chicago's southside. Her path was strewn with people who pushed her to do and be her best. She grew up with a sense of duty to others, of needing to give back, and she did in many ways.I don't give 5 stars often. Only to books that I find myself thinking about long after I've reached "The End" and gone on to other books. This definitely fits that description.

reviews: I am probably biased given that I think Michelle Obama is amazing anyway but this book is phenomenal. Michelle is a gifted writer and speaker and I would recommend everyone on any end of the spectrum read her book. It is not hyper-partisan although of course you can see her view point through the words but it doesn't over take the book. She makes it about her and her experiences rather than wasting time on detractors or negativity.

reviews: I liked learning about her life, but thought she would be more fair in how she described politics. reviews: I admire Michelle, but was disappointed by the book. The first third is what I was looking for - an interesting and inspiring story of her life, growth, decisions and professional development. The remainder was interesting from a historical point of view of the twists and turns in the Obama administration, but was focused on Barak's career and clarifying some misconceptions against him and very little content was dedicated to the person I wanted to read about - Michelle herself.

reviews: I led our book club in a discussion of this book. We all enjoyed this amazing story of becoming as well as the glimpse into the White House we had not known before. The values displayed by the Obama’s were strong: when they go low, we go high, and the reality that Black American’s have to work harder to achieve. The concept of swerve as described in the book led us to discuss the swerves in our own lives. Michelle is an amazing woman, whose grace and service to others, especially young women, is inspirational.

reviews: My admiration for the Obama family and administration was already at a five star level before reading this beautiful, important memoir.  Now, after completing its pages, I daily offer prayers for the health and safety of my city’s and our country’s most precious foursome. Michelle Obama’s message of gratitude and optimism will help guide me during this most challenging time of the current presidency, and in my own advancing years.

reviews: From the cover through the credits, this book captivated, resonated, and spoke to me on a down to earth, sitting on the porch or in the kitchen sort of way. Michelle tells her story in a way that is easy to understand, and for me, easy to relate. She’s “matter-of-fact about her personal struggles, achievements, and does not gloss over any of it. She is a classy, intelligent, loving, relatable and very beautiful woman. This book is an inspiration for all, and is the genesis for many more “Becoming ...”.

reviews: Most political memoirs are bad, cliche, and use life experience as a means of getting to a talking point. Fortunately, Michelle Obama's Becoming, much like Barack Obama's Dreams From My Father, avoids these pitfalls. Michelle is a fantastic author who comes across as consistently authentic despite the loaded nature of "authenticity" as a concept and the difficulty of embodying it in a position of mass scrutiny. Strip away the entire second and third sections of the book, which detail the development of her relationship with Barack and her experience as First Lady, and you would still have a beautifully rendered portrait of American life in a working-class neighborhood on the South Side of Chicago that would put many memoirists to shame. Ironically, the least interesting part of this book is her description of her tenure as First Lady, which offers little in the way of political opinions and follows the traditional stylings of the "person whose life has been upended by fame and power" narrative. Luckily, the majority of the book more than makes up for this. Michelle Obama has a gift for humanizing herself and relating to people in a non-superficial way, one that no doubt propelled the political superstardom that came to a zenith in the "They go low, we go high" speech at the 2016 DNC. She makes you believe in fundamental values of civic engagement and kindness without every descending to kitschiness. This trait, shared by the Obamas, doesn't guarantee flawless leadership or decision-making, but it's so, so rare (rarer than we think!) and a precondition for pushing a moral agenda successfully. This book is well constructed, empathetic, and human despite appearing in a genre where humanity is hard to find - I'd recommend it to anyone with any level of interest in politics.

Luckily, the majority of the book more than makes up for this. Michelle Obama has a gift for humanizing herself and relating to people in a non-superficial way, one that no doubt propelled the political superstardom that came to a zenith in the "They go low, we go high" speech at the 2016 DNC. reviews: Michelle Obama is an amazing woman and a gifted storyteller. I was lucky enough to read this book mostly in one sitting while I spent the night with my mother in the hospital. I didn't want to put the book down, and I got to read all night without getting fussed at for not sleeping. Thank you, Michelle Obama, for such a wonderful book--one of the best non-fiction books I have encountered. I recommend it to everyone who believes in hope and goodness.

reviews: This was ab absolutely wonderful read!  Not only does Michelle give an inside picture of the joys and tribulations of being a First Lady, but how also she achieved despite her humble upbringing in Chicago.  Hopefully it serves as a reminder to those of us who take for granted being white and the inherent privileges that accompany that status.  Also, it should also serve as a reminder that people can overcome the color stigma through very hard work.

reviews: Becoming, shows the former first lady coming into her own. She went from a private person into the roll of first lady. She made sure that her girls had a normal life as much as possible. She put others first and now it's her time to shine. She let you in to see how much your life changes when you get in the public eye. She had to go though a lot of things, some good as some not as good. She took the high road, showing grace, compassion, and class.

reviews: Anyone working with children, which my husband and I both did for more than 35 years, will appreciate Michelle's central message:  Help young girls, especially young girls of color, be the best they can be.  Anyone who grew up in the Chicago area will relate to Michelle's descriptions of growing up in Chicago's south side.  This book contains very little that is overtly political.  I found it to be refreshingly honest and humble, and it gives an inside view to life as a family in the White House.

reviews: I bought this book a long time ago and just finally got a chance to read it. It is a beautifully written autobiography. Michelle Obama is relatable, thoughtful, and tells really interesting stories from her life. The printing of the book is disappointing, though. Several of the pages printed so lightly they are unreadable. It's always at a really good part that I turn the page to find a blank or nearly blank page.

reviews: This is one of the best books I have read in a long time. Michelle Obama is an amazing woman. Having grown up on the south side of Chicago, she graduated from Princeton and Harvard and went on to become the first black First Lady of the United States. She is an inspiration for all women. I had not realized how much work she did for children. From planting a garden on the White House lawn to improving the food served in every school she has improved the health of all our children for generations to come.I would highly recommend this book to anyone who is looking to read an inspirational book.

reviews: Especially during this election year, I found the book very informative.  What better read than from a former FLOTUS about life as President and First Lady.  Written well.  You learn about her humble life growing up in Chicago, college years, meeting and falling in love with Barack Obama, his beginnings in politics, his Hawaiian home and African family, and, of course their life in the White House. A must read.  It will restore you with the knowledge that there are respectful politicians!!!

reviews: What an interesting woman.  There was so much I could identify with.  I was raised a poor white child without many opportunities given to me - yet much more than this wonderful woman.  With all the racism and hatred in this country, she managed to succeed to the top.  Her words are so poetic and honest, it was such a pleasure to engross myself in her story.

With all the racism and hatred in this country, she managed to succeed to the top.  Her words are so poetic and honest, it was such a pleasure to engross myself in her story.

reviews: I enjoyed every page from cover to cover. Two problems: 1 - It was over too soon; I couldn't put it down. 2 - I definitely now think she will not run for President although she'd do a great job and I'd vote for her in 2020.I bought it for my mother and she loved it too. <3

reviews: I loved this book. Since the Obamas left office, we have faced such challenges as a nation. We must hold on to all the good that was there in Washington for eight years - the hope and optimism.. Michele is a wonderful writer and a wonderful role model. I heard her speak at the University of Maine and was so very impressed by her passion and sensibilities. Now I’ve read some of how she became the woman she is today and she makes me proud. This book gives me hope. It would be a wonderful addition to every family’s library.

reviews: This book is simply Michelle Obama having a conversation with you in your living room.  She is telling about her life, in her own words.  I could hear her voice as I was reading.She tells about her very humble upbringing, and how her very hard work opened doors for her.  She tells of her meeting Barak Obama and their relationship and his entry into politics.  She tells a  good deal about the White House and the political environment, but not in a political way, rather an observational way.It doesn't matter where you lean, politically.  This is just a good read.

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. It flowed very well and allowed me to learn about both Michelle and Barack 's journey. A great read about 2 resilient, compassionate, inspiring individuals. Highly recommend it.

reviews: Loved the intimate look into hers and the families lives.  Michelle’s interpretation of those life moments made me feel like I was along for the ride.Miss you and POTUS’ leadership and guidance.  Miss your voice on the national stage.  I am looking forward to the Obama Presidential Center and Foundation’s work as our great nation ushers in a new crop of young energetic leaders for our worlds future.

reviews: This book was written so well I could hear Michelle Obama's voice.  I have always thought of her as one of the Amazing First Ladies, but in this book she allowed people to see the person she is.  She was so transparent I was surprised and once again marveled that this country of our had been so lucky.  If you want to hear where she came from and what it cost her to land in the White House; buy this book.

reviews: I cherished this book as if it were gold and could keep the Obama's close for just a bit longer.  I read it slow savoring every chapter. I laughed and I cried and didn't want it to end.  Thank you so much for sharing your journey thus far with us. l will always be grateful for the best 8 years of  political achievement with dollops of humor I've ever had.

reviews: I have been a Michelle Obama fan since the first time I heard her speak on the campaign trail when Barack was running the for President the first time. However, after reading this book, I have learned firsthand what it means to be a black woman. No matter how educated you are or what your station in life is (is there any higher than FLOTUS) if you're black, you are still a second class citizen.I want to become like Michelle Obama by giving up my biases,  listening to others, and looking for our likenesses rather than our differences.

reviews: I highly recommend this book. Michelle Obama is an amazing woman with an amazing a true life story to tell. Her accomplishments while First Lady are amazing. She is truly a role model to all the young ladies of the world. What a better world we  can aspire to because of her efforts.

reviews: Many people have hopes to Become. Some begin their quest on a level playing field. Others must first climb over too many barricades to reach that field. But those who finally do, exhibit a strength of spirit and inner determination that shines a lighted path for those who may follow. Michelle Obama is a star whose light will shine the way for so many others who are trying to imagine and follow their dreams. Mrs. Obama, you have reached way beyond whatever you dreamed of becoming, and our nation and history will always be grateful.

reviews: This was the most insightful, inspirational, heartwarming book I have read in a long time.  I chose to read this book because I wanted to read  first hand Mrs. Obama's accounts of her years in the White House. How she was able to maintain so much grace under all the extraordinary pressure she was under. I loved how she walked us  through all the experiences of her life; the good as well as the unpleasant. I would recommend this book to all  people, so they can learn the process of what it took for our "Forever First Lady" to "Become".

reviews: I miss Michelle so much. Her grace, intelligence, passion and love are second to none. I devoured this book, laughing at parts, getting angry, weeping and smiling. I bought the Audible version, which was so awesome because Michelle narrates it! I felt like Ms. Obama was just sitting having a conversation with me while I was driving.  After the Audible finished, I purchased a hard copy--just had to have both!

reviews: I found this book to be very enjoyable. Michelle Obama comes across very relatable, honest, and authentic. I enjoyed her story from her childhood in Chicago to the White House. Her relationships with the people close to her are obviously precious to her, especially her family. She tells of her journey and relationships with touching candor and humor. Nice insight into the former President and their relationship as well. I smiled a lot reading this book and felt her pain as well. Great insight into what it was like raising a family in the White House. I have always been a fan and am more so now.

reviews: The memoir was a wonderful read.  Michelle spoke about her life with what felt like grace and honesty.  She spoke about her early years growing up on the south side of Chicago, her career path, her relationship with President Obama, and how she stayed grounded while moving along the political path with him.  I'd recommend this book to anyone who likes to read about other people, but this book is historic!!

reviews: I am enjoying this book, not quite finished. Not too many autobiographies that I have read compares to this one. I have to add  Michelle Obama to the # 1 spot of women I would like to meet, after Queen Elizabeth II.She inspires you to think of others and to put yourself in their shoes before you judge them.Both my sisters are reading Becoming and cannot praise it enough.GREAT book!!!

reviews: This is one of my favorite autobiographical reads. While reading I'd pull up YouTube's and articles about the events she speaks about. It's fascinating to look back on the pivotal campaign speeches and media frenzies. I hadn't realized that I'd missed so much of the Obama Campaign and term in office. I loved her honesty, and came away with a deep respect for her integrity and generosity. What a life! I look forward to following what's yet to come. Thank you, Michelle, for writing this book.

reviews: This was the best book I have read in over a year. I keep thinking I should be able to pick it up and the story will continue... Mrs. Obama is an incredible inspiration to every woman. I was thrilled to watch her and her family as they stood beside President Obama as he took his oath of office - twice! I appreciate the time she gave us as the first lady of our country and I know we are in a better place for her courage and resilience.  I hope she continues to do her good work and inspires other girls and women to a life well lead.

reviews: Although I lived in the Chicagoland area, I really didn't know that much about our former First Lady.  Although I read most of my books on a Kindle, am really enjoying reading this book.  Being a Mother, a Politician's wife, and having your own career is a difficult combination to manage -- but my hat's off to her for the job she did.  I'm not a Republican or a Democrat -- and am enjoying reading this book.

reviews: Actually, Michelle Obama and I had very similar childhoods.  I was surrounded by loving family among Jewish Americans.  My life has also turned out much better than I could have expected.  One variable was that my mother expected me to work after high school to help send my 4 brothers to  college.  I was stubborn and worked my way through college.I am impressed how Michelle has always supported and mentored women socially and professionally.  Her values are solid

reviews: Highly recommend this book. I truly believe anyone who had a negative view of Michelle Obama will definitely change their mind about her. She is definitely a person who deserves respect and admiration for putting a positive spin on everything that came her way. She is an asset to our country and I’m so glad I read her book. I never doubted her love of God, family and country. Shame on all of you who do.

reviews: I enjoyed every sentence, paragraph and page of the book. Mrs Obama touched my heart in many, many ways.  I grew up in Chicago so I was able to really relate to the logistical reflections. When she came to the part where her Father passed, I shed tears for he was such a strong character as is her Mother. May God Always Bless her and President Barack and Sasha and Malia and her Mother forever plus One Day!

reviews: Let me preface this by saying I love Michelle Obama. She is such a great role model. With that being said I read many books by "non-writers" and they are usually just okay. This book is definitely written by an author. She captures your attention and keeps you interested. There is so much compassion yet truthfulness in how she feels, both positive and negative. She continues to be relatable to everyone through her writing and holds up hope for something more.

reviews: This memoir offers an intimate portrait of a woman, both real and iconic, along with a rare behind-the-scenes view of life in the white house. More than that, it is inspiring and uplifting, piercing through today’s darkness and cynicism with a brilliant ray of hope.
text: This memoir offers an intimate portrait of a woman, both real and iconic, along with a rare behind-the-scenes view of life in the white house. More than that, it is inspiring and uplifting, piercing through today’s darkness and cynicism with a brilliant ray of hope.

reviews: An engaging storytelling that explores the  personal transformation of a seemingly ordinary woman to a bonafide global figure.  Her story has strokes of universality as she unfolds the economic struggles of a family, the sorrow of illness & death, the intricacies of courtship, marriage & motherhood, the power of education, the shame of institutional racism and the kabuki of politics. With a combination of intellect and emotion, reflection and vision, humility and boldness, she has attempted to get the most out of her personal challenges and opportunities. Truly inspirational and aspirational!

reviews: I went through a time in my life when the only type of book I enjoyed reading was the Memoir. As a writer in many forms over the years, I find reading someone's to always be fascinating and important, no matter what their history.This is one of the finest memoirs that I have read in many years. I say that because of where we stand in this country today.I have people close to me who could not read and respect Michelle Obama's truth. They would spin over the political comments and history she touts. But, I noted that I was 2/3 of the way done with this book when I read the first anti-Republican remark that jumped out at me.But, by  that point, I had read so much of Michelle's voice that I connected with, that I felt I was learning a new perspective from some a whole lot like myself, despite our vastly different upbringings.She talks often about her hope for our young people and a new country built on tolerance, Grace and respect for differences. But I see a younger generation of kids who are quick to group think and shame. I think it will be up to my generation to continue to teach and reach for a more tolerant and loving tone.I don't know how much help Obama had in writing her memoir. She credits a great many editors at the end. I probably highlighted 10 different places where the words really spoke to me with such Grace. And, a part of me is OK with the thought of a group of all types of folks working together to create something that has the potential to change minds.  I think that is really the point of her writings.

I say that because of where we stand in this country today.I have people close to me who could not read and respect Michelle Obama's truth. They would spin over the political comments and history she touts. But, I noted that I was 2/3 of the way done with this book when I read the first anti-Republican remark that jumped out at me.But, by  that point, I had read so much of Michelle's voice that I connected with, that I felt I was learning a new perspective from some a whole lot like myself, despite our vastly different upbringings.She talks often about her hope for our young people and a new country built on tolerance, Grace and respect for differences. But I see a younger generation of kids who are quick to group think and shame. I think it will be up to my generation to continue to teach and reach for a more tolerant and loving tone.I don't know how much help Obama had in writing her memoir. She credits a great many editors at the end. I probably highlighted 10 different places where the words really spoke to me with such Grace. And, a part of me is OK with the thought of a group of all types of folks working together to create something that has the potential to change minds.  I think that is really the point of her writings.

reviews: From “The swerve,” to, “When they go low, we go high,” this book and the writer leave much to ponder and process.  I am glad that Mrs. Obama did not use the pages to settle scores or dish inside scoop.  Her background and accomplishments are laid out and defined for all to appreciate.  Her beautiful words are a salve for the abrasive times we live in now.  Reading the book went by too quickly and left me hungry for what is yet to come.

reviews: I loved every page of this book and to know she is just like me forever she will be my First  Lady Michelle Obama🤗🤗🤗

reviews: Having just finished it, I looked at the Amazon reviews by others and was astonished at many of the negative comments.  Percentage-wise, they are few, but still astonishing.  Clearly most of them come from people who would never approve of Michelle Obama or the wonderful job she did as First Lady.  Much of this is may be attributable to their negative feelings about her husband, a President that continues to stand out for his leadership, dedication and civility throughout his two terms.Michelle Obama was a star, and she made us proud every day for eight years.  Her early life was inspirational, and her years in the White House continue to make me proud.I would give anything to have Barak and Michelle Obama (and their girls) back in the White House today.  I can only hope that their successor is gone before he completely ruins our country and the world!

reviews: This book is amazing.  Michelle Obama did a wonderful job of telling her life story.  I did not know her background or where she was from.  She is such a warm authentic person.  I highly recommend her book.  You will learn a lot about her and her family.  You will also learn a lot about what it is like to live in the White House as a member of the presidential family.  I love that her mother stayed with them the entire 8 years to support them.  I respected her and her husband before reading this book, and now I respect them even more.

reviews: With most biographies of famouse people I tend to get bored with a long and drawn out childhood story but, the way in which Michelle wrote her book, as well as her complex story truly, drew me in. So many times the Black childhood experience is portrayed as negative or almost as unattainably perfect. Her story sounds like my story. SImple, with progressive parents who weren't lackadaisical in their parenting, who taught values and hard work but not so overly strict. Her choices in career and career changes spoke to me of how restless we can be. Her strength and independence shined through her words even as she says she felt treated as a missus.She gave us such a clear view of what happened during those inspiring times and it instantly made memories flood back in of hope, real hope. She layed out her struggles in both fertility and marriage, how she dealt with such extreme critics and even her stumbles on and off the trail. I simply adore this book.

reviews: Michelle Obama is a truly gifted writer. I wish that this book could be required reading for all high school students. If we put our political affiliations and color barriers aside, you will understand that this is a beautiful story of evolving, showing kindness, and leading by example. There are very few books that I read that I do not want to end. It was my privilege to have read such a poignant memoir.

reviews: I love this book. It reads much more like a novel than a memoir. It's into in a way that I never expected. She's brutally honest and warmly heartbreaking. To say I miss the Obama's is a political choice of mine. But, to say that I miss the respect, the dignity that both she and President Obama, should at this point be glaringly apparent! She is ACCOMPLISHED!

reviews: Through this inspiring memoir that starts slow and then picks up pace, Michelle Obama takes us through her remarkable journey to becoming the trailblazer that she is. She opens doors of imagination in the readers’ minds about what they could become by appealing to their optimism, belief in the American dream, passion in their goals, hardwork, trust in society and more than anything else, their compassion and empathy to people from all races and backgrounds. In a day and age that is ever more polarized, and where the differences between red and blue, white and black, left and right are hard to shake, this book is ever-more relevant to remind us that it is all different shades that make a rainbow!

reviews: As a military wife, I was disappointed with the false information presented in this book about how long Obama was pro military. During his presidency he chose to take away bonuses given to military service men and women $10,000. Michelle talks about how she would visit soldiers in the hospital. I’m sure her heart was in the right place, but actions speak louder than words. When my husband was stationed in Kuwait, he experienced severe military cuts. His job was to repair Chinooks. The military was so low on supplies due to president Obama's military cuts that out of the entire flight of helicopters only one was in working condition.

During his presidency he chose to take away bonuses given to military service men and women $10,000. Michelle talks about how she would visit soldiers in the hospital. I’m sure her heart was in the right place, but actions speak louder than words. When my husband was stationed in Kuwait, he experienced severe military cuts. His job was to repair Chinooks. The military was so low on supplies due to president Obama's military cuts that out of the entire flight of helicopters only one was in working condition.

reviews: Overall, this is a GREAT book (but unfortunately, I had to purchase it from a local store after ordering the book here). When I received the book, several of the pages were faded. As I continued reading, the pages eventually were completely blank! I don't understand how this was not caught before being shipped. Very dissatisfied. The book itself is great!

reviews: I enjoyed reading this.  As a fellow mom and woman I found much of the book relatable and heartwarming.  The inside look at life as First Lady was compelling and also enlightening.  I have no interest in politics and found Mrs Obama’s book to be an enjoyable read really because it does not focus on politics but rather the need for all humans to work together in order to better our world.  Great positive read!

reviews: This book lifted my heart and reminded me that only three years ago our government was led by people whose hearts were filled with love, compassion and a desire for our Democracy to offer the best it has to all it’s citizens, red and blue.  There is only a whisper of acknowledgement of the negative pressure Barak experienced from the Republican Congress. Instead it focuses on the accomplishments of both their lives, before and during his Presidency.  It is the story of her life but is really inseparable from his. The story shows a path to success for people who are denied privilege. I loved it.

reviews: More than hope..a journey, honest, eloquent and realistic. Michelle shared her life, her struggles and how she sometimes painfully overcame them. Sometimes she just endured. It’s a life struggle that any woman can identify with..the art of becoming gracefully. Who better than Michelle to emulate. A roadmap to self inventory and discovery.

reviews: Michelle Obama is a terrific writer. Her memoir is engaging, enthralling, informative and important. At times she educates, amuses, saddens and uplifts the reader. There were times that I LOLd and at other times I had tears in my eyes. Truth be told, I'm a long-time Michelle admirer (Barack, too) and this book only increased my admiration. But, as much as I would love to meet her and her husband, the person in the book whom I would most like to spend time with is her mother Marian Robinson. She paints a glowing and lovely portrait of the family matriarch, a woman who come across as smart, wise, kind, patient and endowed with something we could all use a lot more of - good old common sense. This book is high on my list of best works of non-fiction of all time.

It will inspire and connect you to our first Africa American family in the white house. I am proud of her hoselty and love for us all.

reviews: I highly recommend this book to everyone ,especially my women friends !!!  What an inspiration she is and what a perfect model of a First Lady.  She is so real in letting us know what kind of person she is and how she grew in maturity and wisdom.  God bless her family. Especially her mother Miriam , her dad Fraser and brother Craig.  She was blessed and destined to meet Barack and marry him. What a great couple they are and good parents as well !  May they continue to inspire Americans to get involved and serve others .

reviews: I appreciated how Michelle Obama was unapologetic about what it means to be a black woman in America. At the same time she doesn’t deny the uniqueness of people different from her.  Overall, the book is insightful, humble, and well-written.

reviews: I'm grateful that Michelle Obama had shared her life story with us. I originally bought the audiobook but returned it to get the hardcover so I could read it at my own pace and mark some of the pages for review. She writes in a super relatable way and connects with anyone that has ever wanted more, loved family, ached making tough decisions, or looked back with both joy and sadness. I read it a few months ago and glad I have it in my living room to remind me of my strength.

reviews: When I read her book, I was seriously doubting my job with similar reasons she had while at Sidley Austin.  Her book unexpectedly helped me revisit my own career and what I really wanted to do with my life.Overall, I have so much respect and admiration for Michelle Obama for her incredible strength and courage.  It would be fantastic if all little girls in the world had an opportunity to learn how to become a strong and confident girl from a children's version of this book.  There are many core teaching elements in her book.

reviews: It was so delightful to find out how Michelle Obama really is. I admire all that she has become and how she grew as her life progressed. She is such a giving and sincere woman and really cares about people and their problems. She and her family represent a model for all people in government. Her commitment to honesty and trying her best to do for her family and the nation is so impressive.

reviews: So pleased I got Audible version. Car trips are great. Like having Michelle Obama in the back seat sharing her life story. I wanted various family members to have a chance to hear Ms Obama's book so start it again every time someone new needs a ride over the holidays. I've heard it though 3 times so far. Wonderful chance to understand behind the scenes details of a special person living a good life.

reviews: This is a beautifully written interesting book.  I read it as part of one of my book reading groups.  I couldn't wait around for the large print book to become available to me through my library system so even though I really can't afford it, I purchased the book for my Kindle.  I kind of love my Kindle by the way because I can make the font size whatever I want!  Read the book.  Bring intelligence and love back into your life. :)

reviews: I was really loving this book until I got to pages 52-53 which were virtually blank. I could barely make out the printing on the outside edges and tried to get the gist. An anomaly I thought, until I reached pages 60-61. Then I thumbed ahead and discovered 84-85 and 92-93 are also blank. I think that’s all but it’s enough that now I plan to exchange the book. I’m hoping Amazon will do it although it’s been more than 30 days. If not, then a book store should be able to exchange it. I’m very disappointed. It’s a fantastic read!

reviews: This was a captivating book, detailing growing up on the South Side of Chicago to a very poor family that hung together through thick and thin.  Amazing that Michelle grew up in that environment, with loving and caring parents, and emerged such a powerful figure.  She added so much to humanity and is to be congratulated for it!  Her years as the First Lady were incredible and she raised two young girls all the while.  I wasn't aware of the demands made on a first lady and this really opened my eyes.

reviews: I liked the way this book was written . I found it inspiring to hear of Michelle came to be the woman that she is. Reveals where her earnestness , honesty and strong leadership came from! Also enjoyed and learned from her perspectives on family and marriage.Loved the optimism she expressed all throughout the book and especially at the end. Giving me reason for optimism even in these divided times .

reviews: I loved everything about this book. Michelle Obama not only gives us a glimpse into her childhood upbringing, personal life with Barack and what it was like for her during the First Lady years, but there is also a very thoughtful and thought provoking thread throughout the book about the black experience in Chicago and the nation in general. I didn't want to put this very readable book down and look forward to one day reading more from this very remarkable and down to earth woman whom I believe is a national treasure.

Michelle Obama not only gives us a glimpse into her childhood upbringing, personal life with Barack and what it was like for her during the First Lady years, but there is also a very thoughtful and thought provoking thread throughout the book about the black experience in Chicago and the nation in general. I didn't want to put this very readable book down and look forward to one day reading more from this very remarkable and down to earth woman whom I believe is a national treasure.

reviews: Heavy on the self-hagiography.  The earlier chapters about family members and their hardships in Chicago were illuminating and real. Mostly though,this becomes a book about a woman determinedly unaware of the privileges that broke her way, and unable to lay blame for anything, even her few blunders, on anything but race.  This subterranean animus and the Michelle is always right theme became  tiresome and predictable.  Loved her mother and especially her father.

Becoming a woman, regardless of color of ones skin. Level of education, nationalities, is a process.I thank this graceful lady for sharing with me her personal transformation.  Allowing me to be able to identify through hers the man

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book.  It was so well written, I could almost hear Michelle's voice saying the words as I read them. It felt very intimate, as if we were best friends and she was telling me her story.It also made me realize how very much I miss her and her amazing husband. (there was a lot of sighing and crying on my part because of this)  I am more of a fiction reader, mainly because reality sucks, but I was so captivated by her story it was a very easy read.  Thank you for sharing your story.

reviews: Honest, forthright autobiography of an inspiring, self made woman. Raised in a modest neighborhood, with a focus on education and support of family, Michelle took advantage of all avenues of the schools she attended. Rooted with the support of her mother, always making sure her daughter’s classroom met her scholastic challenges and a disabled, hardworking father, Michelle Robinson Obama continues to “give back” to her community as well as our nation.Well written and heartwarming story of a great woman.

reviews: Unlike many celebrity memoirs, Michelle Obama's book is well-written with lively prose and an authentic voice. I did not expect a "tell-all" and would have been disappointed to find one. What I discovered is an author who convinced me that her story was true to her nature from the very first page. I greatly admired both of the Obamas before I began reading this informative book, and admired them even more at its conclusion. If I had to select a favorite aspect of this lovely memoir it would be Mrs. Obama's honest and loving rendition of her mother, who continues to play a key role in her the Obamas' lives.

reviews: I chose this book because of the First Black Lady that resided in the White House. Michelle Obama's story touched me in many area. It was written in a manner that made it clear, concise, interesting, and relative. Being a Black woman I could relate to some of the emotions she experienced. I recommend this book to all young Black women. It's a wonderful source of encouragement.

reviews: I loved this book so much I’ve been buying it for my loved ones! Michelle is so easy to relate to even though her experience has been so different than my own. Hearing her story has just made me love her even more because her drive, determination, agency as a professional, and ability to stand up for herself and ask for what she needs is so inspiring! I feel like everyone NEEDS to read this book—it’s that good!

reviews: Now we can read the back story of michelle beginning in Chicago through present day. This is an American story shared to tell the real life of Michelle Obama on her journey to become a great leader as well as First Lady to Barack.  It’s s great read!

reviews: She is an inspiring powerful strong woman who has lived through tough times and has always come through with grace resilience and lessons. Lessons that she has used to help and encourage others. Never forget to where she has come from and giving back. She saw in her husband his greatness and set aside her personal warnings to support him as well as keep him on track and on time. No First Lady will ever shine like Michelle through so much adversity. Becoming is a must read for all!

You experience every part of Michelle's life, what she learned and felt every step of of the way.  This country was lucky to have been led by the Obamas for 8 years.  Barack Obama is a truly lucky man to have Michelle as his partner.

reviews: I thought this was a very honest and forthright portrayal of the life of Michelle Obama, before she was the celebrity we know today. It was the story of a real person living a real life with all the fears and doubts we all experience. It is well written, and interesting. I've always thought I would like to know her personally, and this book assured me of that.  Thanks Michelle!

reviews: Michelle Obama is truly a person to admire for her strength, tenacity and graciousness. This is one of the most inspiring books I have ever read. What a beautiful and fine individual she is, always expressing her honest perspectives with a guiding loving purpose. It is an honor to have had her as a First Lady of the White House along with her amazing husband as president.

reviews: I think that this book should be required reading for all high school students.  It gave the reader hope that if they work hard enough, they can set goals and meet them.  Hard work and care for others pays off.  It is not a strictly political book.It is a lesson in virtuosity.

reviews: I've admired and adored Michelle Obama for a long time, and after reading this book, I admire and adore her even more. We are roughly the same age so I wish I had known her when we were kids... but, I was a white kid in the south, and she was a black kid in Chicago, so I guess the chances we'd ever meet were about zero. Still, some of the similarities between her upbringing and mine surprised me and made me smile (and before anyone comments on that, the surprise is because she was in such an urban area, and I was on a farm.)

It will conquer your heart and mind forever. Unforgettable.onyspin

reviews: I appreciate the simplicity of this book. It’s a straightforward glimpse of a woman growing up and raising a family with some unique challenges.  It had never occurred to me that the First Lady had a choice in who she could be, only that there were expectations of who she should be.This book also seeded many more wonderings about the state of our great nation and human nature. Thank you for the new perspective and reminder that we live in a world where there are good people doing good things in spite of the challenges that come along.

reviews: Love, love, love, love this book. It is so inspiring, so I definitely gave it as Christmas gifts to all my friends. I just love how connected I felt to Michelle while reading her life story is so relatable. My daughter is now reading and we both are so in live with this Obama's love abd life story.  I have gone on to watch all the interviews Mrs Obama has done during her life of "Becoming Michelle Obama ".

reviews: This book was an incredible read, right from the beginning.  I devoured it, loved it, cried at least three times, and marveled at her grace, style and honesty.Sadly, however, as I came to the last page,  I couldn't help but reflect on how far America has gone in a totally opposite and wrong direction since the book was written.Here's hoping for better times ahead...

I'm really enjoying reading this book, when I grow up, I would love to be like her, I truly admire this lady, she is funny, classy and super intelligent, she is her own person and one of the BEST First Ladies we have had!

reviews: This is an amazing book! I loved the true meaning of this book. Its filled with so many fascinating interesting facts about the Obamas. I learned so much about who they truly are through reading this book. I learned so much about Barack Obama and Michelle Obama.  This book is compacted with so many wonderful quotes and heart warming story. I loved reading the part where Michelle described how Barack (Husband) proposed to her. I love reading the story of both Barack and Michelles childhood. I was so happy to read about Sasha and Malia Obama(Michelle and Barack Obama two daughters) they to had a crazy childhood- since their father was the President Of The United States.I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS BOOK TO ANYONE WHO LOVES THE OBAMAS AND WANT TO TAKE A SNEAK PEAK INTO THE LIFE THEY LIVED FOR 8 YEARS IN THE WHITE HOUSE.

reviews: I really enjoyed reading this book. Her insight and honesty relayed in her writing  was outstanding. She was able to help us understand the drive President Obama had to try to make the world a better place. Without her taking on the mundane day to day tasks of their family he would not have been able to achieve what he did. Even with that, she was able to contribute her own goals to this country and worldwide. She is truly a national treasure.

reviews: This is a beautiful, well-written memoir and I loved it so much I didn't want to finish it!  I wanted it to go on and on!  What a lovely, classy lady Michele Obama is!  I could relate to her hardships and her positive parental influence.  Loved the book and recommending and giving it to friends and family.

reviews: If you're looking for some political dirt, go elsewhere.  This is a book about a real family and how politics takes over your life.  The book is also about the struggle to hold onto values when it would be much easier to give in.  It is well written and easy to read.  Being from Chicago, I could relate to all the Chicago references.  My thanks to the Obama family for their commitment and sacrifice.

reviews: I am a 70 year old white woman living in Washington state.  I grew up here, a high school class of 900 white kids. I spent 9 months in Arkansas in 1968 & was appalled as I witnessed white teenagers throwing garbage at black teenagers. Now I have a handful of so called Trump lovers who have actually said to me "she made those school kids eat food they hated"!!!!Hello????Who is watering your garden Michelle? Is the soil rancid from hatred spewing from the  front door? Did someone build a wall  covered in barbed wire  around your garden? This book tells a huge story of love for family, young girls in need of mentors, military families looking for hope & trust from our government, God forbid. We're sorry you left the White House. The greatest #1 bucket list for me would be you knocking on my door just to say hi & maybe a glass of wine!

reviews: I like that the story is an honest account of how one person is constantly trying to become a better version of herself.  Michelle is not afraid to share her journey as an American; what it means to be a part of a country that is still struggling to define itself.  Are we a country of immigrants or are we  a nation only for those who are white?  This is a key question for everyone to answer and reconcile with.  America is a multicultural and multi-ethnic nation and we we should embrace it as our strength.  Just as a person is constantly changing as he/she comes into contact and interact with others, a nation must seek its identify and embrace the changes that it goes through to become something better.  The sum of all the parts is greater than any individual.  This is the message of the book and it is told in a graceful and entertaining read.  I recommend this book for those who seek to learn more about himself or herself and seek to understand more about the journey that our country is going through.  We are all on a quest to becoming.

reviews: I've always loved Michelle Obama.  This was so worth the purchase, I bought Digital copy and a hard copy to add to my collection.  Our first lady is the epitome of grace and elegance. I felt this read was genuine, honest, loving and touched me in many different ways.  I won't give away too much because there is so much I loved about this read.  I loved, loved, loved when she spoke of her husband the 44th and how they first met.  A must have for any book collector.

reviews: I am constantly amazed how one person can ascend the ladder in America.  I grew up sandwiched between the south side of Chicago and Gary, IN. I have seen both sides of the coin - underserved and privileged. The trappings, limitations, struggle, triumphs of both. Ms. Obama eloquently describes the divide. Society is shaped by strong women such as these, we should learn from them in the hope of shaping a brighter tomorrow.

reviews: Yes, you can actually hear Michelle's voice in your head as you read her book. It's lively, spell-bounding, and makes you want to laugh one moment and cry the next. Spoiler alert: have Kleenex handy for Chapter 11.Mrs. Obama: if you ever read reviews, I want to say THANK YOU for everything you've done even before entering the White House. You are the perfect role model for all children (boys as well as girls) and you brought class and dignity back to the White House.

reviews: There is nothing I could possibly write in this review that hasn't already been said. I read and also got to listen to the audio book with Mrs. Obama narrating her story. It is every bit as inspiring as she has been. There are moments when I laughed aloud and other moments where I was brought to tears. I hold this woman in an even higher regard and I am glad my daughter gets to witness such a public person. She is very relatable beyond her blackness. I would highly recommend.

reviews: I loved this book. It’s beautifully written, inspiring and genuine. Mrs Obama opens up about her feelings and her life much more than I expected in a very honest and down-to-earth way.  Anyone wishing to know more about this woman and her family will really enjoy this book.  I’m betting those who have written dismissive and disparaging reviews here have not actually read it, don’t like her and her husband for political reasons and are just being nasty.  Ignore them.  When they go low, we go high.

reviews: I loved this book. It reminds us that there are good and smart and honest ways of being.  It brings to mind some degree of hope that our nation can be governed in a honorable fashionIt was a good read, a look into the workings of the highest office in our nation.  The Obamas join a presidential family group that include the Truman’s, the Lincoln’s and the Franklin Roosevelt’s that made us look better than we think we are (among others that I have omitted).

reviews: We love listening to Michelle Obama tell the tale of her childhood, meeting Barack, becoming a lawyer and moving beyond that 'gotta win' place. She's got a great story telling voice too.
text: We love listening to Michelle Obama tell the tale of her childhood, meeting Barack, becoming a lawyer and moving beyond that 'gotta win' place. She's got a great story telling voice too.

reviews: Whether you like Michelle Obama or hate her, this book will give you insight into her character and behavior. From her childhood in Chicago through her work as a lawyer and then into politics as she helped her husband, the path is fascinating and eye-opening. It is beautifully written as well as revealing and more than worth the time and effort to read it. Highly recommended.

It is beautifully written as well as revealing and more than worth the time and effort to read it. Highly recommended.

reviews: To say I had a hard time putting this book down, would be an understatement. I wanted nothing more than to take an entire day to dive into each and every page, soaking up all that I could about our former first lady. At a time when grace and dignity are clearly lacking in the white house, I found myself longing for what was and hopeful for what could be again. Michelle Obama illustrates her struggles as a black woman from a neighborhood that was turning toward despair. I can never begin to understand what it feels like to be a woman of color, nor will I pretend too. But I do know what it feels like to be a woman in a world where people tell you you're not good enough, and make you feel "other".No matter what your views on this beautiful human being is, crack open this book and take the world from her point of view. It's beautifully written and eye opening.

reviews: I have so much respect for the Obamas.  Their interest in children's education and health for all citizens is brought out in this book.  It emphasizes  the fact that someone who is not born into privilege  and wealth can go as far as their dreams carry them with hard work and perseverance.  Michelle gives an inside view of what is is like to be a First Lady.  It is beautifully written.

reviews: Felt like FLOTUS n=must have been transcribing from journals for all the detail contained in her book.  Thought at times so much could have been left out to make a much better read.  Gets into family life, political life, segregation/integration.  The rise of Michele Obama specifically shows her desire to succeed and to make a difference.  With some editing and condensation, this would also be a good book for young people.

reviews: Michelle Obama is articulate, thoughtful and realistic in describing life as the wife of a man dedicated to human rights issues. She portrays herself as equally as ambitious and determined to make a difference in the lives of those who elected her husband, to creating a sense of "normality" for her children  and creating a platform from which to enrich her role as FLOTUS.

reviews: To say how proud I am to have witnessed both the success of the years you spent as an exceptional FLOTUS and your eloquently written bio is truly not adequate. Thank you for being the lioness that roared openly, proudly, and gracefully. Thank you for not calling into that political trap they all hammered for you to take that bait. You deserve to return to become you again. God speed Mrs Obama.

reviews: The straightest, insightful, real book I have ever read on growing up in a middle class black family in Chicago. The 1st Lady was direct in explaining interacting with white people while growing up, through college and in adult life. I enjoyed the book and have a great deal of respect for her telling her story without fluff and sugarcoating.

reviews: Loved her honesty and straight forward views on events that affected her life as well as her family’s life while involved in politics, especially her time in the White House. She shared the not so glamorous side of being in the limelight at all times, especially the lack of privacy. I admired her desire to be more than just the wife of the President of the United States with her efforts to help children make healthy choices with her White House vegetable garden, her efforts to get children to be physically active, and her efforts to be involved rather than just lending her name.

reviews: Not typically a fan of memoirs or autobiography, this stands apart. Well written, as if you are having a conversation. I like how the book was organized, by that I mean a well planned guided tour when you are abroad versus an awful one. You know, too fast, too much info, too long in one place, not enough time in another,etc.Sure there are insights about certain events and or situations that I might see differently and that’s okay, primarily because it’s told with humility.

reviews: Michelle Obama's autobiography is not only about becoming for black urban women, but touches every woman not born into a life of privilege. Many of the issues she raises about earning her place, I similarly experienced in leaving a rural area of Pennsylvania in 1977 and arriving at the steps of Harvard University, looking forward to a great adventure while being scared and concerned whether I "was good enough". When she mentioned the "Artichoke" quandary, I laughed out loud remembering my own identical scene. I hope I can remain as hopeful and graceful as she remains after the last election.

reviews: As steady, poised and enjoyable a read as the First Lady herself. Mrs. Obama comes across in or in much the same as she does when we see her publicly. A class act. Truly authentic. I relate to most of her story and that's refreshing. It's also wholly believable that if she land in a history-making role, then so can I and so can millions of other girls. And the President... He steals the show on every page where he appears. Love and blessings to their union.

reviews: I love non-fiction. Love learning about all kinds of people, and Mrs. Obama was no exception. Her book is thoughtful and insightful. I grew up in a predominantly white middle class town, with very little exposure to people of color. However, I also lived in West Africa as an adult for 4 years where I was the minority. While I didn’t agree with all of Mrs. Obama’s political views, I firmly believe she is like most mothers...she simply wants a better world for her children, and ultimately her grandchildren. I learned a little about what it was like to grow up on the southside of Chicago, live in the White House, and everything that came with both of those experiences (what? You paid for your own food??). But I also learned that regardless of the color of our skin, she and I grew up in a similar home; one with loving, but strict, parents. One where education was important. Highly recommend this book, regardless of your political views

reviews: Two days before someone gave me a hardcopy of "Becoming," I had downloaded it onto my Kindle and began to immerse myself into it. I was happy to have the hardcopy as well in case I ever get to meet Mrs. Obama, shake her hand, and have my copy of her book signed by her. The openness and honesty that is shared in this book is so perfect. Before reading the book, I had decided that this woman is one of my heroes and she will always and forever continue to be. The insight into her life has been wonderful.

reviews: I'm a fan of Mrs. Obama - from everything she has accomplished to the dignity and grace she exemplifies every day. After reading Becoming, I feel like she is someone I could be friends with. I wish this book had been around when I was a teen. It's an eye opener about privilege, diversity and strength of spirit. I appreciate her candor and her positivity. Read this book not as a Democrat or a Republican or a Libertarian, but as a human being and get to know another exceptional human being.

reviews: There's a little bit of repetition, but, for the most part, this is an amazingly well-written an informative book.  I thought I had a good idea of what was going on, but I surely learned a lot.  Even just the tidbits on Queen Elizabeth II are worth the price, and there's so much more: memoir, insider tell-all, analysis of American politics today, family portrait -- it's amazing how much is packed into it.  And it's a very easy read.

reviews: Michelle eloquently recounts the story of her life's journey and through her story makes you realize the embedded prejudice that affects people of color their entire life. Now under Trump much of that prejudice has flared as outright hate. Michelle does not dwell on any of this, but deals calmly with living her life with compassion and grace.  A good book about an amazing role model for all women.

reviews: Loved so many things about this book. It's easy to follow and gives the lay person a peek into the real life of former FLOTUS Michelle Obama. Her genuine humility echoes off the pages as she takes the reader through the three major chapters of her life. Fascinating read. I'm also inspired by her upbringing, which I knew little of before reading this book. Must-read!

reviews: In today's crazy world, Michelle Obama is a voice of sanity and hope. I LIKE this woman, and I adore her mother's view of life. I wish her dad could have seen her accomplishments.

reviews: From the opening sentence, I felt as though the author was sitting across the table from me. Her voice is so authentic and sincere from beginning until end. She tells her life as it has been and does not sugar coat anything. She makes it clear from early on that politics is not her "thing". Her sincerity, warmth, intelligence and fortitude should be an inspiration to both men and women of any political persuasion. It is truly an excellent read!!

reviews: I purposely read this book slowly, because I wanted to savor each word. Michelle Obama did what good writers do..she made me feel and experience her FLOTUS life through her words..... its ups, downs, triumphs and tragedies. And, since our　political　landscape　has　changed　so　drastically since the Obamas left office, my most fervent hope is that she would change her mind and RUN FOR PRESIDENT !!

reviews: I felt as though I was sitting in the same room with Michelle Obama and having a conversation.  This book is truly a must read. She made me feel the struggles, laugh at situations and grieve at some of the experiences she shared.  I am so glad I own this book and have recommended it to many.  Though, I have to confess, while engrossed in this book, I found myself in despair over what our country has become. She exudes such hope and now there seems to be none.

reviews: Inspired, I am trying to find the courage to move forward after a very difficult time of being bullied. Encouraged, that for all our differences it is all our sameness that we celebrate. Annoyed, that so much of the beautiful work, the steps forward, are being systamtically errased by a floundering fool, a jester of no class. Enpowered, that all the world is still malable. Humbled, that I now believe we are all here for a purpose. Determined to make and become my best! God bless the Obamas ! Thank you!

reviews: I was loving the book, "Becoming,"  until I got to the middle where there are 16 pages that are blank.  The empty pages randomly occur between page 178 and 207 and were there but with no printing.  The following printed pages were numerically meant to include those empty pages but with printed content. I am convinced that this book was acquired from an unscrupulous underground source.  The publisher wouldn't sell it this way.  I am very disappointed that Amazon would carry/sell this substandard product.

reviews: Great insight into both Michelle and Barack Obama. Who they are, what motivates them.  The book starts out with Michelle as a young girl in Chicago. Her parents instilled in her  love of learning. She Went on to graduate from Princeton and Harvard. Worked at a prestigious law firm and then decided to something more meaningful to help others.Good read, you won't be disappointed.

reviews: It's awesome to have an inside look on what the first family went through during their ascendance to the White House and how they got there. Michelle Obama is truly a role model to look up to and she's very relatable in this book!

reviews: Michelle Obama has a beautiful writing voice. Loved learning about the early days of her romance with Barack. Really enjoyed reading about her love for her daughters and her concerns about them growing up in the White House. Her compassion, humanity and care for people jumps off the page. I highly recommend this book and was disappointed when it ended. I could have read more!

reviews: It was all great.....such honesty and truth.I loved the history of both Obama's background and Michelle's.  It made the story of their love and their path together so much more real and rich with the tapestry of their lives and how it intertwined with those of us that love and support them."Becoming" was a great book and wonderful story of two people who lives and decisions have impacted and changed the lives of many people across the world and it was so beautifully written. I highly recommend it!

reviews: I wish there were more stars available for this book. Five stars are insufficient. What a woman!  What a loss for our  nation when their term was up. Contrast in the way our country was governed by Obamas and is being governed now is incomparable! Tragic even.  Her refusal to be bitter but resolutely remain hopeful is very inspiring to me.  A must read for everyone!

reviews: I recommend the audio book! Michelle herself narrates it, and it's cheaper than the Kindle or physical versions. Her writing style is pleasant and her observations are inspiring. She doesn't brag or pat herself on the back. She actually makes a point to say that she is successful because of the opportunities given to her, and never points out that she is better than anyone ever in this book. There is plenty of content about her husband, and will show how grassroots both of them are. It was never boring, even to my friends that don't like reading.

reviews: Excellent read. 'Behind every great man, there is an even greater woman' is so true. She held the helm while he worked the ship, preventing it from sinking, for 8 years. How could a couple survive 8 years in the white house with no scandal is beyond my comprehension? She is the embodiment of patience, endurance, motherhood, and smartness (intelligent, educated).

reviews: I would recommend any living person to read this book. I love reading and have not favorite theme, just a reading that holds my interest. From the beginning to the end all I can say is I wanted to read more. Thanks Michelle for being real and honest. I respect your views and honesty of how you shared your years in the eyes  of public life. God has given you so much and you turned right around and shared it in so many ways. Keep being you.

reviews: I very much enjoyed learning about Michelle Obama and her family, life before and during the White House years.  I feel a closeness to her. Having experienced a small amount of racial indifference growing; part Native American and female. I lived with knowing my father didn't really accept me, because I was suppose to be a boy.  My future was to grow up a be a wife and mother, no expectations of college. Reading about Michelle Obama, I find myself ending her in a lot of ways.  I truly hope she reconsidered a run for president, I know it's a lot to ask; I think she would be great.

I loved this book and couldn't recommend it more highly.  Our country was lucky to have Michelle Obama as our first lady.  This should be a must read and would make a great mother to daughter gift.

reviews: Michelle showed her true self. Her imperfections and insecurities are just as real as everyone else. Don’t get me wrong, she’s an amazing woman but she revels how human she is. Understanding her a bit more now makes me feel like I can achieve so much more in my life. I appreciate her writing this book as I see how I can improve my time on earth. I also appreciate how thoughtful and nurturing she is. She gives me hope for a better future.

reviews: An inside view of the Obamas and especially Michelle. The transition from Southside Chicago girl to Princeton and Harvard and finally the White House and FLOTUS. Although this book is a memoir, it’s also a reminder that while you may be in a challenging place in your life, you can always have your feet pointed in the direction of progress.

reviews: To start with, I am a fan :). I think both of them are amazing and am so upset over the events starting January ‘17 undoing so many elements of the Obama legacy.I found the book to be very personal and intimate. I loved the way it was written in a very relaxed manner. It really made me feel like if I ever ran into her, I would know her.I loved reading about life in the White Hiuse. But most of all the feeling the I got to look into the life that took many unbelievable turns to get so far with such speed. It really is an inspiring story.

reviews: So refreshing to read a thoughtful, composed, and honest accounting of the combination of fortitude, determination, and circumstance that accretes to one’s station in life. Becoming holds, for me, a wonderful portrait of not only an amazing first family - one of the best in the history of this nation - but also of a girl from the south side who becomes something so much more.

reviews: For measuring personal choices, growth,attitudes, and actions, this book gives one a wealth of material. For seeing ways to have and extend hope, grace, optimism, history, and the future, this book gives one examples and insight. For a wider perspective on this nation, one needs to read of the challenges and struggles Michelle Obama describes. I am thankful I took the time to read this book and will do so again.

Even as she chronicles tragedy and difficulty she also brings the strong  undercurrent of optimism.  This is at heart a very down to earth story qbout living in an environment that is anything but and most importantly, this is Michelle's side of the story in her own beautiful words. Easily some of the best five hours 'I've ever spent.

reviews: Fantastic book. I was convinced of Michelle Obamas candor & honesty in this book. It allowed a view into some of the more personal (without being voyeuristic) aspects of her life as a smart, driven woman, her personal evolution, & as her role as the partner of the president of the United States. A very well written book, interesting all the way through. I will read it again at some point & that's quite an endorsement!

reviews: I am so very disappointed.  I bought this book in November, however it was added to my "need to read" pile and I just started reading this book about a week and a half ago.  When I came upon Chapter 13, I found that several pages were "white-washed", so light they could not be read, or completely white.  Then, there were normal pages of text that were just fine.  This continues on throughout the entire chapter of both chapter 13 and 14.  I am completely disappointed as Amazon said there is nothing I can do about it now.  I did not get to "talk" to an actual representative.  In my opinion, this book should be replaced.  It was sold to me as "new".  As you can see from the pictures.  It is a defective copy.  The book itself has been excellent so far.  The content is wonderful.  I am so sad.

reviews: Loved getting into Michele Obama's head; learning how she thinks and what things meant the most to her.  This book was written in an easy to read style, bringing you right into Michele's way of thinking.  Great getting an insight into her life in the White House. There were times that I felt right "there" with her as her life progressed.  I saw her as a young woman, a wife, a mother, and all the emotions with each part of her life.

reviews: I found Michelle's life story fascinating as I knew little about it before she became First Lady. She's a better storyteller than most in similar positions. The mostly upbeat messages are a pleasant contrast to much of the news in 2018-2019.

reviews: I just finished this incredible book and hated to see it end. It took me through the South side of Chicago to the White House, as if I had accompanied the Obama’s on the journey. It is honest, inspiring, dedicated to anyone who thinks they don’t count or couldn’t accomplish what others have done. Thank you to Michelle Obama for taking the time to write. It also made me sad at the current state of politics as delivered on the news and social media. I look forward to the next election in hopes of having a family of integrity again who also have a sense of humor.
text: I just finished this incredible book and hated to see it end. It took me through the South side of Chicago to the White House, as if I had accompanied the Obama’s on the journey. It is honest, inspiring, dedicated to anyone who thinks they don’t count or couldn’t accomplish what others have done. Thank you to Michelle Obama for taking the time to write. It also made me sad at the current state of politics as delivered on the news and social media. I look forward to the next election in hopes of having a family of integrity again who also have a sense of humor.

reviews: I'm not usually a big fan of autobiographies but I wanted to give this book a try. Michelle Obama's writing in this book is clear and sincere, without any frills or airs. From her Chicago Southside upbringing, to her studies in Ivy league universities, and through her various careers and her terms as the FLOTUS, she manages to tell her story in a relatable, funny, yet down-to-earth way that makes her so endearing to me. She is trying (and succeeding) to both define and be true to herself as she grows through the different stages of her life. I read about her struggles, and how hard she had to work behind the scenes in order to appear so effortless and flawless on TV. She truly is an inspiration. 5/5 stars for this amazing book.

reviews: I did not know that much about Michelle Obama.  I heard her speeches on Youtube during different conventions, and she has always been articulate and graceful.  She seemed to ooze confidence and charm.  I took her book on a cruise and could not put it down. I read straight through it.  She impressed me with her calm under pressure; through all the criticism, she saw how she could improve instead of attacking.  She asked the same questions that we women have been asking for centuries. Am I good enough?  Through all her accomplishments, she is still striving.  I love her spirit and integrity; She serves as a role model for all women and girls.

reviews: I just finished this last night. It makes me miss the Obamas even more. It was great to learn of Michelle's working-class upbringing on the South Side of Chicago. She had loving, supportive parents who worked hard to give her and her brother a good start in life by making sure they had educational opportunities. She and her brother worked hard and fulfilled their parents' hopes for them. I enjoyed the personal look into her relationship with Barack, her children, and her extended family. I highly recommend this book.

reviews: Ha! 2 years out of office and we’re still living on not 1 Obama, but 2! Her story is Every Colored Woman’s story in many ways. I’m so grateful she literally opened up and shared her life then and now. This is a must read and share. She can throw some shade! Don’t let being the 1st lady fool ya. I can now understand why she’s so strong. I admire her on many levels.

reviews: Understanding where and how Michelle Robinson Obama was raised lets the reader understand her upward travel in life.  How she survived campaigning and the confinements of the White House. How she could raise two remarkable daughters and be a loving wife under the constant scrutiny of the public.  Michelle's ability to  write candidly and from the heart make this a must read.

reviews: Inspiring, honest, full of hope.  This is more than an autobiography.  This is a book of inspiration, hope, humor, and encouragement to continue becoming your best version of yourself no matter who you are.  I miss Michelle Obama as our First Lady - but I am so glad we had her for eight years.  She's a beautiful example of how to be a woman, a mother, a leader, and a spouse.
