reviews: I just got an overall feel of arrogance in this book. Condescending. Being talked down too. And out of touch with the average person and reality. Not a good way to move people into one's corner with this type of tone.

reviews: This memoir by Michelle Obama is very well written and I thought it was full of heart and honesty. It is a very personal sharing of her life journey from the South side of Chicago to Princeton and Harvard to the Whitehouse and being First Lady of our country. There are many details and stories in this book, I could not put it down and recommend it highly.

reviews: It was just ok for me. I was expecting so much more, I bought into the first lady hype and all the marketing surrounding this project. Dont get me wrong, I loooove Mrs. Michelle Obama, she is fierce, equipped with  beauty and brains, but I found a lot of this book to be dry (especially in the early chapters); however, it got better as she addressed her experiences in office with Barak, they're dating life, and evolving family life together.

reviews: It became boring the more I read. I feel it would have been more interesting reading about her life as a private person and stop. Then her life as a public figure. Put it together it became boring

reviews: I had really high expectations of this book because everyone was talking about it. The first chapters are somehow boring because it gets really specific in Michelle’s pre school and kindergarden stories. Even though overll the book was fine I believe the same story could be told in half of the pages. However, a light reading is always good to get to know more about such a political character (while enjoying your vacation)

reviews: Ordered this book from Amazon as a Christmas gift - and the recipient called me last night to say there are blank pages within the book (she is just now reading it.)  I am very disappointed and with the Amazon cut-off of Jan 31, I don't have any recourse.  I would suggest that if you buy this book, don't buy it from Amazon or else look to make sure all the pages are there.  Having gotten this book from the library, I will say the book itself is wonderful, when the pages are all there.

reviews: Delivered quickly.  Read with book club.  It would not have been my choice for a monthly read, but I’m glad I read it.  I have a greater respect for Michelle Obama because of it.  I always liked her, but after you read her story you will have a deeper appreciation for the woman and her journey.

reviews: One of the best books I've ever read.  It's like a how to book on how to live a life that is successful (how to make choices you know are right for you - that money and what other people's opinions have are not as important) .  I have admired her and Barack from the beginning - and still do.  You can tell character (good people) - they have it!  Such lovely people.  Best Wishes to them and their girls!

reviews: I have spent a lot of time feeling betrayed and confused by authorities.  I have experienced way too much ugliness to sit back and trust that justice will be served as a matter of course.  But never have I felt more support in making sense of it all, or knowing where to even start to position myself to make the difference I can make in the world.  I feel that I owe Michelle (and Barack) a huge debt for offering a model of integrity and humanity.  Thank you Michelle, for telling your story.  It means the world to me.

reviews: Thank you First Lady Michelle Obama for being the real, authentic person that we all came to know and love. Thank you for keeping it 100 in your book and being unafraid to walk in your truth and tell it with such clarity and in a manner that every woman can identify with. I laughed with you and I cried with you and in the end, I was hungry for more. I just want to know when Book 2 will be released! You will forever be my shero.

reviews: I liked the complete book.  I am a white, 81 year woman who is still working as a income tax preparer.  My life was similarto Michelle Obama but didn't have the means to attend college.  My mother raised 8 children and was my best friend and my hero.  My father worked in the coal mine and was not such a great man.  My Mom kept us all together.  My dad was abusive and frightening at times.  We were poor and we were bullied and discriminated  against because  we didn't have the best clothes or the nicest homes.  I kept my grades up in school and worked my way up to now that I own my own business.  This book drew a wonderful comparison between myself and Michelle even though we lived in a different period of time.  Thank you Michelle Obama for this beautiful book showing that women can BECOME whoever they want to be.

reviews: Michelle Obama is an inspiration, especially given her background growing up on the south side of Chicago.  She had a wonderfully supportive family and being super smart and open minded didn't hurt!  My favorite part of this book was reading about her early life in Chicago through her initial meetings with Barack Obama.  Much of the rest of the story, we know, although there were some interesting tidbits which made reading through to the end worthwhile.

reviews: "Becoming" is a very well written autobiography.  Michelle Obama describes growing up on the Southside of Chicago during a time of continued struggle for inner city kids.  Her parents were staunch believers in education, continued learning, and respect.  This background also caused her issues because she "talked like a white girl".  Through continued education, perseverance and continuously pushing herself, she became a lawyer.  Her beliefs in family, nutrition, and education were maintained in all that she did.  Great read!

reviews: Michele turns out to be a terrific writer. I love her even more now having read about her childhood.  And I love her husband even more now knowing how he treats her.

reviews: Such a refreshing and open book.  Obviously written by her, and not a ghost writer, like so many celebrity books.  Goes from her youth and early family life all the way to her current hopes and dreams.  A must read for every Obama fan!

reviews: Wow. Incredibly well written, I am truly blown away by what a tale is told about a little girl who grows up on the south side of Chicago and fell in love with a man while finding her true passion in life.

reviews: This most incredible first lady does an impressive job bringing us along for the ride from her childhood though her young adulthood, early career, motherhood, and of course the White House. Her integrity, humor, and unflinchingly owned imperfections all make this memoir sparkle with truth.

reviews: The value of family and love for children & county were ran through the entire story. This carried over to military families and the education and health of all families regardless of race.I enjoyed the simple happy and often humorous, moments  Michelle shared around everyday life with her girls, dogs,garden, staff and of course her famous husband.

reviews: I was fascinated by the strength of character that was developed so deeply by former First Lady, Michele Obama’s parents and extended family. I was so impressed by her determination even as a preschooler to excel, in piano, later in school, and in her assent in her career. She was so perceptive in recognizing nuisances of how people reacted to her, being a woman of color, and in how she would not allow people to “put her in her place.”  She and former president, Barack Obama, are truly classy, and I appreciate their efforts to find good in others and help those less fortunate rise. They made a difference in all of the work they did and we now must work to find positives in the future.

reviews: This is a great read. To be able to look at how Mrs. Obama grew up and the support of her family, makes you understand how she grew to be a strong independent woman. And then when talking about her relationship with her husband, and seeing how strong they are together, is exactly how they show the public who they are. After reading this book I feel like I understand who Mrs. Obama is and how much I admire her.

reviews: I'm glad I read this book for its historical perspective, and even more for learning her specific story, the telling of which often allowed me to forget who she was and just learn about her early life. It is well but unpretentiously written. Her story is an important one to know, especially in the context of our nation's past and present. I do love that she so consistently continues to honor where she came from and to work at helping people on early paths like hers.

reviews: I like Michelle Obama & this book increased my approval of her. It is very well written and not just about the black history, but poor people in general. Very impressed by her honesty. I don't approve entirely of Barrack, but in general his positions are not what's at the heart of Michelle's book. I didn't like the ACA due to its punishment to the poor for not getting health insurance, but its about all he could get through with the "old white guys" working to fail him. No hard feelings, but well written honesty about all phases of her life and relationship.

reviews: Easy to relate to Mrs. Obama and raising a family. Really tells her story as it was.  No fluffy words.  Appreciated the truism of her life.  The story does tell all of us that with hard work, loving relationships, family, friends, education , and faith goals can be achieved and life changes can become a positive part of maturing. Than you for the great read!

reviews: I found myself getting very sad reading Obama’s words of dignity, kindness, intelligence. I wondered how we could possibly go from such grace, to such uncouth disregard for the people this Administration is supposed to represent. A President is supposed to represent the whole country, not just their rabid followers. I will always be grateful and proud to have lived during the Obama Administration and to know what can be and pray we get back to that. Where we cared for our fellow citizens and didn’t denigrate based on religion, skin color or country of origin.

reviews: I read this book at the right time. It helped me remember the feeling of expanding diversity and the importance of having a family like this in the White House. I was inspired by how they worked as a team through challenges most all of us couldnt even imagine. I particularly appreciated the details about feeling trapped in their roles but privileged at the same time. The awareness about diversity and inclusion couldn't inform leaders any better.

reviews: It's refreshing to read a memoir where the author doesn't try to present a constructed persona of themself...or does so in a way that doesn't sand down all the rough edges that make a person interesting--and human. MRO reveals herself to be driven, ambitious, and at times critical. This is (unsurprisingly) a well written book: my only critique is that narrative becomes (perhaps out of necessity) less detailed in the White House years. Michelle Obama is no politician. A shame, really.

reviews: Becoming is one of the most inspirational autobiographies I have ever read.  I am in awe of Michelle's account of her life and her determination to succeed despite the odds.  I was moved by the strength she and Barack displayed during his tenure as President against  the op-positional  forces  they faced and their ability to continue to work to improve the plight or children, military families, etc.  It definitely has strengthened my resolve to do what I can to help others and motivate the youth to be the best that they can be.

reviews: As always, Michelle Obama gives hope to a troubled world.  Her book, Becoming, is written from the heart and touches the heart of anyone who reads it.  She writes with such grace, humility and dignity, along with a sense of humor, that just wants you to reach out and give her a hug!The Obama family truly are a First (and very special) Family.

reviews: Becoming by Michelle Obama is a reminder that anyone can get the job done. She was vulnerable in each chapter, yet reminded us that she is a career woman, a wife, a mother, and above all a human being just like each and every one of us; every time a new challenge rose, she threw herself in without losing her voice. My favorite part of the book is when she strived to promote girls' education/ education for minorities in general. Thank you for reminding us that, if we just believe in ourselves, we all deserve a seat at the Ivy League schools! Honestly this is one of the best investments of 2018-19, and definitely worth every penny.

reviews: This is a good book so far but getting to the middle of it now I am realizing there are 16 pages that did not get completely printed. I’m very very disappointed in this. How am I supposed to read those parts?

reviews: BECOMING is well written and contains many stories about Michelle Obama's life. She sees the notion of BECOMING as "growing up with intention." Her mom taught her how to speak, think critically, and draw conclusions about subject with her peer groups. It has shown me that children need to be taught about emotional intelligence, recognizing inferences and using their imaginations when reading, writing, and problem solving Pre-K-4th grades.

reviews: I have enjoyed every moment of this journey. It was a lesson to young women, a support to family love and boundaries , and insight into what human spirit can accomplish! The Obamas have changed how integrity is viewed and showed America what resilience and class can look like. I admired this family from the beginning, now I'm in love. Thank you

reviews: I enjoyed this book very much.  The first part (pre-White House years) was the most interesting to me.  Her life when she was growing up in the South Side of Chicago.  Her relationships with her family members and friends.  Her experience at Princeton University.  Her choices in careers.  And her meeting Barack and some of the aspects of their different personalities, backgrounds and approach to life.  The White House years were interesting, but not nearly as interesting to me as the first half.  Still, I recommend it.  If for those who were not fans of the Obama administration.

reviews: I purchased the book and the audio. It was delightful to hear Michelle reading to me. She allows you to see her life as if you were there. Great read but I enjoyed hearing her voice.

reviews: I liked the stories of the Obama Family.  How Michelle and Barak met and fell in Love.  What it meant for both of them being the first African American couple in the White House.  The highs and lows of what that meant for their family.  Also how  many of these things are familiar to families everywhere, but often more poignant for any family living  such a public and  scrutinized life.  She makes us see that all of us affect our times and circumstances in our own small sphere of influence in which each of us lives.

reviews: It is a real accounting of the struggles to become on the partner track at just the right law firm. And what happens when you start over. It is meeting the perfect guy who is a little more laid back than you like, but taking a wonderful adventure with him. It is a bail about raising children and going to couples therapy. It is recounting of the ups and downs of being the leader in chief. It is warm. It is funny. I miss the Obama family in the White House.

reviews: I really thought there would not be anything that "new" here. . . Wow, was I wrong!  Her life story was so engaging and her colorful writing style made this a real page-turner even though we know the "ending" before the beginning; it's the "Becoming" that captures the reader right from the get-go!  As a side note,  I think all young parents should read this if for no other reason than to get an example of great parenting skills. . exhibited by Michelle's parents and Michelle and Barack as well.

reviews: I was already a fan before I read Mrs. Obama's book.  So, when a friend bought me a copy, I thought great I'll get around to reading it as soon as I can.  I thought it would be interesting, I would read about her "first lady" role(s), duties, responsibilities, and a lot about the president. I was surprised she shared so much of herself and when folks saw me reading Becoming, they would ask me if it was good. I always answered, yes, you will love it and you will feel proud she was our first lady. Becoming was warm, sincere, and intentional. It makes you think of your story, your Becoming.

I only really enjoyed the first 1/3 of the book when she talked about growing up in Chicago with her family. After that, it became too political for me and I just lost interest but I read on because I spent money buying it. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. It was ok.

reviews: This book illustrates the four concentric circles that make up Michelle Obama's life and the source of her strength: Family, Community, Nation, the World. Firmly rooted in the first circle, her life expands into the outer circles until her emerges as a world figure. Fittingly, only the last quarter of the book deals with her White House years, so you have a profound view, written with deceptive simplicity, of remarkable individual growth and transformation.

reviews: I purchased these as Christmas presents for my 2 adult daughters.  When the first opened her's everyone was so excited, and the other daughter was so happy for her.  When the next daughter opened her's, we were touched by their tears of gratitude of receiving Michelle's story that we all highly anticipated.  Today, the youngest daughter proudly displays her book at her home in Berlin, Germany, where she is currently a student.  I highly recommend this insightful read.

reviews: Really felt like I got to know her on such a personal level from her younger years with all of her career changed until her First Lady days and beyond. she has done so much in her life already and impacted so many lives and truly took her role as First Lady and worked hard to make a difference throughout those 8 years for what she felt strongly about including obesity and women’s rights and gun violence, all this and still played the role of mother and wife and daughter!!!!

reviews: Michelle Obama's experience of growing up in a poor but loving family and an unprivileged circumstance resonates a lot with many American families, including mine. Her resilience and determination to make the most of all the opportunities given to her as well as to strive to improve the financial situation for her family and her future children is extremely admirable and inspirational. I can relate to a lot of her sentiments, since I also encountered many of her challenges growing up. Just like her, I was determined to go to college and subsequently finished a doctorate program that eventually landed me a job that affords me financial stability and happiness. I hope her efforts at helping inspire and support underprivileged kids to discover their hidden potentials and to overcome adverse circumstances will live on and we will see many successful and accomplished young adults in the next 5-10 years.

reviews: Michelle is great writer and knows how to draw you into a story. The book does a very good job of helping to understand what being in the public eye involves and coping with the lack of privacy.  I appreciate her letting us into her life. She made me feel like an old friend.The only negative, it was too long. A little repetitive in places!  🌺🌿 Thanks for sharing your story with us, Michelle.

reviews: I don't usually like autobiographies, but this one stands alone as a true masterpiece. Following all the Obamas through 8 years of presidentiall-style living, it was beautifully written with a plethora of details and poignant moments.  Michelle's story touched on sensitive subjects which she brilliantly described and parsed. This was definitely a "must read".

reviews: If asked who living or dead, would I most like to share a meal with.....Michelle Obama would be on my top ten!  What a gracious lady and not afraid to laugh at herself.  She shares her story of growing up in Chicago’s Southside from humble beginnings.  She embraces the belief that with goals, education and perseverance, along with the love and support of family, you can rise above your surroundings, and become the person you envision.

reviews: While I've always been a fan of the Obamas, this story made me appreciate the journey Michelle took to become our first lady. Like most Americans what I knew of Michelle was the highlight reel that most of us read about in papers or saw on t.v. - the pages of this book took me behind the scenes and I gained a greater understanding of all that she has gone through, all that she has achieved and above all how special a person she really is. A great mom with an unwavering commitment to making our world a better place, the words illustrated the challenge in balancing many hats. I appreciate the candid nature of the book and I found it was hard to put down, I just wanted to read what happened next. An inspiring read I hope everyone picks up!

reviews: Michelle Obama has inspired in me something I never thought possible - activism in politics. Because I believe our country made its biggest mistake EVER with the election of Donald Trump, I hope to join or start a get out the vote movement in Austin, Texas. I am a white senior female,and my targets will be mostly women and, more specifically, women of color. Thank you, Mrs. Obama for such inspiration.

reviews: I have been a fan of Michelle Obama for several years,  but after reading this book I'm absolutely awestruck by her.For anyone who wants to understand the Obamas better, especially Michelle,  this book is a must-read.  For any young woman looking for inspiration,  especially young working mothers,  this is what you have been looking for.I am so proud that we had this lovely lady and her beautiful family representing our country.Her writing style is easy and breezy.  I came away from it feeling like I know her as one of my girlfriends.I've recommended this book to my friends,  my daughters, and even to my housekeeper!

reviews: I'm grateful to Mrs. Obama for sharing of herself and her experiences with all of us. I wish I could spend time with her as she embodies such grace and a forthrightness that is refreshing and inspiring. I cannot imagine what would compel a one-star review by anyone who reads this. But that message lies in the pages of this great book.

reviews: There's not a word I didn't enjoy reading. A terrific book on so many levels. I was and always will be an Obama supporter. Her words are ultimately positive and encouraging. I will reread this book again and again for more encouragement and insight. It is a beautiful story of love, of spouse, children, family, friends, country, and all people in our world. This is an unforgettable account of the importance of family, education, curiosity, commitment, dedication, courage, and resilience, a must read.

reviews: I have a confession to make: I grew up about 30 blocks away from Michelle. I also grew up about 30 years earlier than her, but still, her story and that of her experiences growing up in Chicago resonated with me. So did her romance with Barack. I had a similar experience on the Illinois Senate floor with my husband of 45 years. Everyone I know who reads this book says they've enjoyed it, even without having a personal connection to her words.

reviews: Loved this true story about Michelle Obama and her family! What a treat! Six of our thirteen grandchildren are African-American, so I understand your feelings for their safety and  protection as well as your own!  We are vacationing in Hawaii right now, which increased my appreciation for your words even more!  I have taught yoga to children for years and love our interactions!  Know you are loved! Lou Ann Maxwell Bruck

reviews: Loved it from the beginning.  Enjoyed how Mrs. Obama described her humble beginnings, her humanity, herself.  It was interesting and I enjoyed the information given while being the First Lady.  We rarely get to know the inside of the White House from the everyday living point of view regarding the body guards, the garden, the staff assisting them. That was cool to read.  Throughout the book we are entertained by this beautiful, real woman who showed us her humanitarian side, her feelings and emotions.  Could not put it down.  An autobiography that I fully enjoyed reading.

reviews: Honest,well written account of growing up as a first generation upwardly mobile minority person in the 60’s and 70’s. We were the product of hardworking, optimistic, positive parents and mentors who enabled us to overcome societies odds against us. Like Michelle, most of us now seek to make it easier for new generations even when they aren’t blessed with extraordinary parental support.

reviews: This is a terrific book about an amazing woman.  She is truly an American.  She loves her Country, her Family and her Friends.  Raising people’s knowledge about things that really matter in the World around us and encouraging the help of people who have a lot of pull in getting things done is what this woman did to make the World a much better place.  Her love for children both hers and all girls has helped a lot of girls’ dreams come true.  A great read.

reviews: I liked the no nonsense telling of a life’s story, one worth hearing. Easy to understand and sometimes difficult and convicting to take in. For anyone willing to hear a compelling perspective of the times we live in. Especially for those looking for the courage to form the parts of their life into an equally important and compelling narrative, free of the crippling critical voice inside our heads.

reviews: It’s hard to overstate how good this book was. Michelle’s writing is superb:  multilayered, detailed, funny, heartbreaking, vulnerable, intimate.  If I ever have the good fortune of being able to speak to this wonderful woman in person I would thank her for her hard work and apologize for the oftentimes awful conduct of many of my countrymen. You and your family deserved much better and at the time this American had no idea how lucky he was to have you folks.

reviews: To start from such humble beginnings and to rise to one of the highest positions in the land, is a remarkable achievement.  Her family's love, support, and sacrifices, helped to make her who she is today.  Her drive and ambition enabled her to be successful long before she entered the White House with her Husband Barack Obama.  What a life!

reviews: What I loved most about this book was that it wasn't the story of the president's wife or of the administration's work from her point of view. This was about a woman and what made her special, and what precisely did not. There was enough humble-brag to make it real. And enough emotion to give depth without playing the world's tiniest violin. Importantly, it answered my questions about what happened to the woman Michelle Robinson Obama. Turns out, she was there all along

reviews: I enjoyed this book so very much. She spoke with true emotions.Regardless if those emotions were fearful, happy and sad. She still became Michelle Obama !!!!! Thank you for sharing your story with me 😀😀😀😀😀

reviews: Enthralling read and incredible journey from South Side of Chicago to the White House.  This story shows why she will be remembered as one of the best First Ladies, not because she was black but because of her grace, intelligence and love for this country.
text: Enthralling read and incredible journey from South Side of Chicago to the White House.  This story shows why she will be remembered as one of the best First Ladies, not because she was black but because of her grace, intelligence and love for this country.

reviews: "God is in the details." From those first details that never end, I felt I was more than a reader---a friend, a part of the family. I was drawn to the quality of determination and its strength in every activity, whether it was keeping family important or getting projects accomplished---inspiring! This book is as much a movie as a book.  I hope you continue writing, Michelle. You are a born writer, and yes writers have teams. Your writing is a flow of conversation that taking the black ink off the paper becomes family or friends in conversation---as if you are living it as you write. With gratitude for your huge effort of writing, and gratitude for all those on your team.

reviews: I have always admired Michelle and I am not at all surprised that she wrote such an inspirational and uplifting book.  I highly recommend!

reviews: I would recommend this book to my friends, especially my girlfriends. Michelle Obama is a truly fascinating woman. As I read each page I honestly began to see her more as a wife, mother, friend and mentor than as the icon of First Lady. I’m positive that I could sit down and share a cup of tea and just talk the afternoon away with her. A positive inspiration for all young women.

reviews: First, I am a huge fan of both Michelle and Barrack Obama.  I loved the way this book was written and the insight into politics through the eyes of the FLOTUS.  Great read.  Wish they were still in the White House.

reviews: I liked her childhood and university stories a lot.  I was struck by the difficulty she and other African-Americans have in accepting themselves as capable people; the constant self-questioning.  But I thought the times in the White House were sort of mundane and I found myself wishing she had given much more personal accounts of the people she encountered during that time.  It was a rather cautious approach.

reviews: As we get closer to the next presidential election I was comforted every minute I spent reading this book.  I am hopeful our next president will be the man that worked alongside Barack Obama for eight years.

reviews: This book is so genuine!  I felt as thought Mrs. Obama was sitting at my kitchen table with me the entire time I was reading it.  It is a wonderfully human look at the impact of hope and perseverance and love as well as what it is like to hold the highest office in this land.  You won’t be disappointed.

reviews: Becoming is one of the best books I’ve ever read. Reading Michelle Obama memoirs gave me a an up close experience of some of what can be consider intimate details of Michelle Obama’s life. Becoming gave me a sense of belonging with relatable thoughts, feels and accomplishments not to mention relatable childhood memories. This memoir reinforced the love I already felt for this fist family. I highly recommend this book to others

reviews: I really enjoyed reading Michelle Obama's personal experiences from her upbringing to "becoming" the wife of the president of the United States. I often wondered what went on behind the scenes at the Whitehouse. Michelle Obama told her story the only way she could, honestly. Her story made me realize how fortunate we were to have such a classy family representing the best of America.

reviews: An excellent read about one woman’s life and how she accidentally ended up in politics. She comes across as likable, smart, and somewhat driven. It also gives a nice snapshot of behind the scenes, living in the fishbowl of the White House.
text: An excellent read about one woman’s life and how she accidentally ended up in politics. She comes across as likable, smart, and somewhat driven. It also gives a nice snapshot of behind the scenes, living in the fishbowl of the White House.

reviews: If you lack hope because of the current political climate in Washington DC, and the imbecile in chief, read Becoming.  You will once more be filled with hope and faith in the human spirit.  Michelle Obama is a beautiful writer and a beautiful person.  She is the perfect antidote to the bullying and the wealthy entitlement that inhabits the White House now and is truly a great example of what meritocracy means, again in such a contrast to the inherited wealth and the immigrant wife who inhabit the White House (despite, incredulously,  losing the vote count in the 2016 presidential election by 3 million votes).

reviews: A reflective and revealing view into the life of First Lady Michele Obama, from girlhood through her White House years. Clearly written with humor as well as gravitas, we get to see the kind of person Mrs. Obama is, and also some glimpses into the family in which she was raised, and the people who mentored and supported her along her journey. Especially enjoyable was her professional journey from law practice to public service and anecdotes around family life with the president and her lovely daughters.  Mrs. Obama isn't shy about her struggles with motherhood in the White House and how she could honor her professional goals while supporting her husband on his own incredibly demanding journey as well. I wish there were more to read!

reviews: I didn't intend to read this book but, I received it  "by accident" on my kindle. Michelle and I are the same age and I felt I knew her and her story already because much of it as a working mother and woman who has had to "adjust" to having a love one who has an illness is my own. I am pleased to be reminded of hope and our capacity to grow as a nation and as individuals. Thank you for reaffirming my own humanity by sharing your own.

reviews: I felt as if I was reliving the whole White House experience through her words. Her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the trials, tribulations and adoration of living,learning and growing as a black female and family that were able to see the beauty of everything in this country and the world. Thank you Mrs. Obama for sharing yourself and your family with us. The world as I know it throughout lifes ups and downs is still a better place because of you and your family's dedication and hard work. I enjoyed the becoming of your story as it will guide all women to realize that we are in a constant state of becoming. Which isn't a bad thing at all.

reviews: I laughed, I cried, I talked back to the book... it was a very moving experience.  It both met AND exceeded my expectations.  I could identify with a lot of what Michelle wrote about, as some of my own childhood experiences were very similar.  Side note:  I am a church musician. I had completed reading the story about her musical recital just a few days before a child at my church needed to be shown middle C to play a piece at a special program one Sunday afternoon.  After pointing it out, I was returning to my seat, and was awestruck by the similarity of that event!  Great read, and wonderful weave on the story line.

reviews: I have always admired President and Michelle Obama and watched their family during the 8 years they were in the White House. I first ordered a sample of this book, thinking it might be geared for young girls to find their place in life. I had only read a few pages when I ordered it on kindle. I have been reading all my spare time and have 2 daughters ordering and 1 daughter suggesting the read to her book club. I recommend highly.

reviews: Great great read!  Michelle allowed us to see “her” which I love because it’s hard to have your own identity when u are married to someone who is out front!  Thank you Michelle for speaking to the heart of women everywhere and showing us that regardless of where we are we can create and be who we are while “Becoming!”

reviews: This is an excellent autobiography and memoir about former first lady Michelle Obama. She really gives you a close look into her life. The book is professionally and aesthetically compiled. The documentary BECOMING is a must see film. It goes hand in hand with the book. This book depicts what an intelligent, strong, caring, positive and optimist woman Mrs. Michelle Obama truly is.

reviews: An incredibly down to earth look at what it took to be the first lady of the land and still remain a real person.  The remarkable integrity it takes to hear such awful lies about yourself and the people you loved most in the world and still maintain you dignity.  Michelle Obama is one classy lady. I'm glad I lived in the same time frame.

reviews: Partly a fascinating glimpse into life in the White House, and partly the story of Michelle. The beginning of the book is better than the second half which becomes a kind of anodyne description of Michelle’s projects as first lady. The first half in which the young Michelle is actually “becoming” makes the book worth reading.

reviews: This book presented Michelle Obama from the inside. She told her story, including images (both in words and pictures) of her life and her family. Reading this was similar to having a personal conversation with this lady.

reviews: From the living grassroots of the south end of Chicago to the pinnacle of the Whitehouse. An endearing chronicle of Michelle Obama and the emotionally charged life she, along with her family has lead. I could not wait to read each page wanting more of a glimpse of not only her storyline, but also the goings on in the Whitehouse and grassroots community initiatives. What an amazing snapshot of history in the making!

reviews: I loved how candid and forthcoming Michelle is in telling her story. From her childhood growing up in the south side of Chicago to her journey as a mother and partner to a man with a vision of change and hope, her authenticity is so refreshing and inspirational. I have recommended her book to friends and the first question I get is, “is it political”? I don’t think it is. It’s the story of a feisty, courageous, committed and devoted woman who is pulled into a role she didn’t plan for herself but handled it with grace and humility. As we witnessed her as First Lady, and since she’s reentered public life, Michelle is a passionate leader who has and still is making a difference. The book is well written and enjoyable!

reviews: Michelle Obama is a gifted and talented writer with a voice that calms and soothes as she reads her great story. I purchased the hardcover and audiobook. I am so humbled by this beautiful (inside and out), brilliant woman, her audaciously intelligent, humble husband, and a family that worked hard to give the best to their children. Michelle was raised with love, support, and hard work that permeates the framework of who she is before, during, and after the White House.  Knowing her and her family through this book gives me hope that the Obama's, including their daughters, will contintue to contribute to the greatness of this country as they did for 0ver 8 years.

reviews: Although this made me feel like a lazy mom, I know I can’t really compare myself to the First Lady who has two Ivy League degrees.  Her book was more thought provoking than I imagined, making me consider possibilities in my own life, while also offering an inside look at her incredible life.

reviews: I am a recently retired military member ... was never so proud of this amazing country in 2008 ...cried tears of joy...from Iraq as he was sworn in.Again, so proud to serve under the amazing man that was re-elected in 2012...he belonged ...and our country recognized ...Only to cry tears of sadness and fear of what would become of electing a man of such divisive antagonistic hateful words and actions...in 2016.She stayed “high” in her book (as they did every day in the WH) ..it is a beautiful recollection of amazing experiences ...we all know what the media portrayed of events...it was truly humbling to read the personal experiences Michelle Obama recounts in a heart warming, (sometimes heart wrenching) truth.

reviews: A wonderful page turner about the highs and lows of Michelle Obama's life.  I found the story of her years growing up in the Southside of Chicago the most interesting.  It is a fascinating success story about a spunky little girl whose competitive drive and encouraging and supportive parents allow her to achieve the remarkable - Princeton and Harvard!In adulthood she comes across as down-to-earth, smart  and very loving, especially with her children.  It is a story of her life rather than the politics whirling around her.  Rising above the bad, unfair and exaggerated press reports she learns how to make the most of each personal encounter.  And, of course, she shares everything with her partner and friend, Barack (or 'Barry' as his childhood friends called him - interesting tidbit).

reviews: Becoming is an intimate honest sharing by a thoughtful uplifting women that our entire country was blessed to have been thrust into the spotlight as First Lady.  Enjoyable reading giving a picture of family life in the White House by a very special family.  In today’s often depressing reality portrayed by the current President. Reading Becomng is a great way to be reminded of the wonderful eight years our country had and gives hope for the future.

reviews: La vida de esta espectacular mujer sirve de faro para todas aquellas que en ocasiones nos olvidamos de que nunca podemos perder la esperanza.Como persona, mujer, profesional, hija, hermana y madre  nos da lecciones de vida.Es amiga de sus amigos, compasiva, fuerte, inteligente, resistente, valiente y luchadora.Ya desde lejos, sin tener toda la información, la admiraba,  ahora, conociendo de cerca su vida, he aprendido a ser mejor ser humano y la admiro todavìa más!!! Fue triste terminar el libro!!!

reviews: You will laugh, you will cry and you will smile. This is an incredibly written book from one of the classiest woman in America. You can hear her voice come off the pages, and she shares not just political things, but a lot of personal things as well. It’s so heartfelt and a great read.

reviews: Loved this memoir by former First Lady Michelle Obama. It depicted the rigors of politics, the heart wrenching moments of gun violence and the endless responsibilities of being a woman, a wife, and a mother on the National and World stage. I learned and I teared up while absorbing such a remarkable and honest story. I loved the dignity shown by the Obama Family while their every movement or word was heralded or rejected, or critiqued by so many. Becoming is a book I would recommend highly and I feel that all women will find notes of “connection” in the story of a young black girl who always asked herself, “am I good enough?”

reviews: What an insight into the life of such a beautiful and refined woman!  I always felt she "had class," but learning about her roots, her challenges, and her dedicated work to make society better for all was awe inspiring.  With all the hateful words and name calling from our current "leader," it was so refreshing and inspiring to follow her and the president's journey to the White House.

reviews: Written from the heart start to finish.  From a humble beginning she pushes through prejudice and accepted norms. Enlightened and motivated by her extended family to work hard and succeed.  Very enjoyable.

reviews: I believe this is one of the best books I have read in a long time. In reading some autobiographies I get bogged down and have to put the book down in the middle, perhaps never to pick it up again. Not so with "Becoming". I was intrigued with every page; Michelle Obama's excellent and articulate writing coupled with her honest portrayal of the lives of herself and her family kept me interested to the very end. I laughed at times and at times I got choked up; her story leapt to life on the page.  I recommend this book to everyone, for an insightful look at a very accomplished and  extraordinary life.

reviews: Michelle shares herself completely in this lovely autobiography from growing up amidst her loving extended family in south side Chicago, to meeting & falling in love with her driven, brilliant “unicorn”, to her adventures into and through eight years In the Whitehouse. She was always growing, caring, giving, & infused with a deep sense of moral character and courage.  Our country was lucky to have her and them for eight years.

reviews: I enjoyed the entire book, though found the second half, 'the presidency' extremely interesting.  What is required, on a daily basis, for the presidents family, and even more for the president, is almost beyond belief.  That Michelle and Barak Obama are both extraordinarily gifted and special people was never in any doubt for me,

reviews: I couldn't stop putting the book down! It was a good memoir of the former First Lady's life on Becoming who she is today.  I laughed, cried, and felt all the emotions she went through in her past through this novel.

reviews: My wife found this book amazingly written and thought provoking, especially with the challenges faced today. This book is very relatable for women today whether they are career-driven, a working mother trying to balance work and life or a supportive wife trying to preserve her own identity. What she describes as her journey through all of that while providing much needed insight into what the presidency entails and what she made her role thrive as first lady garners much respect.

reviews: Michelle Obama is so open and honest about her childhood and her years of being the wife of a politician.  She is truly a great lady who has done so much good for all Americans.  I applaud her.  She is a great role model for all women.

reviews: It was like being in the mind and emotions of the girl next door who became the first African American first lady. Where she came from and how she weathered through uncharted waters while keeping her family number one. Her humanity is what makes this a must read for women. Especially those who struggle through managing work and home life. Trying to keep mind, body, soul and spiritual aspects of health all in proper balance

reviews: I enjoyed learning about Michelle’s early life as a young woman in South Side Chicago to becoming the First Lady of the United States. You get a glimpse of Barack as an up-and-coming law student in the first 100 pages, so there is plenty about Barack. She went into great detail of the Iowa primaries in 2008 about how that would set the tone for the presidential elections that year. Overall, this book is meant to empower young females to achieve their goals themselves and Michelle saying that if she could make it then anyone can with hard work and determination.

reviews: Enjoyed reading this moving biography on our former first lady.  Loved her candid discussions of growing up in Chicago and her movement into her professional life and her life as First Lady. Felt her concern and care for our nation as she tried to keep some semblance of a normal life for her family.

reviews: Mrs. Obama is a gifted writer who knows how to tell her story. I enjoyed reading this one, but for a few pages of campaigning travels that I skimmed. She is open and honest and has further tossed herself into the public eye by laying it all out there, but with class.

reviews: What a remarkable story from a remarkable lady. I was fascinated by her truthfulness, resiliency, intelligence and how humble she is. She has stayed true to her roots and heritage and I am proud to have lived during this era and see her be the best FLOTUS to ever lived in at the People's house built by slaves. Such a moving story and shows that with hard work, self-respect and love we can all make it far. Love you Michi!

reviews: I absolutely loved learning about Michelle's side of the story, from her childhood to their departure from the White House. I believe this book was intended to be a feel-good book, and to be enjoyed by all ages, by which I mean it is an easy read. This doesn't diminish its value, in fact I think it enhances it by making it accessible to a larger audience. It is not gossipy, or narcissistic, and while I would have loved some juicy details, Michelle has remained her classy self.

reviews: This was our small book club's selection for our next meeting.  It was assigned at the beginning of December and by our meeting in February, several members still had not finished reading the book.  We all have active lifestyles, and the holidays did play a part in the length of time it took for us to finish reading the book, but it took longer than all the other books to finish or almost finish reading.  It was a very well written book, with the preciseness of detail that you would expect out of a lawyer.  It was open and honest, especially about her personal feelings and attitude.  I learned a lot about Michelle, her family and her husband and his family that I did not already know.  After reading her book I feel she is a regular person, slowly accepting the fact that she really isn't as regular as most of us.

reviews: I loved how she was able to smoothly segue to each memory of her child, teen and adulthood. I was surprised how effortless the writing was to achieve this.I related so much to her upbringing which was cool because I did not grow up to become a lawyer or First Lady of the US. The life lessons she was told were similar to what a lot of us learn as we grow up and mature.This book was genuinely written very well.

reviews: Michelle takes the reader through three important stages of her Becoming. She first gives us valuable insight in to her education from the south side of Chicago through law school. Then she allows us to see the role and the demands of a presidential campaign on the spouse and family of the candidate. Lastly, she shares with the reader the demands of a First Lady who is also focused on being a good mother, a loving spouse, and a role model for women and especially girls.

reviews: I love Michelle Obama and everything she does. This memoir certainly contains interesting and an inspiring story. When you need to be reminded that you can also do it, this is a great read. I might cut a little bit of the book though as it can get a little repetitive at times.Though a great insight to how the most privileged people on the world struggled and thrived through it all.

reviews: Thank you for give us such an detailed insight into your life before, during and after OUR time in the White House. Your family is amazing and you make all of us proud. Thank you for sharing your life!

reviews: I appreciate the explanation of her background, growing up in a loving family, valuing their input without stifling growth. Creating a picture of what must have seemed like single parenting a few times, yet remaining true to the family unit. Most of all speaking the truth, without spin, of the highs and lows of being a part of the nation’s first family.

reviews: This book exceeded my expectations. I learned much more about Michelle Obama and my respect for her grew. Her resourceful personality , fierce determination to empower people , courage on many levels and her portrayal of her husband, makes a fascinating read.To be the initial First Lady of colour , to making a real difference in the lives of many , and a very positive parental figure , daughter , sister , wife , she is a fascinating woman of this century. She will continue to make a difference.The book is fluid and accessible to many audiences.

reviews: M. Obama's book was worth every minute that I spent reading it.  I laughed; I cried; I even took some notes.  (Everyone has a story and everyone's story is worth telling...but I don't think they're all worth reading!)  M. Obama's story is not only  inspiring, but helps us walk a mile in her shoes.  She shares her life as a daughter, a wife, a mother, a volunteer, a caring citizen and as our First Lady.  I loved her book and highly recommend it.

reviews: Michelle’s story is relatable on so many levels. Whether you support her or not, this one is worth the read. Her imagery is very vivid, taking you back to her South Side upbringing, her internal personal struggles and journey through life. Being a working mom with a husband also simultaneously trying to make a lasting impression on this earth. She lays all out there, all the questions we ask ouselves, the burning curiosity about the presidency.

reviews: I bought this book as a Christmas gift for my wife and she indicated it was one of the best presents that I could have given her this year! Very positive in every way and that is what we need in this negative world we seem to be living in these days!  She and Obama were a real asset to the American people and we miss them very much!!

reviews: Michelle O. does not always present an unbiased view of her life, but she is always brutally honest.  She shows us the many sides of her extraordinary self; and she is definitely NOT the "ordinary person" she thinks she is!!The amount of love and respect she has for her family,children in general and our nation is boundless.Anyone with a curiosity about the White House and the political scene will be mesmerized from the beginning to the conclusion of her story.  One wonders what unexpected marvels we can expect from the next chapter of her life.Review by a white retired school principal from the south.

reviews: It's interesting reading the First Lady's autobiography. She writes well, and she is candid and honest - I really enjoyed Michelle Obama's book. It is an important document about the society she was a part of when she was a little girl - things we take for granted today that unfortunately were not to be taken for granted back then. A book I would warmly recommend.

reviews: I loved this book for the inspiration it offered and Michelle's very down to earth writing style.  Those that say this is about "self-pity," don't know the difference between self-pity and the inevitable sadness that goes along with every aspect of life. But again, the jewel of this book is the inspiration and hope it offers to all that have faced difficult challenges and have persevered.

reviews: I really enjoyed learning more about Michelle Obama’s life growing in a low income family and her success in her own right before Barak.  I thoroughly enjoyed getting a peek into the impact on family life of living in the White House. I also really appreciated her sharing not just facts but feelings. I entered this book already respecting her and exit it respecting her even more.

reviews: A black girl from South Side of Chicago becomes a First Lady, that in itself is extraordinary. Although Michelle Obama considers herself an ordinary woman, she is more humble, caring, determined, and patriotic than most of us. The book opens our eyes to life of a working class black family that a few would consider as All American in their ignorance and prejudice if they had not read this book. There is much we need to learn about black life in America than what the evening news portrays. A must read for all Americans.

reviews: I loved this book because it gives such a clear picture of the sacrifices and rewards of public service. Also of value is the story of the journey of a woman who could have been marginalized but who with the help of good parents and good schools achieved her potential. It inspires us to try to reproduce the qualities in others so that more people might live fully realized lives

reviews: First off, let me way I am not a left wing type person.  I have more of a right wing view.  This book however is one of the best books I've read in quite awhile.  She and Barak are truly remarkable people.  Well worth the money

reviews: I really enjoyed how First Lady gave the readers more insight of what went on in the White House; not just with mr. president but with the girls as well. I thought it was awesome how she still tried to keep their lives as normal as possible in spite of there new normal. I will admit is was hard to read because First Lady has so many words lol but I’m glad I stuck with it until the end.

reviews: I picked up this book and could not put it down.  I am proud of my First Lady and all that she represents.  This became my journey as well as hers. I lived this story with each turned page. I will read it again. Bravo Michelle Obama!

reviews: I really enjoyed how Michelle's book is written. It is interesting, honest, funny at times and provides a great picture of what life in the political spotlight was like for her. Being Canadian I hadn't paid a lot of attention to American Politics, but now I wish I had. I loved the book and admire Michelle Obama greatly. A true role model for us all.

reviews: Can't wait to read this book, it has such great reviews, I bought 2 to give one as a gift😁

reviews: Felt like I got to meet her personally. She is so down to earth, ambitious, caring, and relatable. She seems to be a supportive wife, encouraging mother, and the best first lady of this time. She truly cares for her country. She deserves all the success she has garnered and is a great role model for all women. This book was a real page turner. Rich in history and personal reflection. I truly enjoyed reading it. Grateful to my hubby for getting it for me.

reviews: I did not expect to become so riveted by Michelle Obama’s book that I would not put it down. She is a gifted storyteller and the retelling of her journey was honest insightful and sometimes raw. I thought I knew most things of the White House years from news etc ..but her insider perspective was seriously WOKE... nothing gets past her observation...I am deeply grateful for her service and  her husbands..and for the telling of it.

I thought I knew most things of the White House years from news etc ..but her insider perspective was seriously WOKE... nothing gets past her observation...I am deeply grateful for her service and  her husbands..and for the telling of it.

reviews: Michelle Obama just bares all!  I love how she retells the story of falling in love with Barack; and then the difficulty of raising two small children while Barack is away in the legislature 5+ days a week.  Although the book deals with the political side of her life, the most endearing parts are the stories of her "becoming" and her reminder that we are all honing who we will become on a daily basis.  Inspiring and lovely.

reviews: LOVED learning about the early times of Michelle Obama, how she and Barak met, courted and married, their struggles to have children, their strong connection to family, and some insight into Barak Obama's drive to try to make a difference in ordinary American's lives and leave a lasting legacy, along the way overcoming blind hatred.  This is a great ready, and I'm savoring it.  I recommend it highly.

reviews: I loved the Obamas and especially now, with who our current president is.  This book was very well written and I couldn’t wait to read it each night.  I actually felt like I had visited the White House.  Thank you, Michelle, for all that you did as First Lady.  You inspired the country to go high...Even when it is hard...your whole family made the country proud.

reviews: I was so looking forward to reading this book by Michele Obama.  And it didn't disappoint.  I was interesting to read her side of things, because you read about certain things in the media, but Mrs Obama is very candid.  I know It would be very hard on children to adjust to White House living, but in reading her book, the first lady seems like she had handled it very well. It appears the girls are well grounded. Good book. I recommend it to anyoney.

reviews: What an amazing journey and what testimony to family values. I appreciate the life experience of watching true values lived by in every situation on any day. I deeply miss this truly presidential family leading this country. A country I chose to follow my husband to during his military service. The only regret I have about this book is that despite my pace to enjoy it slowly it came to an end.

reviews: I have always been an MO fan even though I knew very little about her life.  Becoming, is the appropriate title as she shares her life from childhood to present.  I was impressed with her candidness and honesty.  I suppose I could go on but I am not one for a lot of words.  Suffice to say that I enjoyed every word and page.  Now that I know more about her life I totally understand why I liked her in the first place.  Ralph A. Carlson

reviews: Very good book about the ultimate over achievers. Loved her growing up stories, but it surprisingly starts to drag after she Meets Obama. Then it picks back up when she talks about her girls. I guess it’s thumbs up for all the family stuff. Thumbs down on talk about the elections and First Lady policy’s, programs, etc. for me anyway, that gets boring after a few pages. Anyway It’s still good and worth the money.

reviews: This book inspires everyone - certainly every woman - to embrace what is possible and make it reality.  It’s a book about vision, generosity, authenticity, optimism and hard work.  We all have the raw material to move foreword: the challenge is to keep aiming high, to continue sharing resources and opportunities equitably, and to be hopeful.

reviews: A wonderful reminder of what grace, dignity, and family love should look like. This book reflects the author’s humble dedication to using her talents and perseverance in the not so user friendly world of politics while maintaining her higher calling as wife, mother, friend.
text: A wonderful reminder of what grace, dignity, and family love should look like. This book reflects the author’s humble dedication to using her talents and perseverance in the not so user friendly world of politics while maintaining her higher calling as wife, mother, friend.

reviews: As a 67 years young African-American women so much of Mrs. Obama's story is relatable.  Her struggles, her frustrations, her obstacles, and yet her perseverance, her determination, and her  joys are the threads that connect to my life experience.  I thoroughly appreciate her willingness to share her journey thus far in her life.  I believe she is just "becoming."  AND THE BEST IS YET TO COME!  May God bless her and her family.☺

reviews: Michelle is a natural story teller. Honest and straight from the Heart.  I could hardly put the book down.  The times our chaotic and hostile, but she keeps her head up an finds the Good and Positive in everything.  She is a Saint on a Mission.  In her own little way she will change the hearts and minds of the doubtful.  No matter what side of the aisle your on, you'll find her truth your truth.  It's that simple!

reviews: I loved the book, easy to read, words just flowed.  Especially appreciated it, because of the similarities to my own challenges and accomplishments growing up in Chicago’s Pilsen neighborhood.  Wonderful to read about the many initiatives Mrs. Obama completed as First Lady, why they were chosen, how they reflected on her upbringing and how she paid it forward.

reviews: I purchased two books - for myself and a friend. We both admire the accomplishments of M. Obama and I bought these after watching her Netflix doc. It’s a great book and details her life. Light read and have now gave it to my teenage daughter to enjoy. We need young women and men to admire hard work and perseverance opposed to what they see on tv/social media - instant gratification - and this books shines light on those roads taken.

reviews: the hardcover copy is poorly put together.  Print is so faint and terribly small I could hardly read it.  I bought it first and gave up reading it, so I then bought the Kindle version.  It is a wonderful, informative book.  I don't believe the one-star people ever read this book.  An interesting side idea in the book is it shows what a very hard life campaigning politicians and their families endure.

reviews: A really well written memoir.  It gave much insight into the life of the Obama family, where they came from and how they navigated the rise to the White House with their children.  Michelle Obama is a wonderful example of a strong career woman, who managed to find her place in the world, and maintain balance with a strong motivated husband.

reviews: Listening to Ms. Obama read her own words and reading them closely...I love her and her family (if it’s possible) that I did before....truly self-made people who worked hard for all they have achieved and become.. these are the American exemplars! These are people worth following, knowing and admiring!  I am proud to have voted and believed in them. Thank you Michelle Obama for giving us the gift of you!

reviews: My neighborhood book group selected this book. I found it fascinating to learn of the trajectory of Ms. Obama's life; her thoughts were reflective and she learned from the experiences of others around her.  With sharing that she and Barack sought marriage counseling to iron our some time issues in their lives (she was pretty regimented and he was more easy-going), she showed us all that relationships take conscientious intent. She allowed us a peep into the workings of the White House which was illuminating.  I thought the book was a bit on the long side and that some chapters might have been shorter.  This is a worthwhile read.

reviews: I am so glad I read this book.  It truly shows from being a young child to a grown women all the ups and downs that she had to go thru.  Our First Lady was that, a Lady!!  She is what we should strive to be and that is not to put on airs but to be the best we can be.  Thank you for sharing your story.  I do believe that you have made an impact in lives and will continue to do so!!!

reviews: I fell in love with the Obamas after the 2004 Democratic Convention. Both Michelle and the President are a class act, through  and through. Michelle 's journey is fascinating and outstanding. Her parents are a great example of how to behave toward your children. Michelle 's depiction of her journey is a testament of integrity, honesty, unbiased love, and the good old American work ethic....consistent hard work can and does pay off. Awesome read!

reviews: This was a for sure a labor of love, it was inspiring, uplifting, emotional, and  RELATABLE to anyone. I couldn’t put it down and together with seeing Michelle Obama live at Barclay’s center, reading this book was life changing. Buy it and give it to all the important women in your life, and then ask the important men in your life to read it too.

reviews: This is a good book. I enjoyed learning more about  Michelle. I found it quite interesting to learn about her childhood, family, upbringing,  and life experiences.  Michelle is honest and open sharing her story.  It got a little slow for me at times, however, I  definitely recommend the book and I’m glad I read it.  It’s valuable to learn about the experiences of people who grew up very differently than yourself.  I especially enjoyed learning what it was like for her growing up a black girl in Chicago.

reviews: Great read.  Wish it was required reading in high schools.  Not because of any political agenda, but because young women, especially young women of color , need to hear her words.  They offer advice and hope.

reviews: A thoughtful look into the formative years of Michelle & Barack, where they came from, & their experience as the First Family. With humility & grace Michelle chronicles the public & private life of her family. I recommend for all interested in humanity & the character of leaders.

reviews: Excellent, informative, written from the heart, humble.  So glad First Lady Obama shared her truth and journey as well as her service.

reviews: Truly eye opening. Such intelligence graced with humility. I to am not a fan of politics but I am a fan of  ethics and of dignity. I am a fan of  compassion and of Human rights with liberty and justice for all. I also love my country and will also remain optimistic with hope for its future as a part of our global world. Thank you Michelle Obama for all that you have done and continue to do not only as a great woman, a great American but as a great human being.I highly recommend this must read auto biography. In fact I plan to read it again with a highlighter.

reviews: Insightful, poignant, and candid view into the world of the Obamas. This book allows you to feel what it was like to be in Michelle’s shoes. How she and her husband fostered a time of hope and progressiveness, while raising two young girls in Chicago and then the Whitehouse. Supporting her husband while maintaining her own identity and fostering her own initiatives. An inspiring read.

reviews: What a great writer - she eloquently explained her life story as any smart woman would and her story was engaging and relatable.  When her story got to the white house, it was a very interesting look into the role of first lady balancing first wife and first mother roles.  What a great read...or in this case listen. Very uplifting in a time when women are being bashed in general,  and other crazy crap is going on.

reviews: Reading “Becoming” felt like spending the weekend with Michelle Obama and getting to better know a woman I respect deeply, am grateful for and yet, have never met. She is an exceptional woman whose life has followed an extraordinary path and on these pages she brings us onboard for the journey. Beautiful.

reviews: For the most part this was an insightful book into the heart of Michelle Obama.  I didn't need as much about Barack, although the way their personalities worked together was of interest.  I would recommend it, especially to those who have formed a negative impression of Michelle based on what the media and her detractors pushed.  It changed my mind about some things I was told that were out of context!

reviews: I enjoyed being invited into the Obama’s family. At times I felt I was secretly spying on them. I now have a much better understanding of life in the White House. I always felt the First Lady and President Obama were exceptional people, and this backs that up. Thank you for opening yourself up to your admirers, Michelle. Anyone reading this book will be given incentive to reach inside themselves and discover more than they could ever dream of finding.

reviews: I love this book. I had gotten the kindle version and wanted the hardcover book too. I have read other autobiography books of First Ladies and this is by far my favorite. Michelle Obama is an inspiration for young people and women around the world. Reading her book brought tears to my eyes in certain parts. She is a true First Lady in every meaning of the world. A lady with a genuine heart.

reviews: I love Michelle Obama and I loved this book. It was entertaining, informative and provided a lovely picture of what formed our forever First Lady. Her life, while not a bed of roses, has certainly had its moments. I was totally jealous of her relationship with her mother. Without her mom she could never have become the woman we so admire. I love her. She made me proud and she wrote a lovely book.

reviews: Sincerely, better than all the hype says. I'm glad I overcame my aversion to reading what "everyone is reading". Also glad she spent most of the book on her childhood and the "getting there", vs being in Washington. That was interesting too, though. It was all wonderful. Didn't want it to end. It makes me miss the classy, warm, edifying and uplifting Obamas all over again.

reviews: I have enjoyed reading this book about your life, struggles and victories!What a wonderful and inspiring  family you are! I just want you to know how much I and others  miss you and Barack as President and First  Lady.Both of you have been a hard act to follow as what a President and First Lady should be. I wish you all the best in the futureThank you for sharing your life with us.

reviews: Michelle Obama is the most amazing role model for everyone- she sets an example to every single person. This book was entertaining, captivating, and eye opening. It caused many a revelation in my life and I am deeply sad that I have closed the last page. Thank you Michelle

reviews: Michelle Obama’s journey is different than mine in many ways. But our common humanity links us, our common experiences as women trying to be successful in a male-dominated professional environment links us,  her care and compassion for all people of all races links us. I found this book to be interesting and challenging, and as a white woman, sometimes a little painful to read; but it is a journey well worth taking and I’m glad I did.

reviews: Realistically positive in its approach to personal development, growth and political attainment. It is a refreshing contrast to the lack of civility and negativity that exists in our current political scene.  Programs and efforts described are real and effective. It gives hope for possible days to come.

reviews: I enjoyed hearing about her life and how she became the person she is.  She seemed to have a sense of what she wanted to accomplish in her life at a very young age.  She is remarkable and I love the memories she shares about her and her brother and how driven she was to accomplish things that were not a given for her.

reviews: I finished the last 35 pages of Michelle Obama's memoir-to-date yesterday morning, just in time for last night's Book Club meeting.  My one amusing contribution to our discussion was that, while reading Michelle's account of her relationship with Queen Elizabeth, I had a conscious thought that I might be able to reach out to her - to ask her if she would consider arranging an introduction to the Queen in advance of our visit to London next month.  Within seconds of that initial thought, I came to the realization that in spite of the candor and intimacy shared in her book, I don't actually know Michelle Obama, and don't have any better chance of meeting her than I do of meeting Queen Elizabeth.  LOL!

reviews: What a wonderful look at a woman’s life!  She is definitely a “home-grown” girl who made it good. In spite of her humble beginnings, she had enough drive to overcome her disadvantages. She also provides insight into the decisions and sacrifices she made as a wife, mother and career woman. I came away with the great feeling that we had the greatest woman we could ever have had as a First Lady!

reviews: I was eager to read the book and enjoyed it even more than I thought I would. It was written in a colloquial manner, with a positive spin on most issues. I specifically liked realizing that whether growing up in Chicago, or the Spanish speaking Caribbean,  of different  ethnic descent or economic class, what we learn in our family is what mostly defines us as persons once we become adults. Michelle Obama's parents and mine came from different places,but they shared the same moral principles ,  exerted similar discipline and had similar goals for their children. Education and being decent human beings were most important in both families. They had similar priorities- education and family.  The extended family also played an important role in both our upbringing. While Mrs. Obama's accomplishments exceeded those in my family, I could see glimpses of our upbringing in her story.

Proud to be able to give something of this caliber to young people about to begin their journey into their young adult lives!

reviews: Michelle Obama, Becoming is now a trademark, a standard, a ritual of optimism that has universally reset the stage. A guide for the faithless, the hopeless, and the unknown---- the invisible.

reviews: I didn't have any expectations going into reading this book. Quite frankly I didn't know that much about Michelle Obama.  I was pleasantly surprised to learn so much about her.  The book was a refreshingly 'real' view into who Michelle is and is not.  I highly recommend the book.

reviews: I wanted to read this memoir to get past the daily political nightmare we are living in and remember the genteel years of the Obama presidency.  The surprise in it is how beautifully, honestly, personally and revealing she writes.  She is a marvelous writer.  You will not regret buying this book.  I have two.  One for my bookcase and one on my iPad.

reviews: Excellent, I've always respected Mrs. OBAMA, but now it appears I 've been given a glimpse of who she really is, a down to earth person who is compassionate with a twist that only God could create, she doesn't realize her real gifts yet, but God will soon reveal them. She has much work to do for his kingdom, he was just preparing her. GREAT JOB FLOTUS. May God continue to guide you..

reviews: The first few chapters are a bit slow and I actually put the book down for a month about 100 pages in. After so many friends told me to keep reading I finally picked it up again. I was SO glad I did. I usually read Emily Giffin type books so this was a change for me, but I really enjoyed it.

reviews: This book was well written about a life who was so badly criticized being the wife of a politician. I enjoyed reading about Michelle Obama's humble life and accomplishments. Also learning more about our President. I suggest anyone with an open mind read this book. You will be pleasantly surprise what a wonderful family this truly is.

reviews: This is one of the best, most heartfelt and inspirational books I have read. I loved it from the first page. So interesting to know how many lives you and your family have touched. Well written and sincere. Once I got half way through, I forced myself to slow down because I wanted to know I had more to read the next day.  Have recommended to many friends and will continue to do so.

reviews: An honest, interesting memoir by a truly special First Lady. We need to listen to her voice of reason and of hope. It may be years before we take our country back to the promising level of the Obama years, but this courageous woman lets us know it is possible to do so.

Before meeting Barack Obama she made veiled references to discrimination.  But life with Barack Obama is not easy and she did not want him to run for President.  Interesting!

reviews: I purchased numerous copies and gave out as Christmas gifts.  Everyone immediately screamed when they opened it.  They are enjoying reading it, and even more so that it is a great keepsake.

reviews: I’ve always admired Michelle for her apparent kindness and her vision for making the world a better place. After reading this book, I’m humbled by her drive to lift others up, no matter what country they were in.  Her ability to look past the detractors and the viciousness in which they tried and continue to try to bring her down is monumental.  Her strength in remaining positive as the country headed south in terms of misogyny and racism and her unwillingness to give up.  Thank you for all you have done, and continue to do, to be an inspiration for women of every shape, size and color.

reviews: Beautiful story of courage, vision, hope and love. ThisFirst Lady's story is truly an inspiration for anyone who dares to try the handle on a closed but unlocked door.

reviews: I quite enjoyed it! I was uncertain what to expect, but as I read I became more and more invested. Overall, it is a resonant, compelling story which speaks on the balance of being able to confidently and firmly stand in who you are as an individual - moving with such a fierce, conscious intention. Also on accepting the fluidity and uncertainty of life - being a strong-rooted tree whose leaves still beautifully dance in the wind. Loved it! I walked away moved and intending to apply these lessons in my everyday life.

reviews: I always admired Michelle Obama but after reading Becoming I am in awe of her energy, resiliency, tenacity and compassion. I was only vaguely aware of the good she had done during the Obama administration but now see that it's been a lifelong journey for her. The pictures of her life that her words painted at times brought me to tears. I look forward to future Obama contributions to our injured society. We miss your dignity and decency.
