reviews: A beautifully told story of a woman filled with grace and intelligence. This is a reminder that every child deserves to be loved, supported, and educated because you never know where they might end up. Michelle Obama is humble and brilliant, and I look forward to seeing how she continues to advocate for children because we are only as good as a country as how we raise the next generation.

reviews: I gave this book to my mother as a Christmas present...she started reading it about a week ago and was enjoying it until she got to page 52/53 where the print was so light she could barely read it.  This continued intermittently with there even being a few completely blank pages until page 101.  After that the print is fine.  It would be great if we could get a copy that has every page legible in it.  We could send this one back. I didn't see anywhere other than the review to contact anyone about this.  Other than this she really enjoyed the book.

reviews: I loved this book - it was very honest and told a compelling story of what it's like behind the scenes of running for president and being the wife of the president.  It was nice to know how much security there is for the family of the president.  It was great to read about the effort Michelle made with the garden and healthy eating for children.  I highly recommend this book.

Her writing is a wonderful invitation to any reader who wants to get to know Michelle as a warm, talented, well-educated human being who has had to overcome hardships along the way.

reviews: Thoroughly enjoyed this book. Savored every word and shared excerpts w my husband who now can’t wait to read it himself. So relatable  Michelle Obama is an inspiration.  Felt kinship w her life experiences and the lessons she took from each. Knew a lot about her from press coverage but this book provides details that add depth. Grateful that she shared her incredible story. Can’t wait to discuss w friends.

reviews: Thank you Michelle Obama for writing this memoir. It is an important American story - A black woman from humble but loving beginnings, who pursued education with all her being and succeeded. Then when a man named Barack walked into you life I could not put the book down!  Then sharing the details of life in the white house, all from teh perspective of a dedicated and caring mother as well as a fully engaged First Lady - fascinating, revealing, vital story. I miss you in the White House but am happy for you that you are in the next phase. Highly recommend!

reviews: I'm so glad I read this book.  Michelle Obama reveals a lady with deeply rooted character, compassion and love.  She lays it all out -the good and the bad with such ease.  While it is easy to relate to her because she is so human, she transcends difficulty in a way that most of us can't bring ourselves to do.  Her remarkable story is an inspiration to all of us to be our better selves.

reviews: Michelle Obama successfully takes you through the journey of her life to date sharing the meaningful and inspiring insights of what it has felt like to come from a humble background in the mid west, be female,  a daughter, a sister, a wife, a mom, a professional and African American as she ascends to her unexpected position as first lady.  It is a book of full of truth, vulnerability, optimism and hope.  It is also an interesting first hand account of the realities of what it felt like to be inside the White House during the 8 years Barrack was in office.  This is an excellent read and an inspiring account of what it means to be an American and truly courageous and powerful human being.  She is an inspiration to us all.

reviews: I'm still reading this book, but I must say its an easy read, enjoyable & so interesting.  I gained more knowledge about Michelle and her being her own person, before, during and after Barack as President!  I love their love story!  The principles Michelle grew up on, she still carries with her & instills in her children, which is so refreshing to read about.Michelle has a special place in her heart for uplifting youth.  She uplifts me to want to do more.  I'm reading it every night!

reviews: So many nuggets of insight and wisdom that Mrs. Michelle Obama shares in this very heartfelt memoir. Powerful. On the last chapters she talks about visiting Nelson Mandela at 92 years old. He was imprisoned at 44 and released at 71. I thought about this for a few minutes: it's basically being captive from now until my dad's age. 27 years in prison! Unfathomable. My perspective on life as a First Lady has completely changed as a result of reading this book. Highly recommend!
text: So many nuggets of insight and wisdom that Mrs. Michelle Obama shares in this very heartfelt memoir. Powerful. On the last chapters she talks about visiting Nelson Mandela at 92 years old. He was imprisoned at 44 and released at 71. I thought about this for a few minutes: it's basically being captive from now until my dad's age. 27 years in prison! Unfathomable. My perspective on life as a First Lady has completely changed as a result of reading this book. Highly recommend!

reviews: Whether you like her politics or not, her book is well written and a great read.  Thoroughly enjoyed hearing about her early years and her earlier involvement with politics.  Learned a lot about Michelle and, of course, her husband and family. Lots of interesting previously unknown (to me) information and anecdotes about well-known public figures. Everyone I have recommended it to has also enjoyed it.

reviews: The book gives a very good insight into the political and social situation leading up to the election of America’s first black president. Also the Obama years are described, but - understandably - not with the president as the main player, but  showing Michelle’s own contribution to effecting change. I found reading the book fascinating.I also listened a bit to the audio version that came with the book. It is great to hear Michelle in her own voice. Great!

reviews: I just loved this book. You really got a feel for what it was like for Michelle Obama growing up, her hopes and dreams, and how her life plans changed over time and circumstances. You also got a wonderful inside view of living in the White House (no Thank you!). This is really well-written, with vivid stories and thoughtful discourse. What a wonderful human being! You just want to sit down and have a cup of coffee with her to talk about life or just the events of the day.

reviews: This book was a window into Michelle’s world as First Lady. She’s an example of goodness in so many ways. I appreciate that she focused on children and empowering others during her time in the White House. She pushed for positive change. It was really interesting to read about her approach and her experiences because she was a first in so many ways.I grew up in an area with very little diversity and I appreciate how this book opened my eyes to injustices I’ve never personally witnessed. I feel more informed.

reviews: I appreciate Michelle Obama's voice throughout the book.  She is honest about her experiences growing up as a young black woman and the prejudices her family faced, about her concerns for her children growing up in the public arena, and about her learning how to be an effective first lady.  She writes her story in such a personal way with humor and compassion that you feel she is sitting in your home sharing her life.  Becoming gave me greater insight into the life of a woman who overcame the odds to become the First Lady of the United States.

reviews: Becoming takes the reader through the life of one of the most iconic women of our time. And what struck me was how much I related to every moment. This book forced me to reflect on my own childhood and really look at how we treat each other a people. Laughed a little. Learned a lot. Grateful that she was brave enough to share her story. And I hope it inspires many young women to aspire to be greater than the limits society has placed on them.

reviews: This is such an amazing book/life!  At first I was somewhat uncomfortable reading it because I felt like I was intruding on Our First Lady's most intimate thoughts.  She is so honest and forthright about her life.  She told us about aspects of life that someone like me had no clue about.  Reading this, however made me miss those days, but gives me hope for the future with the seeds that were planted! Thank you for this amazing story!

reviews: I found the book to be an easy read. I liked getting to know the little girl who grew up in Chicago and eventually became FLOTUS. I wasn't aware of her passion for children and that she and the President tried to incorporate/expose children to activities at the White House. I enjoyed reading about her educational journey, and her resistance to politics. I found her frankness refreshing. I was embarrassed as a white, college educated, middle-class woman to the fact that racial discrimination and gender discrimination still exists.  I appreciate Mrs. Obama's willingness to share her story and family with the reader. After reading the book, I had a deeper appreciation of the sacrifice that each family member makes when their loved one decides to pursue a political role in our country.

I experienced Becoming as validation of my own life experiences.

reviews: Becoming is a book for everyone who has an interest in the American presidency and, in particular, the presidency of Barrack (and Michelle!!) Obama. Mrs. Obama writes with honesty and warmth about her early life In Chicago, about the importance of her education, about the shifting of her goals, and the significance of the two most important (to date) roles of her life: marriage and motherhood, all against the backdrop of life in the White House. This eminently readable book is an inspiration and a delight.

reviews: A truly enjoyable word-portrait of Michelle Obama’s life and the eight years she spent in the nation’s house with her family. I would say that the book is unsentimental but with heart-felt feeling, and determined without being driven. And if she can be hopeful regarding the future of our divided nation, so can I.

reviews: This book was like a pair of comfy slippers & robe. Once I had it on, I didn't want to take it off. Mrs. Obama's transparency with her life was inspiring. I laughed & cried & celebrated each success, milestone & tragedy related in this memoir. As a minority, Black & Female, Mrs. Obama's resolve to make a difference & be heard, made Becoming a beautiful mindset.  This is a must read for anyone who thinks their circumstances have them bound. Anyone can be. Everyone is. We are always Becoming. Kudos Mrs. Obama!

It’s not politics-heavy I promise.

reviews: I loved reading this book. It reinforced my perception of our very gracious First Lady. I admire and respect her even more now than I did before. I can’t even imagine how hard it must be to choose to go high when so many people around you are hitting low blows every chance they get. All the people who treated her and President Obama with so much disrespect and tried to stand in the way of every initiative they took to improve our country, need to read this book so they can hopefully realize that she and her family are like all Americans who love our country.  We love our family, and we forge our way through life with hopes and dreams to make things better for everyone.  It’s a great book. I wish I could meet her and President Obama in person.

reviews: Not only is it a well written book, it lets us into the emotional life of one coming "off the street" into a leadership position.  I am sure most citizens are not aware of the projects in which Ms Obama was involved.  We are not aware of all the things that were Done in education.  Thank you for taking the lead.

reviews: This takes you to the heart of Michelle and President Obama’s values and feelings. This is compelling reading (unless u R a republican). It gives you insight into how they view the world and why sound morals do matter to the US presidency.

reviews: This is a well written and thought book that details the perspective of former First Lady Michelle Obama, an authentic self-made, focused and committed to the noblest of causes of humanity: to inspire and improve the quality of life all citizens through honest effort and work. The details of her infancy, youth, and adulthood and lastly as a First Lady transpire unique aspects of her life, education, challenges and a constant assessment of her role as a woman, a mother, and a leader.

reviews: An amazing woman! I learned so many things about Michelle Obama that I was clueless about. She is so accomplished, smart, an achiever. The book is very well written  and an honest account of her life as a child, college student, lawyer, First Lady, and becoming more. If she lived next-door, I think I would invite her over for a cup of coffee or a glass of wine.

reviews: I LOVE this book. It's so real and down to earth. I have read it twice now...and enjoyed getting to know this classy lady. It is easy to see where her values were instilled from an early age...family matters! My daughter and granddaughter have both read it and feel the same as I do. It is like sitting down and having a personal conversation with Michelle Obama.

reviews: I love the the story, the writing but the actual physical book is flawed. I got to page 178 and the print is so light I had to strain to read it and I thought oh well, no big deal. But there are a number of pages in this chapter that are so light I can barely read it and I'm past the window of time I can return the product now so I'm pretty disappointed even though I think Michelle Obama is a fabulous human being and I want to read her whole story!

reviews: As I read Michelle Obama’s book, I realized I missed following the eight years she and her husband were First Lady and President. It opened my eyes to who she really was as a human being, her feelings and her persistence in moving through change. I felt like I really got to know her and the real person she is as well as her husband. I highly recommend reading “Becoming” for its humanity and it’s insightful background of both Michelle and her husband.

reviews: Michelle Obama tells a delightful life story, complete with struggles and lessons learned; and she demonstrates untold strength and versatility as she faces the challenges of highly unusual, new circumstances.I have admired the author of BECOMING from the day she entered our lives and find after reading this memoir that Michelle lives up to the integrity and many fine qualities I had credited her with when she became our First Lady.

reviews: This book is a very personal glimpse into the life of an amazing woman and her family.  Michelle Obama lays it all out there and is it good enough?  The answer is YES!  Her childhood, young life, adult life and  White House life are marked with happiness and hardships, laughter and love.  An outstanding book for all to read.  Thumbs up, girl!

reviews: What a journey that Mrs Obama has shared with us! Thank you for the honesty, vulnerability, transparency, and most of all the love that exudes from each page! This book has given me the courage and permission to be myself and know that I’m not strange to want make a difference in this world and for my life to have impact on those around me! Thank you Mrs. Obama and president Obama for your previous leadership of our country and for making a difference then and now! Blessings...

reviews: This book really seems to speak with Michelle’s voice which I appreciated. I would recommend this book to everyone- because I think there is a lot to take away and I suspect I’ll take something different on each read.It’s not set out to be inspirational. Michelle simply asks that you listen to her story in the way she wants it told. I found insights into not only politics but also the actual people involved in implementing those politics. Insights into not only Barack Obama the president but also into Barack the man & how he thinks. Insights not only into life as the first family but also into motherhood, parenting decisions and sacrifices.There is plenty more and I will definitely be rereading this!

reviews: I was pleasantly surprised at what a good writer Michelle Obama is!  Her book was well worth the money, kept my interest, and her story of their early years and their White House years was fascinating.  I highly recommend this book.

reviews: This book was the epitome of when opportunity meets preparation. I enjoyed how Michelle Obama’s drive led her to all the right places. It seems that she was a reluctant leader preparing for greatness unbeknownst to her. In large part she was lucky but she made her luck. I loved this story because she was just an American woman who took advantage of the opportunities she was given. She made the most of what she was given and I have more respect and admiration for her now than I did before. This story was definitely inspirational.

reviews: I was totally captivated by this whole book.  It is not only grammatically so well written but is excellent literature.  I have some issues with her discussion of the Whitehouse years. I found those most illuminating about all the various issues that she involved herself particularly with young women and her own children.The early years growing up on the South Side of Chicago were riveting as I have some familiarity with the area. I cannot recommend this book more highly.

reviews: This book has been an eye opening experience into a he life of Michelle Obama from her beginning to present.I was reminded of items I skimmed over in newscasts, and was glad to understand the backstory of some of them.For a white woman who knows what the feeling of invisibility is I was glad to see it expressed in a way that I know might be heard.

I can relate to her on some things while other things I don’t.

reviews: Absolutely loved this book.  Michelle Obama is a wonderful role model and a wonderful human being.  She brings humor as well as grace in her story.

reviews: Amazing book ! I like this book so much that I will recommend it to my book club. I felt like  I was reading a novel.  I laughed, I cried, and more importantly I felt uplifted. Every young and old person should read it. There are so many life lessons in it. I loved the Obamas before reading this book and I love them more after reading it. I am becoming! Thank you so much Michelle for everything you have done as our First Lady and mom in chief to make us so proud to be an American. I will continue to dream that one day I will be able to meet you in person. My son and I love you and your beautiful family a lot.

reviews: This book was amazing.  It took readers on the journey of an unlikely world leader and the people who helped to make her the person she became.  I enjoyed the entire book, but especially the sections on Mrs. Obama's life growing up in Chicago and when she met future president Barack Obama.  The photos were awesome too.  A must read.  Five stars.

reviews: I was apprehensive about buying this because While I am interested in politics I have trouble with political books because I get disheartened, and I generally don’t read memoirs, but I’m so glad I got it. It is very well-written and interesting; I couldn’t put it down. She does an excellent job balancing her story with Barack’s, the light with the heavy, the public with the private. It’s great to find out more about Michelle’s life, and to see Barack’s ascent and presidency through her eyes.

She shared the positive and even the negative which was shown from a positive growth perspective.  I thoroughly enjoyed this book and recommend it highly.  I was impressed with her before reading the book and more so now!

reviews: Humble, yet strong, honest and revealing!  This might just be Michele Obama’s greatest legacy; inspiring men, women and young people to put their heart and soul into everything they do and become their best.

reviews: The writing of Becoming immediately invites one into Michelle Obama's early life and the close loving family she was fortunate to have. Because of health issues, I was compelled to read it slowly, but perhaps that was the best way to become completely immersed. I never lost interest or forgot a thread or anecdote. If you haven't read Becoming, you have a great treat in store.

reviews: I loved this book so much. She was just like any other working momma out there. One minute she's working a job, juggling kids, single mom during the week, having Chipotle at lunch while sitting in her car to have a moment of peace and the next she's FLOTUS and living in the White House. I loved her authenticity and vulnerability in sharing her journey of self doubt and wondering "Am I good enough?" The fear of losing her identify as her husband became the Commander in Chief and how at the end of the day her responsibility and commitment to being a good mother never wavered. She is such an amazing woman!

reviews: A story of a professional woman who became the first African-American First lady of my country, the wife of President Barack Obama.  Her story is told with heart felt candor and humour. With a passion for making a difference, Michelle Obama shares her insecurities, convictions,and joys from birth to her last day as First Lady.  But truly, she will always be the First Lady.

With a passion for making a difference, Michelle Obama shares her insecurities, convictions,and joys from birth to her last day as First Lady.  But truly, she will always be the First Lady.

reviews: Michelle Obama is such an intelligent, caring, compassionate, accomplished woman that reading about her life was sheer pleasure. It was interesting to read how she was able to support her husband, Barack Obama, in his quest to become president, even though she is not a fan of politics. She has been able to do that, be a great mother and maintain her individuality.

reviews: What an amazing story. I feel like I know them all so well. Whatever your political affiliation, this story is amazing. I loved hearing about the visits with the queen! A great perspective and a refreshing story. I liked Michelle Obama before I read the book but I am now an outright fan!

reviews: This is definitely a page turner.  It was interesting to feel "connected" to the former first family and into the life of our nation's first black president. Michelle Obama is a very beautiful woman - inside and out.

reviews: 5 stars is well deserved. Mrs. Obama does not dwell on politics. But she does give us an insightful view of their lives through all stages in her life. The pictures she included were an extra bonus. Everyone should take the time to read this memoir.
text: 5 stars is well deserved. Mrs. Obama does not dwell on politics. But she does give us an insightful view of their lives through all stages in her life. The pictures she included were an extra bonus. Everyone should take the time to read this memoir.

reviews: Michelle has a crisp, direct, efficient writing style, yet personable and warm, too.  I felt she was in my living room, telling me her life story.  And what a love story!  Her love affair with Barack, her parents, her daughters, her White House garden, her staff — her list of people and things she loves deeply is long, revealing a woman of heart, as well as one of intellect and ability.  I am a 67-year old white man, and I loved this book.  Oh, how I miss Michelle, her husband, her daughters, and everything about her and her husband’s White House years.  And this book captures those years so well.  Thank you, Michelle!

reviews: I loved President  & Michelle Obama!  They were so proper while they were in the White House...such a strong contrast to what we have now.  Dignity is a word that comes to mind which we sure do NOT have now!

reviews: I had extremely high expectations for this book, which I pre-ordered along with tickets to the author’s book tour. Both the material and the presentation were everything I hoped for and more. Michelle Obama is a role model of character, dignity, and grace. I challenge anyone to read this memoir in today’s political climate without getting teary for how much we’ve lost. At the same time, it’s pure pleasure to relive wonderful moments in our country’s history through Michelle‘s graceful and humorous words.

reviews: This forever first lady's novel is beautifully written. She knows how to capture your attention and your heart. She is pure and I feel like I am becoming a different person when I read this book. I waited awhile for this novel to come out and it was indeed worth the wait.Thank you First Lady Michelle for your class, your strength, your intelligence, your truth, and for sharing your story to the world!

reviews: This book is filled with both optimism and realism- I could totally relate to Michelle eating a quick lunch and running errands on her lunch break as a busy (often solo) working mom.  Her story reminds us of the importance of education, and always lifting one another up.  While I was horrified by her school counselor’s negativity, I am emboldened to keep going in my own counseling job to motivate and inspire our youth.

reviews: Her book is filled with the same sensitivity, compassion, fright, laughter, pride, and motherhood that most women experience during their lifetimes. The inner workings of the White House highly interested me because of its small-city population where designated tasks must be accomplished every day. I had no idea what it required just to keep the place running. Not only is Obama a terrific storyteller, she is an incredible writer. I enjoyed every moment I spent with this book

reviews: This has been the most inspiring book I have ever read. It not only gives you an insightful look at Michelle, her life, and her journey as First Lady, but it causes you to reflect on your own journey. I love the way she brings her journey into yours regardless of its differences and/or similarities! I admire her balanced perspective of optimism and reality ; seeing what is good and hopeful and not down playing or ignoring harsh realities of an imperfect world. That is hard to do and is what makes her to me an inspiration for all who can realize where you start your journey is not as important as where your journey takes you. The journey is a continuing life long process .

reviews: Michelle’s Obama memoir is a great reflective narrative. Life and destiny are indeed engineered by God himself. The author through her story has proven anybody/everyone can become all they were created and endowed to become. This book is a great motivation for the “girl child.” She can rise above all the entrenched patriarchal biases, odds and labels to exploit her potential to the highest. The language in the book is strong, simple and understandable even with author writing with a lawyer’s mind. All things considered, it’s a great educative read.

reviews: I partly listened to the audio-version and read this book. *Btw, Michelle Obama reads the audio; sometimes I found that boring and other times inspiring.  I found it very insightful when Mrs. Obama describes her years living in The White House.  She's not a pedestal First Lady, she's actually quite accomplished and I admire her for that in itself.  She used big words sometimes, that I was thankful for a thesaurus,  but she really impresses me inside and out.

reviews: Michelle Obama’s journey from childhood to White House is certainly inspiring. I was continually amazed at her steadiness in the face of so much racial backlash . Here was a woman who leveraged her position for nothing but good, uplifting everyone she met, and not pandering to those institutions that felt she owed them her appearance.

reviews: I'm very unclear why a  reviewer remarked that Michelle Obama's memoir " Becoming"  was "... boastfully boring..." or some such words. This is a real and true voice, and I have rejuvenated respect for Michelle Obama.

reviews: I always read the low percentage comments first. Am amazed, truly fascinated, by the number of people who felt the book rated lower than 5 stars. Question: Why did people who obviously never liked the Obamas buy a copy of this book? Ah-ha! Probably just trying to figure out why they get standing ovations wherever they go, even years after they left the White House.

reviews: This book was wonderful! Michele Obama is such an unassuming person. Her autobiography is inspiring and enlightening. I don't usually like this genre, but I found this to be highly readable, interesting, and seemingly honest. I especially enjoyed the inside peek of the Obama family's life in the White House.

reviews: Starting from a humble home, Michelle tells the story of her journey to the White House. She gives us a glimpse of life as the First Lady we would never experience. I found her story very honest and intimate. I am left with the impression that she and her husband are two good people trying to do good in the world. I am left admiring them more than ever.

reviews: This is a feel good book for me. It tells the upside of the Obama’s story, but I feel it should have added a bit more of the downside of all the pressure they were under. I’m certain Mrs Obama suffered more before, and during their presidency than was revealed. But I still loved the book because it brought back the good old days of kindness, generosity, love, and respect.

reviews: With Michelle's unrelenting grace, she leads the reader through her own story and her own privilege to make a mark during her two terms as First Lady. Recognizing early on that she has the desire, insight and ambition to lead and make a difference - she succeeds with unyielding support of her husband and all those she surrounds herself with who compliment her efforts.

reviews: I had heard that this story was mediocre. I enjoyed all the history of the Obama era. I liked the fact that she included struggles for women and girls too. I was reminded of all the endeavors they achieved and their strong convictions to build the nation. I was moved by their relationships to the national tragedies they endured. I am glad it ended at the end of their term with not too much reference to how they are doing now. That should be the sequel.

reviews: A very engaging read. Michelle Obama is a down-to-earth, self-aware woman who shares her growing up experiences as she transitions from perfectionist people pleaser to the nation’s first Black FLOTUS. Her honest musings about decisions made and the trade-offs they led to should resonate with all women. I like and respect her even more than I already did after reading “Becoming”.

reviews: This is a wonderful set that came exactly as described. I am going to take the photo and writings and get them framed for the wall in my office. The signature is also authentic and you can flip over to the back of the page and see where the ink has slightly bled through - it is not a printed copy of her signature! This is a treasured keepsake and is so nice that I won’t let my kids touch it, lol! The book itself is also a great read and I recently watched the tv special which made the book even more interesting.

reviews: The former First Lady has always displayed a level of class that outshines all of the negative press she has received. However, I did not expect someone with such poise to show such self-doubt. This memoir brings her worries to light. Through her open vulnerability, Michelle Obama allows the reader to understand her fear of not being good enough, whether as a student, mother, or spouse. The honesty of her voice gives a glimpse into the heart of a beautiful, compassionate woman who portrays elegant strength in facing the challenges of her extremely public life. I appreciate the reluctance she describes over her husband’s decision to move into politics. Wonderful read!

reviews: Having completed the memoir by our former first lady, I like her even more than I did when she was in office. Smart, compassionate, loving, and especially hard working, Michelle Obama is definitely to be admired! I would love to meet her in person. Reading this book was like sitting in her living room and hearing her tell her story. Very articulate and thoughtful, she's centered and interesting as well.

reviews: I bought this book because of a deal on Amazon Kindle. I was hesitant at first, given some of the reviews. However, I found it a very interesting book. Michelle Obama is a great role model for any woman, which is the main reason I enjoyed the book. She is strong, independent, and thoughtful. The book is based on her entire life, not just life in the white house. As the president's wife, there are some pages that get political. Even though I am/was not an Obama fan, I enjoyed the book.

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed Becoming by Michelle Obama!  She has such a down to earth writing style that I felt she was talking to me the entire time, sharing intimate parts of her life before, during, and after life in the White House.  She is a truly gifted story writer and I hope I will get to see more of her on the Best Seller list in the future.

reviews: The book is great, but the printing company totally didn’t quality check a batch. There are sections of whole chapters that the ink is so light that it looks like a blank page. I was hoping to add pictures of the error. This is unacceptable. I really wish I could read the entirety of this book, instead of reading over 3rd or 4th page with legible printing.

reviews: I was inspired by Michele Obama’s well written words of faith, honesty, being a mom and a wife. She has inspired me at 73 years old to become a more open and vocal person about truth and faith, stronger and encouraging woman for other women and the optimism that there will be a better day and time in our politics. Read her story!

reviews: What a powerful read for women and males alike. This book gives you the insight on how Michelle became who she is today. I found the book to be very insightful and empowering at the same time. I would recommend it to my friends and family. I was sad when it was over.

reviews: Well written! Classy and refined and yet open and honest. I was squeamish as Michelle wrote in detail about her courtship to Barak and because he was our President it made me feel like she was spilling the tea... but it was reserved enough to keep some things private with just enough intimacy revealed about the Obamas lives!

reviews: I had not really decided what to expect about this book, and hoped it was not full of Political mumbo jumbo.  I was not disappointed, as it was very refreshing to real an honest account of life in the Political fast lane, as a reluctant politicians partner.  Some wonderful family descriptions throughout the book, of colourful characters.  Would definitely recommend.

Found it quite interesting that the University of Chicago had this kind of talent just outside the gates of the college but never reached out into the neighborhood to even explore the value of recruitment of students from that area.

reviews: MIchelle Obamas story is inspiring to see what parental love and belief in education can do to not waste a mind.  She can be proud of giving back to society what was invested in her by her parents. Makes you think about the hurdles the majority of the world faces not being born white and protected by money and connections.

reviews: If you ever wanted to know what it would feel like to be part of a presidential campaign, live in the White House, and see how children grow up in the public eye, this is the book for you.  Also, in this book, you really get to understand Michelle and Barack, their joys and stresses of being the President and the First Lady. I loved this book and will reread it, I'm sure.

reviews: I was amazed at how Michelle Obama's younger life was so relateable.  Amazed at her memories of her childhood. Amazed at the likeliness of "am I good enough.?" Amazed at her strength and stamina to be a great attorney, wonderful, loving and protective mother, and a super SheRo  to the 44th President of the United states. KUDOS!

reviews: Excellent book. Have always felt she was a great 1st Lady. Gives me a better understanding of both her and Barack. Loved reading about their up bringing and all their hard work to get to where they are today. Brilliant minds. We owe them so much respect for how they handled everything while living in the White House. God bless them and God bless the USA.

reviews: Michelle shares her life in a way that is truly empowering. Her downright honesty and pertinence in each word make it difficult to put the book down.  A must read for anyone who has a soul. This book will bring out the very best in you and force you to want to do more for humanity - regardless of how much you have done in the past.  Simply outstanding.

reviews: I’m so glad I read this book. I also bought the audiobook and loved listening to Michelle Obama in her own words tell her story. I loved it and I’m so glad that I learned just how really remarkable Mrs. Obama is. She’s beyond smart and tough she’s very wise.

reviews: I am not usually a fan of reading books that involve politics or the political process.  Once I was able to get past the first Presidential run, this book was much more enjoyable for me.  Very insightful. Well done.

reviews: What amazed me is how "normal" Michele's life and thinking  appears, given her opportunities and resources! Her growing years sounded much like mine from a white middle class perspective. Her family values, although more thought out and entrenched, seemed like mine! She has taken her opportunities and pursued them with purpose and energy. She is a feminine hero in today's life! I enjoyed reading this book!

reviews: Thank you to Michelle Obama for sharing a part of her intimate life with us. I am glad she authorized and written the story about herself. Michelle is an inspiring person in my opinion because she held one of the highest positions in the United State as a First Lady and was will Qualified, Knowledgeable and served as a supportive wife, mother and supportive nurturer for the U.S. In my opinion she was one of the most qualified women to be in that position as First Lady!

reviews: Michelle Obama represents all the qualities we’d all wish to have, intelligent, determined, honest, energetic, kind, charitable.  How lucky a person is to have her as a friend.  Her book is like having a good conversation with her, a delight.

reviews: I loved reading and reflecting back on what when on during those eight years and what has gone on for the last two years. Everyone should be such kind and caring people. Thank you for writing such an insightful book and being one of the best First Ladies this country has ever know. Empowering women will make a comeback. Much love, peace and happiness in all of your future endeavors.

reviews: I felt as if I was lucky enough to sit down and talk with Michelle Obama. Her intelligence is clear, yet she felt no need to use complicated or stilted language to tell her story. I am certain many young people, especially girls of color, and of less than optimal socioeconomic status, will read this and think: I, too, can be Somebody.

reviews: This was a book selected by my book club.  For me it was filled with one sided minutiae.  I would have preferred that a writer team up with her and interview several people in her personal and professional life to give a more balanced and interesting story. This one really fell short for a former first lady.  If I could have given it a half star rating I would have.

reviews: I liked her writing style - she really digs in and, I think, she is very honest - hard on herself when necessary but how interestng to get inside life, as the first African American family, to live in the White House. Can't help but just like them for who they are. Actually very normal and down to earth and I don't think they changed. I love that they love art and culture - so important in our lives.

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book. Repeatedly I thought to myself “this is me!” So many of the thoughts and feeling emoted by Michelle reflect my exact emotions, my experiences. It’s long but meaty. Thank you for sharing these wonderful details.

reviews: What I so enjoyed about this book is it felt very conversational. It was almost as though Michelle Obama was sitting down having a chat with me about her life.  Although there were some things I knew mostly since she came into the spotlight as the First Lady, I knew little else. It was a very refreshing read and captured her voice and spirit well! Highly recommend!

reviews: Certainly illuminating with respect to growing up as a female in twentieth century black Southside Chicago and continuing with an ambitious education and professional life on the way to defining her right  years as First Lady of the United States of America and as daughter, and becoming wife and mother through it all.  A remarkable work.

reviews: She is not one of my favorite people but the book helped me understand her better. She told about her fears and problems becoming First Lady. I think she started America’s change in attitude about food that was better for you. Focusing on the school lunch program helped those people in charge of it make better decisions to offer more choices and better nutritious food for children.

reviews: I especially enjoyed hearing Michelle read her book.  It felt like a long interview.  I had not given thought to what their day to day family life might have been like.  I felt such sorrow for the loss of normalcy she and the girls had in the major child-years of the girls.  I hope one of them will write a memoir when she is her mother’s age

reviews: Michele Obama's account of her life and experiences is pleasing to read. A very intelligent biography untrammeled by verbosity as so often mars personality accounts. Enjoyed it very much and found it irksome to have to put it down. A fine piece of literature, entertaining while retaining a strong element of realism and thoughtfulness.

reviews: I don’t read many autobiographies but so many people I knew recommended this book I decided to pick it up. Michelle had me at the first page. Fascinating to learn about her background and upbringing. As a white woman it was like peering inside a window to a world I have never experienced and knew little about. Thank you Michelle for sharing your story and thank you for inviting us in so “we can let go of the stereotypes” and “embrace the way we are the same”.  I have great respect. Bravo.

reviews: The Obamas are  ethical beyond measure. Michelle's open narrative of their experiences as a black family in the Whitehouse is both horrific and inspiring! This family sacrificed a normal life to make life better, especially for women and children. May they continue their work amid normalcy.

reviews: I have even more respect for Michelle Obama after reading her autobiography. I feel so proud of her and her accomplishments. It's almost like she was a childhood friend. Her writing is very well done too, easy to read.Thank you Michelle for letting us into your life!

reviews: Wonderful book. Enjoyed Michelle’s telling of her growing up, her education, early work life, then on to marriage and her very busy life thereafter. Her descriptions of juggling marriage, motherhood, leading into wife of a political husband. Her life opens like a blossom continually revealing new parts of herself. Loved the book.

I;m in the middle of the book, presently, and she continues to hold my interest to learn how things unfold in her life.

reviews: Compelling narrative, strong voice, marvelous  bird's eye view of the majesty, power, constraints and frustrations of living at the center of power in 31st century America.

reviews: This book is terrible! It tells an amazing story about a girl who had the odds stacked against her. It tells the story of office romance that turned into a life long friendship. It tells the story of the numbing truth of being in the spotlight while rasing your kids. This book is terrible because you won't put it down for hours at a time, you'll stay up when everyone else is asleep, and you'll find yourself thinking of paragraphs during your day that make your life better.Thank you for writing this book.

reviews: I so respected the Obamas for deciding to take the journey to challenge  our country to elect a person of color to its leadership.  In voting for Barack Obama i hoped for changes in how people viewed and treated those who did not look like each of us.  The Obamas exemplified the true meaning of being Presidential.  Thank you for this book but above all for service and sacrifices.

reviews: Reading this book is like talking with a friend. There are parts where you laugh, and parts where you cry. Sometimes Obama sounds like she can't truly believe she has lived the extraordinary life she leads, and that is a really delightful tone in a book. I enjoyed this a lot.

reviews: This is no 'rags to riches' story but rather that of a strong woman who worked hard and is still working hard to own herself, her story and all aspects of her life (womanhood, career, motherhood, everything).I found it a hands-on narrative regarding very important issues.I strongly recommend it as a must read for everyone because it isn't targeted to any particular racial audience. It's the story of a hardworking, determined and passionate woman.Thanks for this conversation Michelle!

reviews: In really glad I read Becoming.  It was quite a revelation seeing things through Michelle's prospective.  A look behind the veil at life in the White House.  Seeing how much she had to overcome and how hard she had to work to go to Princeton and Harvard and  get her law degree inspired me.  The sacrifices she and Barak made as president and first lady.  And the many successful initiatives she began while in office.  Very surprising and inspiring.

reviews: This book was purchased as a Christmas gift for a family member (I have not personally read it yet). She loved it and said she highly recommended it. I ordered it right before Christmas, with 2 day Prime, and it came right away! I LOVE Amazon Prime for those last-minute gifts!!! Don't know what I'd do with Prime!

reviews: I've truly enjoyed this book.  It is very well written and reflects the intelligence of the woman who wrote it.  I have an even deeper appreciation for the Obamas now that I have more of the back story.  I hope they both continue to stay active in serving the people of this country in whatever capacity their hearts lead them to do so.  Most importantly - this book has encouraged me to continue to do what I can to make a positive impact.  Buy the book.  Read it.  Encourage others to read it.

reviews: This is a beautiful and very moving story from a woman I still hope will one day be the president. We need her now more than ever. This is an autobiography that’s different than the others I’ve read before. She’s so open and authentic it really resonated with me and left me feeling very empowered.This book has touched my heart. As Barack once said: I love her and I can’t wait for the rest of the world to fall in love with her. Well I did. What a great woman.

reviews: Inspiring through and through! Excellence personified, as : appreciative daughter, sister, student, grad student, lawyer, wife, mother, First Lady, advocate (children, women, military families, marginalized groups), ad infinitum. A well told story about ethical commitment, perseverance and overcoming challenges....proving what’s possible in the United States of America, even against all odds.

reviews: I really enjoyed the book. Michelle was not "the little woman," standing behind her (impt) man. She was very well educated in a top ivy league university & law school, then hired by a prestigious law firm-- all before Obama even earned his law degree.  Women can easily relate to Michelle's struggles to balance family & her own career goals... until her husband becomes President! It's an interesting story, well told.

reviews: Okay book...probably the thing I found most interesting was how much SHE gave up to see him succeed.

reviews: Former First Lady Michelle Obama is truly a national and yes, a global treasure! Her book, Becoming simple confirms exactly how she came to be one of the most remarkable forces in our country’s current, recently past, and centuries past history! An amazing read that delivers renewed hope for our nation!!!!

reviews: Thank you Michelle for sharing your amazing journey thus far!  All the childhood joys and strength your wonderful parents instilled in you helping become who you are, to the understanding, loving wife , mother and Our true "First Lady"! I loved it all; again thanks for inviting me in, I cherished it all! Thanks  Eddist Rhett

Not only were you the First Lady, but you were a professional in your own right, not just another pretty face😂😂😂. I really enjoyed reading about the First Black Presidential Family.  Thank You for allowing the world, to this experience through your eyes.

reviews: I have the audio version narrated by Michelle. I thoroughly enjoyed the journey she laid out telling her story. A wonderful inside view of the life of the FLOTUS, mother and wife. Amazing listening to her share her story.

reviews: I loved the book at least the part of it I could read.  However, the first copy I received had the following 16 poorly printed or no-print pages: 178, 180, 181, 183, 186, 188, 189, 191, 194, 196, 197, 199, 202, 204, 205, 207.  Amazon sent me a replacement with the same 16 poorly printed pages!  I returned the second defective book but was notified in one email they received the book and in a second email they had not received the book and they would charge me again for the book.  Lesson learned: Check to make sure a book is printed correctly when ordering from Amazon - this is the first time I have ever purchased a defective book in over 70 years of reading books.

reviews: A reasonably detailed account of a magnificent personal and professional journey of an outstanding individual succeeding in several highly competitive environments who is now basking in the warm sunlight of world wide acclaim.  Personal and professional leadership at this level in today’s cultural environment doesn’t get much better!

reviews: I was truly impressed with this writing by Michelle Obama, her life from childhood until leaving the political arena. She is a terrific writer and she expresses herself in a very engaging manner. It was hard for me to put my Kindle down for any length of time. I was impressed with her ability to stick to her concerns and do something about them. Way to go Michelle!

reviews: I'm a big Michelle Obama fan, so wasn't surprised that I loved the book. I especially enjoyed reading about the family dynamics, raising kids in the spotlight -- but keeping them as sheltered as possible -- the inside scoop of living in the White House and their scandal free marriage.
text: I'm a big Michelle Obama fan, so wasn't surprised that I loved the book. I especially enjoyed reading about the family dynamics, raising kids in the spotlight -- but keeping them as sheltered as possible -- the inside scoop of living in the White House and their scandal free marriage.

reviews: I liked that she grew up and lived in the south side of Chicago and went on to be the First Lady and live in the White House. I grew up in Chicago too and I felt that it was a very hard core place to live. I remember the violences at the riots at the democratic convention. And riots at northwestern university. People are so prejudice and close minded and they don’t help each other. Chicago has only gotten worse. I am for no guns in the streets, businesses and homes of America. More mental health education and no drugs. I gave it 5 stars for writing honestly and trying to change some of the things that need to be changed.

reviews: I ordered the book, Becoming, for my wife.  She loved the book and it gave her a real perspective of what it was like for a Black President and 1st Lady to be the first to occupy the Presidency and Whitehouse.  They were such Class Act compared to the con man we have there now:-(. Buy and read the book...you can't go wrong.

reviews: She's a good writer and tells it like it is.  I got to know her and her family through this book.  Obviously, she had to be quiet and keep her mounth shut while she was in the White House.  She's a person of great integrity and ability.  She might've made an even better President than Obama.

reviews: I started this hoping to find some sort of formula for success. Other than pursuing a good education, I am still left wondering where that drive to succeed comes from. Easier for me to relate to and aspire to is the Obama’s drive to leave the world a better place. We need not feel powerless and consigned to accepting things as they are. Time to speak up and act!!!

reviews: My wife loves Michelle Obama as First Lady, and this book, according to my spouse, is beyond excellent, superb, (is that better than excellent?) I’ll read it after she is done. The last elegant, classy First Lady since Nancy Regan.

reviews: As I listen to the very disheartening and depressing news of the day, this book is an oasis for me to open up,and read. The flow and ease of reading this autobiography, is a parallel universe we are in right now. It gives me hope, it gives me a vision into the lives of two very extraordinary people. It gives me hope, we are a nation of immigrants, a melting pot, a blending of cultures, of the greatness, we bring out in each other. This book helps me see that working together, great things can happen.

reviews: I really enjoyed this book .. a very polished and easy friendly style.  Especially the first part about her childhood and also the early days of getting into politics. I was already a fan so cannot say if it will convert you if you are not, but it might. The book is not overtly political, just very human and all about a family caught in fame.

reviews: I don’t care for politics, but this book isn’t really about that.  It’s about Michelle and her life, thoughts, realizations.  No matter what political side you find yourself on, she is a woman like the rest of us.  She wasn’t born into privilege and she worked hard for everything she gained and she didn’t take it for granted.  I have great respect for this woman and I really enjoyed this book!  I would love some day to give her a hug!

reviews: Like most others report, it’s a page turner that is inspiring. It’s a great combo of historical & cultural relevancy mixed with words of wisdom from someone who is both down to earth and beautiful inside and out. I mostly appreciated the funny stories from public life and how hard she worked to keep family life as her dominant focus throughout.

reviews: This book was so beautifully telling a regular black girl who becomes a national treasure. The story in itself has inspired me and reminded me that we all have a purpose big or small. Even though with this presidency remnants of what this family left behind still resonant. I hope to play it forward by opening doors for myself and helping others through and leading them to door to open themselves.Thank you Mrs. Obama

reviews: Michelle Robinson Obama's story is one of strength, fortitude, and pure optimism.  She gives me hope for what lies ahead in this crazy and often hateful world we live in.  Her words of wisdom are very well stated and inspiring.  Thank you!

reviews: A glimpse inside the First Lady to be and the First Lady.  She is an inspiration and, in my opinion, she is one of the finest First Ladies.  I wish that she, as with many in her generation, would refrain from saying "Me and ...", as that annoys me.  However, the book appears to be written in her words and that matters more.

reviews: Michelle said, “I’m an ordinary person who found herself on an extraordinary journey.” What an extraordinary glimpse into the life of a First Lady.This book has deeply touched me, and I encourage everyone to read it as a piece of history—Republican or Democrat.

reviews: As I expected, this book delivered. Well written, so that the reader gets a vivid idea of each story told. One could totally understand where Mrs. Obama is coming from. I know I did, as a black woman. I recommend to all readers, not only for good reading, but for encouragement to continue to persevere, for both genders and all ages.

reviews: Terrific book, and very interesting.  Mrs. Obama was such a great first lady compared to what we have now.  She has a wonderful personality, and always had something going on at the white house.  She engaged people of all ages to get involved with her projects and everybody had a great time.  I recommend this book highly!!

reviews: "Becoming" by Michelle Obama upholds the recognition that she is a force to be reckoned with! Such an amazing, loving, and gifted individual! I never knew the half of it when she was in the public eye during her husband's presidency.  This book allows its reader a closer and fairer detailing of this woman; letting one get a better perspective of the depth and breadth of a truly wonderful human being. Well written and a pleasure to read!

reviews: I was caught off guard with how much I enjoyed this book. Thought-provoking, entertaining, moving and poignant... I found myself tearing up as much as I found myself laughing. I love Michelle Obama’s snarky -but never cruel or rude-humor, her cleverness. Her deep mind and passion for people. This book was such a joy to read.

I thoroughly admire how she, president Obama, and the girls presented themselves to the world. Michelle is an inspiration and I know her book will inspire me and women around the world. Her truth is captivating. Can’t wait to read.

reviews: This beautiful book reads like you are having a conversation with Michelle Obama.  The energy, thoughtfulness, hard work and passion put forth by the Obamas is amazing.  They have set a gold standard for leadership and morality.  I loved who they were and thank them for their sacrifices to serve our country.  I am saddened and frightened by our current president.

reviews: Michelle Obama has touched the lives of a grateful nation for the past 10 years. Perz is the story of love, faith, trust and triumph. As first lady, she exhibited the kind of grace and professionalism that symbolizes the true nature of this great country. She continues to inspire with hope and dignity and forever will be the standard by which future first ladies should be judged.

reviews: I wish I could give it another star! This women is everything and life and more! A real First Lady, a real Wife, a real Mother, Daughter, etc.... just so Humble, beautiful (inside and out) and of course stylish! Lol This book will make you love her even more! Yes, it’s possible lol I love you Mrs. Michelle Obama! MY FOREVER FIRST LADY!

reviews: Reading about the evolution of Michele Obama from a southside Chicago childhood to the First Lady was fascinating and inspiring.  In the turmoil of today's presidency, I felt a comfort in reading about rational, purposeful individuals and their pathways to their current selves. The book was well written and seemed direct and honest.  This should be "must" reading for young women re: the development of their own life story and as an introduction to politics on the personal level.

reviews: Becoming was a well written account of what it's like to be drawn into the world of politics and being the first lady! Not only the first lady, but the first African American First Lady of The United States. Mrs. Obama shares poignant emotions, personal insights, reflections and attitudes about her journey into the White House. I would highly recommend reading this extraordinary work of The journey to BECOME!

reviews: Ms. Obama's words confirm what I saw in tv interviews. She is strong, loving, caring and loyal to her family, friends and country. She leads me to be motivated to speak out more in praise of others good works and to educate my community in matters of bullying and bigotry and social injustices. This was an honest and positive read about our current society.

reviews: My takeaway is that this book should be on the shelf of every young girl.  It's a wonderful, true story that anyone can succeed even when coming from humble beginnings. Michelle has given us a raw, honest account of the rewards and difficulties to be encountered by those who have the courage to follow their dreams.  This is a well written look at some of the most private aspects of her family's lives and her own private thoughts.  I found that I couldn't put it down and I was sad when it ended.

reviews: I loved hearing Ms. Obama’s voice as I read her story. I loved how I could relate to her even though our backgrounds are very different. Maybe it’s because we are close in age, but there’s more than that. Obama weaves you through her life and the message is constant.

reviews: I finished this book while reading and sharing with a book club I'm in. All of us were truly wrapped up in the fact that we felt like Mrs. Obama was talking to us directly. We loved the fact that we could discuss what she shared in the book to everyday life. This book gives nothing but hope, and inspiration to many.

reviews: Although Michelle Obama’s national prominence and celebrity is due to her marriage with the United States First African-American President, more significantly, is the old phrase “Behind Every Strong Black Man, is a Strong Black Woman”. Understanding this simple quote, intrigued me to learn about the strength, the resiliency, the true of root of the legacy that the Obama’s will leave on this world. And like everything they touched, this book authored by the First Lady was nothing short of a generational masterpiece.
text: Although Michelle Obama’s national prominence and celebrity is due to her marriage with the United States First African-American President, more significantly, is the old phrase “Behind Every Strong Black Man, is a Strong Black Woman”. Understanding this simple quote, intrigued me to learn about the strength, the resiliency, the true of root of the legacy that the Obama’s will leave on this world. And like everything they touched, this book authored by the First Lady was nothing short of a generational masterpiece.

reviews: I was bowled over by my reactions to this book.  Without knowing a lot about Michelle Obama, I admired what I saw and heard, but this book has provided unusual insight into this exceptional woman.  Her recollections and reflections of childhood are piercing.  Her assessment of marriage truthful and thought provoking.  I learned a lot about the presidential process and am very glad not to play any part in politics.  A must read

reviews: This account of growing up black on Chicago's Southside seemed so genuine and introspective. For me, it seemed more about the power of women to "become" and the need of all women to nurture through friendship and love for one another. I highly recommend this book for inspiration to find and act on passion.

reviews: Read/listened to this book for a book club and I was surprised at how much I it! First of all, the author reads her own book which is a huge bonus for listeners. Secondly, I had little prior knowledge of her so the book was enlightening, interesting, and incredibly personal. Upon finishing, I had a new appreciation and respect for her as a woman, wife, and mother. Too bad she won’t consider entering politics!

reviews: A provocative memoir of a woman of humble beginnings, who led an extraordinary life. It was not a perfect life but one filled with insightful experiences and purpose. Each of her roles as a career woman, wife, mom and First Lady gives you a glimpse of how it all came together and still evolving into becoming the best person she could be.

reviews: Although I supported the Obamas throughout their political career, I had no idea what had brought them there. reviews: I felt my own personal growth as I read. This book was insightful, empowering, awe inspiring, tearjerking, but wrenching, and truly truly strengthening. To feel ypur own power in the story of others is the reason I read. It's the reason I write. So that another young woman may see that the steps of her journey may not include the beaten path but will be her path and important as she forges the way for other. Forever my FLOTUS! BRAVO!!

reviews: While the book started slow, I felt it was great.  I enjoyed hearing things from Michelle Obama's perspective.  She had a unique view of everything we saw play out over the eight years they were in the White House.  She gave the perspective of a wife concerned for her husband, a mother wanting to protect her children and a citizen concerned for the well being of the country. I loved the book!!

reviews: This was pure enjoyment to read.  I now have even more respect and admiration for Michelle Obama than I did before reading it.  I have always admired her realness.  This book cements it.  It's the best book I read in all of 2018. (out of ~20 others).  It shouldn't matter, but yes, I am white and educated. (PhD in  Chemical Engineering).

reviews: During their time in the White House I always felt the Obamas were such a great couple. Their love for each other just radiates. It was  great to dive into Mrs. Obama's past and learn that really though, they have some of the same relationship struggles as the rest of us.Michelle has to be one of the most driven women in the world! As a working mom finishing my last semester of college,  she has  become such an inspiration to me. Her work with children, girls in particular, was so influential.Great read-lots of tears, quite a few laughs, and a whole lot of girl power!!

reviews: I cant express how much I enjoyed this book! This was the first book chosen for my bookclub and it was a amazing choice! She is honest and open in a way I think we have all wanted to see and read. I appreciate her willingness to be honest about her experiences, not only about her life but as the First Lady. I also loved that she tied in history and facts regarding her and her family's experiences as people of color in America. Overall, prepare for your heart to grow two more sizes for MO.

reviews: I thought it impossible for me to respect Michelle Obama more than I already did, but I was wrong. This insightful, hopeful, powerful memoir is a balm on the wounds of our presently fractured country. If, after all she has been through, she can continue to “go high,” and remain optimistic, then perhaps I can continue to try to do so, as well.

reviews: I loved it for the memories of growing up Midwestern, for that constraint refrain of "am I good enough?" which touches all of us in such a personal way, for reminding us why decency matters so much. My daughter-in-law, wanting to do so much like Michelle Obama, loved it for all the signposts along the road, my husband is loving it, partway through so I haven't yet asked why. Certainly a book with something for everyone, and when you finish you feel energised. Thank you Michelle Obama, what a gift to us.

reviews: This enjoyable book offers insight and wisdom from an admirable and extremely likable person. It was fascinating to have been taken behind the scenes of significant historic events, of which we’d previously heard only second hand, as well as to learn about her educational and professional experiences, her own upbringing and that of her children. Michelle Obama and her entire, extended family enhance my faith in the power of good in the world. Michelle 2020! (If only...)

reviews: Growing up on the south side of Chicago, I realized that Michelle and I have many similarities. reviews: I think the memoir was especially poignant to me, because I am a black woman in her early 50s> I can relate to the First Lady's growing experience. Also, having witnessed the history-making event of electing the first African American president, and watching and admiring the family for more than eight years, it was interesting to get a glimpse of the history and behind the scenes events. I also have to mention that it was well-written, amusing, interesting, all the ingredients for a good read.

reviews: Dear Michelle,Thank you for generously and candidly sharing  part of the story of your life. You are an inspiration to so many people. Your words and seeds are wonderfully encouraging for making a difference in the world. You have supported an incredible man in Barak and positive and intelligent children. May you continue in your quest for justice and love in all people. May you and Barak enjoy many happy and healthy years together. Thank you for Becoming what you are.

reviews: You will be delighted and rewarded by this deeper glimpse into the life of Michelle Obama.  If you have ever wondered how to turn a hope or dream into a concrete plan for success, this book will further that insight.  The heartfelt true story of the thoughts and actions of our ground-breaking and historic FLOTUS Obama is an essential read.  Having read "Becoming", I now feel as if I have had a personal conversation with Michelle.

reviews: Loved hearing Michelle Obama tell her own story. Read the book and listened to the audio book. She could have been from Harlem New York or south central L.A. because she represents all women of color. Whatever your goal is, it is attainable.

reviews: The writing style of the book is open, clear, and easy to read.  There are a couple of revelations -- Michelle was best friends with one of Jesse Jackson's daughters -- but the real value is the flow of events seen through her eyes.  It adds depth to what we already know about Barack Obama and his beautiful, admirable wife.

reviews: A quick read of a woman and her role as daughter, wife, mother and FLOTUS during a time of transformation and hope. I enjoyed the read and her perspective as we are both the same age, coming of age in the 1980s/90s. A woman’s journey, I recommend it as both an empowering and cautionary tale.

reviews: Just a straight forward story of Michelle Obama's life.  She doesn't embellish, just tells the story of a child that grew up in a lower income loving family, married the love of her life and stood beside him to build an amazing life.  It is a great read and shows you just what a hard working and intelligent woman she is.  Definitely recommend this book.

reviews: An amazing journey from a small apartment on the south side of Chicago to the First Lady of the United States living in the White House.  Instead of a famous person I see on television at a distance, she feels like a normal woman who I think I would enjoy being friends with.  I really enjoyed reading her story.  Was very well written and I was never bored.  Worth the time and money to read.

reviews: Michelle Obama takes you on a journey of her childhood to her 8 years as First Lady.  She did not grow up in a life of privilege as many of our previous First Ladies.  Her story is honest and uplifting. She makes you feel that anything in life is possible if you want it bad enough. It just takes persistence and hard work.

Her story is honest and uplifting. She makes you feel that anything in life is possible if you want it bad enough. It just takes persistence and hard work.

reviews: Michelle Obama is the real thing, so authentic and honest.  She shares her humble home life , that I can relate to.  She says that faith is what keeps all of her fears at bay.  She shows us what a family does to keep their relationships honest.  She describes a family where family time is the most important time.  She reminds us to be our true, authentic being.  None of us should hold back stories of love for humanity, for people different than us.  She predicts the darkness that surrounds us with our current President.  All of us need to think not party am I, but which person will lead us to democracy, to honesty and respect for everyone.  We do not need a dictator.

reviews: Becoming offers Michelle Obama's unique perspective on growing from Southside Chicago to 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue. Her priorities are clear, and her heart is definitely in the right place. I admired her more after reading how she managed to raise her children and sustain herself and her marriage in the intense fishbowl of the White House.

reviews: I've always been a fan of Michelle Obama, and this book confirms it.  Her story of what can be accomplished with determination and solid family support is inspiring and life-affirming (especially in today's climate), and I appreciated her perspective on life in a political family.

reviews: What a wonderfully written memoir by a truly wonderful human being. I don’t know where to begin. I laughed, I cried. My heart sang, my heart broke. I could relate and I couldn’t even imagine. Thank you Michelle for your sacrifice and service to our country and for your frank, warm, honest opening of your heart to the rest of us.

reviews: This seemed like she was trying to explain and defend herself more than anything, but I still really enjoyed it. At times, it seemed a little self-congratulatory; almost bragging about sacrifices she chose to make. However, this was another book that I couldn't put down. I thought the writing was above average and her story flowed well - I enjoyed getting to know our former first lady on a somewhat personal basis.

reviews: Great book. Hated to reach the end. Interesting description of the lives of President Obama and Michelle that led them to each other and their relationship as husband and wife and parents. Insight into social conditions African Americans experienced growing up and getting an education. Warm and easy to read with many interesting details concerning life in the White House. Amazing perspective from the female point of view concerning roles in society.  Bought electronic version but plan to buy the print version as parts I want to reread.

reviews: This is one of my favorite books. She held my interest from beginning to end.  Starting from a little girl going through schooling, college, romance, marriage, life in the White House and beyond. This book is about family ties, growing through what you go through and the longing to be a good person do the right things throughout your life.  Michelle Obama has found a calling in writing she is truly gifted.

reviews: Easy to read, the book is filled with the optimism and positivity that Michelle Obama transmits In her public appearances. Besides the historical value, which already makes this book a reference for contemporary history, the lessons that we learned from this woman  as she faced the challenges as being black, female and poor, from the south-side blue collar neighborhoods in Chicago to reach acceptance by the majority of the American people and earn her right to be at the White House at the side of President Obama.Thank you for telling us your story. Highly recommend it.

reviews: As someone who generally shares a disinterest in all aspects of politics (related with Michelle on this one), I truly enjoyed reading her book. She offers firsthand insight into their world, especially while they occupied the White House. She offers, more importantly, her authentic self to be shared with the world. I appreciated her ability to admit when she was wrong and hold tight to her values when she was challenged.

reviews: Michelle Obama is such an inspiration! She writes with such a beautiful, authentic voice and has lead such an interesting life. I learned so many life lessons from this book that I have already started applying on a daily basis. Not to mention, I am about to make the transition into the nonprofit world, so hearing about her journey really helped me solidify my choice and encouraged me to find a job with purpose. I also appreciated hearing about her marriage and that it is not always easy when there are two strong personalities with big life/ career goals. Michelle Obama is truly my hero. I highly recommend this memoir!

reviews: This book is a look into Michelle Obama's life starting as a child through present time. You get such a human feel for who she is and what makes her tick. She is so much like a lot of women, strong, loving, caring, concerned and smart. The country is better for having had her for our first lady! This is such a great read!

reviews: Well done, important read.  Indeed she goes higher !  A bright light in the current age of lies, bigotry, bullying, arrogance and empty headed blather and pomposity.  No human being is perfect, but ethics, honor, education, gravitas, stewardship, and integrity bring us closer to that goal.

reviews: It’s a gem of a personal autobiography and  remembrance of a very important, hopeful time in US history. Easily readable and clear writing; with insights into the daily lives and concerns of a presidential family. By being our first black president and First Lady, the Obamas’ story, thanks to Michelle Obama, is a fascinating and sobering look at our country’s deep racial and cultural faults, as well as its hopeful potential.

reviews: This is possibly the best book I’ve read in the past twenty years. So many times people I’ve really liked and admired from afar become “fallen idols “ when you get to know more about them. Not so with Michelle Obama. She is just the person I thought and hoped she would be. That gives me great hope for the future. 😊

reviews: Beautifully written-as direct and strong as she is.  Very captivating fairytale, until the end when the presidency is lost to the other side.  I envied Michele‘s upbringing--low on material but high on love and support and belief in her ability to do it all.  I inhaled it in four days-a great read.

reviews: I would recommend this book to anyone who needs to be reminded about hope. This work of art reminds us that we are all connected. We all have a story to tell. We can all reach out and help one another. We can all speed the words of hope and possibility, no matter how small the platform. Even if it's just reaching out to a neighbor, to get to know them. Love this book. A must read and read again!!!

reviews: Not just a biography of a Chicago black woman but a biography of a woman who always strove to do more - we can all learn from this.Loved the story and her early years- her drive to only do the best. The part about her White House year’s drug a bit., still a fascinating read by a fascinating woman. I hope my Becoming is that graceful.

reviews: Michelle Obama is a good writer, a good person and a clear thinker.  Her memoir shows her kindness and empathy and is a really great read. Having read her book, I admire her even more. Highly recommend this look at the insider's White House experience, and also this hard working, loving person's life.

reviews: I knew the basic facts about Michelle Obama and always have considered her to be intelligent, thoughtful, extremely accomplished, and someone worthy of the utmost respect. Even so, reading this book gave me a newfound sense of appreciation for her and Barack Obama. Beyond a clear and what feels like an appropriately candid narration of  her life, this book has so many insightful nuggets that prompted me to reflect on who I am and who I am becoming. This is a book that anyone can learn from, and it's one I will read time and time again.
