reviews: This is a polished, authentic look into an admirable life. Written with balance and yet telling it the way she sees it, Michelle Obama has offered a true gift. She showed restraint at many points, and still managed to land her points with intelligence and precision. She went high, and anyone who reads this might find their inner bar raises at least a little for it. I know mine has. I pray this country can hear what she is saying. We need to.

Bush, and Harry Truman.

reviews: I typically don't read biographies but I wanted to read this book for several reasons. One because I am a black woman and I loved the time the Obama's spent in the white house. I don't really like politics or understand everything that goes on in politics. This book just gives more of a behind the scenes view of the white house structure, of Michelle's thoughts, struggles, and vision. I loved  her story of how life began and her trajectory to becoming first lady. I loved her tone throughout the book and I will  be purchasing the print copy  as a momento

reviews: I loved reading her story and learned so much more about her.  Really enjoyed getting the sneak peek into living in the White House and what it's really like to be married to the President.  Her own story even before she met him was so impressive as well.  The story flowed very well even with so much to cover, and she prods the reader to think about their own story and what they've become.  Highly recommend.

reviews: I enjoyed the Obama's years in the Whitehouse, and I couldn't wait to get my hands on this book. It was well worth waiting for, and I am very happy to have my very own copy.The book begins with Michelle's childhood, and encompasses her life story up until leaving the Whitehouse. Her story comes from the heart, and it's an easy read - not full of fancy jargon that one might need  dictionary to understand. I must say I knew the Obama's were different from run of the mill politicians I had become accustomed to. She and Barack are very intelligent; yet humble and down to earth and care deeply about helping others.I just loved this book!

reviews: Who knew Michelle Obama was such a gifted writer. I particularly loved the early years and those before the presidency. She was very eloquent on describing her childhood and making it real.  The last third was a bit less riveting but well chronicled.

reviews: Michelle Obama’s ability to speak of the truth of her feelings and experience goes right into your bones. This book provided me with profound joy and sadness simultaneously—The joy of reliving the dream come true for so many of us for those 8 years and the immense sadness over the way in which it ended. In this regard the book was at times almost unbearable to read but we all know that the price we pay for the privilege of love is inevitably confrontation with pain, loss, and sadness.

reviews: Michelle Obama was open and honest in revealing her innermost fears and insecurities that can dog even the strongest most educated and successful women. She has a lot more to overcome and deal with being a black woman and does it was grace, sensitivity and optimism.  I admire and love Michelle even more than before reading her memoir. I recommend this book to any woman or man. It is inspiring.

reviews: Politics aside, this book reveals what it takes to make something of yourself if you have the will to do so.  Determination, hard work, a confidence in yourself, and a supporting group of people surrounding your journey.  Michelle Obama is one woman to be admired for her honesty and willingness to share how to apply yourself for a goal.  She definitely is a good role model for her daughters.

reviews: Michelle Obama is clearly a brilliant, capable, and warm human being. But  the thing I will remember most about this book is her descriptions of her husband — his character, his intelligence, and the dedication he applied to the impossible job of being POTUS. Clearly he is exactly the kind of person needed for the job, and exactly the opposite of the person who has unfortunately succeeded him.

reviews: Becoming by Michelle Obama, was breathtaking. It was inspiring to learn about how her journey started. She is an amazing Woman, Mother, Wife and Innovator. I admire her story telling about her life. Her stories inspires us to do better, to know that anything is possible if we don't give up and trust God.

reviews: A very well put together book. Its so easy to talk or think about the changes we need in our country but to go out there and making it happen is not an easy thing to do. She was very honest and open to talk about her feelings and how she felt they would never win the primary. She explains her side of the story very well. Growing up not having as much resources to get somewhere in life, she was very driven! I loved the story and how things changed after Barack came into her life. A lot of the behind the scenes I wouldnt have thought about or even imagined it. She gave a pretty good insight on how their lives were after Barack became president. I would recommend this book to anyone.

reviews: Michelle Obama’s memoir is well-written, sharp, funny, and tear-jerking. It’s honest, and she writes herself as strong & intelligent, yet slightly self-deprecating. Her words and her life story make me admire her even more than I did before, and her eloquent storytelling pulls you in as soon as you begin reading.
text: Michelle Obama’s memoir is well-written, sharp, funny, and tear-jerking. It’s honest, and she writes herself as strong & intelligent, yet slightly self-deprecating. Her words and her life story make me admire her even more than I did before, and her eloquent storytelling pulls you in as soon as you begin reading.

reviews: To learn from the REAL FIRST LADY and not the tabloids or sensationalism from the media. Powerful from beginning til ending. Passed the book on to a Native American family. They started reading the book and quickly returned mine within two days. Told me that her story related so much that they wanted their own copy for future generations because "a woman of color did it and we agreed, with so much Grace and kindness. Looked what she accomplished and how she inspired so many." I couldn't put this history book down. Thank you.

reviews: I appreciated the opportunity to hear about Michelle Obama's background and experience that have contributed to the intelligent, articulate and caring woman that she is today. Her accomplishments are a tribute to her upbringing, as well as her own determination and perseverance. Her story is engaging and the book is well written. I hope to hear more from her in the future.

reviews: Michelle Obama's Memoir is beautifully written and candid. I enjoyed the behind the scenes look at life in the White House, life on the campaign trail and her loving portrayal of raising her children as well as reading about the way she was raised. One does not have to be a fan of the Obamas to appreciate this book

reviews: Michelle Obama is both a gifted person and a gifted writer.  "Becoming" reminds us all that we should continue to grow and strive for personal improvement.  My admiration of Michelle and the Obama family grows stronger after reading this book and after observing from afar how they live their lives post-White House.  You are a great role model, Michelle!  Thanks for "being" that and more.

reviews: This well written autobiography offers insights into former First Lady Michelle Obama’s childhood  on the south side of Chicago, her college experience, law school, professional life, her family life, and her time in the White House.  I highly recommend this book.

reviews: A remarkable book written by an incredibly accomplished First Lady.  What an amazing life she has lived. I admire all of the good work she has done for the betterment of this country and the world. I look forward to what she will do in the future.

reviews: Just finished this book and loved it! I am a mother of two boys, have a couple of college degrees and grew up in a modest environment so I can relate to her on many levels. I enjoyed her honesty and transparency. I loved the accounts of her childhood and the people in it. I loved the grace with which it was written, and I feel that this is the same ease and grace she carried herself through both of the Obama presidential terms. I appreciate Michelle and am grateful to have learned so much more about her and her family in this book. Thank you to Michelle and her family for their kind and honest intentions and efforts to move our country forward!

reviews: This book is beautifully written and error free (good editors?).  A wonderful inside look into what formed her and what still defines her.  A primer on how to be a good person and be grounded.  Should be required reading for teenagers.  Emphasis on ethics, morality and respect for others.  Sadly lacking in our president today.

reviews: Becoming by Michelle Obama was one of the most amazing and inspirational books I have ever read. Michelle Obama talks about her life in such an open and honest way. I was inspired by her determination and grit to accomplish her goals. It was cool to read about her journey from Chicago to the White House and what it was like living there for 8 years. I enjoyed reading about what she did as First Lady and how throughout her life she has worked to make the world a better place. I recommend this book to everyone because it will inspire you to embrace your story and encourage you to make a difference in your community.

reviews: I truly enjoyed reading Michelle Obama's book.  It sheds light on what it was like growing up and attending Princeton University where she felt like an outside because of her race.  However, she overcame a lot and became the first Black First Lady of the United States.  This just goes to show that Success can come to all who truly work hard.  I am proud of Mrs. Obama and I wish her the very best in future endeavors.  This was a great read.

reviews: I love Michelle Obama's opus for three reasons. First, it is narrated in her beautiful voice.  Second, it is easy to read and follow. Thirdly,  it is well-written. Every time I flip the pages, it brings tears to my eyes to hear the words of our First Lady. Every American should get this book.

reviews: This is an excellent book. Very real and down to earth. Mrs Obama held my attention in every page by her very true full account of her family life from childhood until present day. I would not hesitate to recommend this book and have done so. Mrs Obama is not only one  of the most intelligent First Ladies we have ever had in my life time but one of the most caring . This is definitely a no holds barred and I believe true full book . Great insight into her feelings about her husband running for president. Thanks to both President Barack Obama And Michele Obama for the eight years of your lives you gave to the American people.

reviews: Reading "Becoming" was such an inspiration.  I have always loved Michele with her grace and dignity.  I enjoyed reading of her early life growing up in a working class family which definitely prepared her for her life later on, especially as the First Lady.  I'm truly inspired by Michele, she's a very down to earth but yet classy lady.

reviews: This book took me on a journey with the Author.  I felt as though I was there, living life on each page.  There is so much hope, a virtual road map on how to Become. reviews: Wow. Just a wonderful peace of work explaining and giving us a glimpse into a world that many of us will never know. Gaining power and prominence while at the same time trading in a certain basic flexibility to move freely throughout life. Something I never considered when you become an elected official, particularly the becoming the First Family.

reviews: To watch Mrs. Obama on the television, it does not do her justice. I fell in love with the Obamas during the first run. I knew he spoke from his heart, but reading this book made me feel the pain that they went though. Every life event she wrote about, how it made them feel. It was the same pain and emotion I felt.They are an amazing family and we were lucky to have them in office, but I am glad they can slow down now.I miss you both very much and pray that we have the opportunity to elect someone with the same ambitions you both had.Thank you.

Politics aside,a very honest look into the ups and downs of a woman not unlike modern women everywhere.

reviews: I was an Obama supporter from day one and I admired the way their 8 years were handled.  But getting to "know" Mrs. Obama and the backstory was very moving to me!  I laughed & cried out loud in places and very few books can do that!  I think it was an honest, from-the-heart chronicle of Mrs. Obama's life - not trying to sugar coat anything, no hyperbole and no negativity!  I enjoyed reading it!

reviews: This was such an engrossing story of a young black girl from the south side of Chicago becoming an accomplished, caring, hopeful, patriotic woman. The fact that she becomes the first African-American First Lady of the United States is just a bonus for our country and the world. The book is honest, personal and full of insights into this wonderful woman and her husband, who just happens to be the former President of the US!

reviews: Gave this to my mom for Christmas and she LOVED it! She called me when she finished it and was sad because she said she didn't want it to end! She has already shared it with several friends, and will continue to do so. Wonderful story by a very wonderful woman of our time. Everyone needs this in their library collection.

reviews: While I enjoyed the book quite a lot, I was a disappointed that so little of the President Obama's second term was covered.  Surely there must have been many interesting things that happened.  I couldn't help but feel that she had had enough of writing this book and just wanted it to end.

reviews: I enjoyed reading her perspective of being in politics as a spouse and what the family sacrifices. Learning her background that I did not know, makes me respect her more. This book tells the challenges we all face each day but for her on a much bigger level. Highly recommend.

reviews: Becoming is deeply inspiring.  It provides a close up view of Michelle Obama in an authentic and profound way.  It was interesting to see how her  journey in “Becoming” and her struggles are similar to that of many women.  Her work will be a lasting legacy. Brilliant work!

reviews: Love, love, love Michelle Obama and read this is just a couple of sittings.  Enjoyed it so much!  Very little of it is about her time in the WH...more about how she grew up, the people that influenced her and her relationship with Barack.  We get to go to her event in Austin in February and we are SO excited!

reviews: I generally dislike biographies but Michelle Obama is a remarkable woman and role model.  It's a refreshing look at the better of humanity in times where it is impossible to escape the worst. Trump uprooting the White House vegetable garden is a perfect metaphor for the current  inimical administration and their snide "let them eat cake" mentality.

reviews: Dear Michelle,Thank you for the,birds eye view into your life.I walk away with with 2 big ticket items from your book!! We have to all battle prejudice and to do this we need exposure,to different cultures,religions and gender choices. #2,get rid of personal interest groups that rule our government and protect our children who sit in classrooms by law but we ex pose them to violence!

reviews: I love this woman and this book! She keeps it real while being the most elegant woman. Telling her stories in such a beautiful way! Getting an inside look into her life and her mind not only inspired me but also helped me realize the similarities in her that I see in myself, further motivating me as a young adult to be better. Do better. Forever my First Lady, Michelle Obama’s book is a must read, and if you haven’t, check out her podcast on Spotify, I love it!

The rest of the book was kind of the same thing over and over. I applaud her for all the hard work she put into being a First Lady.

reviews: I enjoyed this book immensely.  I learned a lot I didn’t know about her and their family. She honestly shared her history and her perceptions and gave us a glimpse into her. The book wasn’t about tooting her own horn and blowing up her ego. One of the most insightful, good books I’ve read in a long time.

reviews: I completely enjoyed this book and wanted it to continue!  Although we come from very different backgrounds Ms. Obama reminded me that we are more alike than different.  I found Ms. Obama to be exceptionally relatable as a woman, a wife, a mother and a daughter.  Her stories were warm and genuine - and kind and strong.  She also gave me hope, enough so that there has been a shift in my attitude about where we are today.  Thank you.

reviews: This story is from Michelle's earliest year with her family sharing personal stories of her dads struggle with MS to her own struggle of fertility. Her relationship with her husband and their life through politics. Michelle narrates the story herself that resonates compassion and empathy through out.

reviews: I listened to this audiobook in the car with my kids, and we frequently paused the reading to discuss what she illustrated about the American experience. So relevant, relatable, candid, well-written, and ... just a lovely depiction of an American life in a graceful, beautiful descriptive light. As for those who commented that this is boring ... my 8-13 year old children looked forward to long car rides because of it.

reviews: I enjoyed the first half of the book more than the second half. There were parts I loved and parts I could have done without. I enjoyed the insight into both the personal and professional pieces of being in the White House. It gave me more respect for anyone who is elected president of our nation and the sacrifices that are made daily. I think the most beautiful part of the book was the thread of hope and sacrifice- her belief in his ability to be a leader for our nation and putting that before her own desires was a beautiful thing to read about.

reviews: Michelle Obama, you have probably heard this so many times but I just have to say it again “you and your family have been the most positive inspiration to so many.”  I would recommend all to read this book as the experiences shared are so relatable to so many of us.  It gives hope in a time of uncertainty for so many of us.  I especially like the reference to life as a progression of continuous growth.  There are so many layers in this book.  It is touching, real, strong and humble.  The story is spoken from the heart.  Just beautiful!

These two incrediblepeople are an inspiration to never giveup on the aspirations and beliefs youhave for a better society and life foryourself, your family and your country. and for your country.

reviews: From an emotional standpoint, it has comedy and drama. Most of all it is a wonderful self-reflection about what it means to joggle professional and family life with dignity and in pursuit of well-being of marginalized social groups. Surely a most read autobiography.

reviews: Thank you, Michele for sharing your convictions and thoughts about your life. It should be truly inspiring to all who read this. Thank you for your service to our country as First Lady for all that you have done for promoting the education and health of our youth. Yes, diversity matters!

reviews: This book is filled with hope. It's fantastic to read the story of how a young girl from Chicago's south side made her way up and then changed tracks to serve the public and help bring enormous changes. The romance story with Barack is adorable. I appreciate that Michelle changes her tone throughout the book to accurately convey her past feelings, even if she does not associate with them anymore -- it keeps the narrative real.

The romance story with Barack is adorable. I appreciate that Michelle changes her tone throughout the book to accurately convey her past feelings, even if she does not associate with them anymore -- it keeps the narrative real.

reviews: To all those who thought they knew Michelle Obama & especially to those who don’t, please read this book! It is a wonderful glimpse of life from her younger days in Chicago and winds its way till her final moments in the White House. We may think we know her because of her public life but we don’t. She’s so much more. She is a person who I would love to call a friend & to have long conversations about so many issues she addresses in this book as well as childhood experiences we share in common. A great read, I highly recommend it particularly to young women looking for a role model! I miss this family.

reviews: A well written book giving insight into how Michelle Obama evolved into the woman she is today. At times it felt like she and I were engaged in a conversation due to the easy, descriptive style that she employed to share her story. Anyone who has ever questioned their own self-worth will devour this book!

reviews: From her youth to leaving the White House. Poignant stories of growing up, the people who made positive impacts in her life and how she seems to carry strength, dignity, and compassion through her life. May she continue to be an inspiring force for generations.

reviews: I'm not big on biographies, but this was a fantastic read. I voted and have supported this family from the start. Have admired their commitment, values, ethics and down to earth common sense. You won't want to miss this read.

reviews: More than a personal recounting,  this book is lens and microscope to decades of systemic cultural racism.  Never preachy,  always first person personal, in a voice so authentic that we live with and through her,  Michelle Obama writes as she leads,  with grace and reality constant companions. A real tour de force.

reviews: What can I say other than I loved the book.  Wonderful to listen in her own words and learn so much about her.  You can see how down to earth she is and how she became such an amazing person.  <3

reviews: One can not have  read Becoming without being inspired to be more involved and to help others and  yourself to be more accepting, tolerant and fair.  Michelle Obama's memoir has helped me understand better that through knowledge, experience and  stepping out of one's comfort zone and being more open to new experiences, new ideas, will  opportunities for change and growth be afforded me.Michelle Obama isn't preachy or judgemental.  She writes smoothly, with a sense of humor and clarity. She doesn't't push her message at you, but shares her story with sensitivity and strength.  We need more of this message of change and growth through compassion and understanding!

reviews: Real, earthy, glamorous, and inspiring. Michelle Obama was a First Lady like no other. Despite her no-nonsense style, her warmth and kindness shine through on every page of this remarkable story--divided into the three phases of her life: Becoming herself, becoming Mrs. Obama, and becoming First Lady.

reviews: I laughed, I cried, I ran an emotional marathon with this book. I devoured it and cherished the time spent reading Beloved. Absolutely one of my all time favorite books. I admire her more than ever after reading this and her down to earth personality.

reviews: This was a First Lady full of grace and her book is no different. She does not comment on other people’s thoughts or lives. She doesn’t try and interpret others. Rather she sticks to her story of what made her who she is and what makes her tick. I really enjoyed the insight and the grace.

reviews: This books was so good!  I think everyone (especially women) should read it.  It isn't what you think .... it is not a political bashing book.  It's about her life, and how she became ....  it is also interesting viewing the Presidency from a wife's perspective.  Highly recommend.

reviews: I anxiously awaited the publication of Michelle Obama’s first (don’t you think there should be more?) book. Saw her in LA on her book tour and just finished reading it. She shares oh so much more about her personal thoughts than I could have expected and did such a wonderful job of describing her life so far. It was an insightful and inspiring story and I took away so many hopeful thoughts about what we are as Americans and what we can be!

reviews: Book club selection.  Best part of this entire book is that we got a clear picture of the the young as well as mature Michelle. This is her story, her background, with no embellishments,, and best of all no political  plans. reviews: I enjoyed this book very much and felt like I knew and understood Mrs. Obama much better after reading. She is a woman worthy of admiration and respect. reviews: This is by far one of the most fascinating and entertaining biographies I have read in many years. Learning how Michelle Robinson O'Bama was raised from childhood, how she used schooling during her formative years, that helped with important career decisions later in life. The focus her parents had on the importance of education was so crucial in helping Michelle make good decisions on career and her own family' life.

reviews: A very good read.  I was not sure I would enjoy this book when I found out it had been chosen as our book club selection of the month as I usually read fiction, but I was proven wrong.  Michelle Obama's book was informative, relatable, and most of all genuine.  A great book club pick as we had stimulating discussions regarding women's issues, race issues, and all learned a little more about life in the White House.  Everyone who attended our meeting that night agreed we would recommend it to others.

reviews: I did not know much about the Obama family until reading this book. It was powerful to connect with many of the experiences Michelle Obama shared about - being a career woman and mother and wife, focusing attention on education and youth, and desperately wanting to make a difference in this world. I appreciate her honesty and vulnerability, as well as her courage.

reviews: An intriguing view from inside the White House looking out.  The book is well written and easy to read- almost as if you are chatting with the First Lady.  Clearly the author has a bias and she makes no attempt to “convince” anyone into her way of thinking.  She just unapologetically shares her personal history, from childhood through the end of Barack’s presidency.  Getting to know her and her husband through Michelle’s eyes provided me with additional insights into the President and the personal motivations that drove his policy.

reviews: This book is well written, with little or no recognizable bias, or smoke screens to alter reality.  Mrs. Obama is definitely in my list of classy First Ladies, that includes Mrs. Laura Bush.  They both raised great daughters in the White House environment.  Mrs. Obama's narration draws you into her life, including the White House days. I wrestled whether to use the title "Mrs" for both of this ladies because readers may interpret this as a fake approval; they both deserve the respect that they gave to the American public. I am proud to say this one the best "autobiography" type books I have read!!!

reviews: I rarely buy autobiographies but I have always admired Mrs. Obama and thought I would give it a try. I loved it. It is written in the same style in which Michelle speaks, light, breezy, with a laugh just below the surface. Her chapter on when she and Barack met brought tears to my eyes. The same with Malia’s birthday party in Montana. I admire her more than ever now and heartily recommend the book.

reviews: Beautiful book, inside and out. Also, a story well written.I saw much of myself in Michelle's story -- wondering and worrying as a young girl and woman if I was ENOUGH. My birth family was much like Michelle's -- hard-working parents who sacrificed for their children, encouraged education, and always tried to do the right things. Needless to say, I shed some tears while reading this book, which will remain in my permanent library. My thanks to Michelle for caring about others and always sharing her truths. Blessings!

reviews: Loved it. Her style is so very readable, helpful in a book! But I was actually gripped by this memoir which I wasn’t expecting. But seeing the Obamas genuine wishing for positive change, however tarnished the Oval Office is now, was uplifting.

reviews: I loved President and First Lady Obama when they served.  Reading this book allowed me to see their journey to the White House and what it was like for Michele as First Lady.  The book was very well written, candid and inspiring.  I feel privileged to have been around during their time in office.  I highly recommend this book.

reviews: This beautifully written book reflects a life of achieving even though the odds were against her . And she changed those achievements into a text to help others achieve . Hated to see the book end.

reviews: This was a totally wonderful book.  I actually had to force myself to put it down. It is written beautifully with feeling and conviction. You see a much closer personal look into being the First Lady, a devoted wife and mother, and a woman who shows all of us that triumph can come to anyone no matter where they come from.

reviews: This book broke down the barrier of Michelle as the powerful first lady of the free world. By the last chapter,  she has become the girl next door just trying to do her best to change the world around her.  Thanks Michelle for sharing your story and providing hope to many a  young woman, struggling to find an identity and a place in this tough world.

reviews: Easy to hear Michelle's voice as I read and gave a wonderful down to earth story of where she came from and insights on her feelings as their life evolved. It's very well written and held my interest right tho the end. She is truly a great lady and mother, positively motivated to helping and building lives of those less fortunate.

reviews: Wonderful to get to know your story and the dignity and grace you brought to the presidency.  No one is perfect but you were perfect for the country at a time when so much is on the line. You make me proud to be from Illinois and to have had our children benefit from your forward thinking humanitarianism.  Bravo!!!!!

reviews: Michelle Obama is an awesome woman and her memoir gives insight into the many factors that make this so.  She writes with ease, humor, honesty and intelligence.  I enjoyed every page and can highly recommend this book to anyone who can respect a truly capable accomplished woman who is willing to share her own truth.

reviews: BECOMING was one of the most important books I have ever read.  Mrs. Obama tells how to start from  a simple life and become one of the most important women in the world.  During this growth, she and her husband continued to do the right things for the right reasons.  I admire both of them.

reviews: Thank you, Michelle, for sharing your story with us.This is an amazing memoir for present and future generations, providing a lense and tone that encourages the reader to honor their past and submit to the journey of becoming a leader in all their spheres of influence.I loved how, in her own way, she honored her family, Barack, children and friends. I'm also glad she made the courageous step to continue to use her voice, tell HER story, in vulnerability and without agenda :D #iambecoming

reviews: A beautifully written book that I’d highly recommend to anyone! Michelle Obama is remarkable! That said, this book is poorly printed. The printer was clearly running out of ink, as some pages are so light I could hardly read the words. On other pages, the words were dark and splotchy. It felt like I was reading a bootlegged book. Maybe I should stick to a Kindle...

reviews: Michelle Obama has written a very inspiring, real life biography that is so entertaining and real that I could not put it down!!!  I am an avid reader that truly enjoys a GOOD book!  This is so open and heart warming that it felt like she was talking directly to me.  An awesome read.

reviews: I appreciated her profound honesty, the revealing of her weaknesses and strengths, how she and Barack fought hard to protect their children without being helicopter parents---giving them room to grow in their own personal styles. I appreciated her great love and respect for her extended family members and theirs for her. I very much admired her lack of interest in politics and having little desire to be on display. At the same time, I so wish she were running for president of the USA. She would be a winner.

reviews: I have watched Michelle Obama handle the tough job of being a first lady with dignity and grace. I only hope to emulate her ability to handle adversity during the next half of my life. This is a very well written account of how perseverance and hard work make the difference! Bravo!

reviews: I enjoyed almost every moment of this book. I’m not a political junkie so that is the  part I just wanted to plow through. The descriptions of scenes and situations are so well described it was easy to picture myself in the spot. Her writing is moving, emotional and full of wisdom. I admire Ms Obama immensely. After reading this memoir, my desire to meet and speak with her is stronger.

reviews: I always admired her, but after reading about her life, I love her even more. So honest, such an amazing story and life she'd led. She's just a terrific person. It was a quick read & I highly recommend it!

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed experiencing the perspective of our recent First Lady. Her writing is engaging, self effacing and straightforward. The book is aptly titled as the reader sees its author develop as an individual, a woman of color, a life partner and a mother. The book deepened my admiration and respect for Ms. Obama who clearly lives a value system I wish the rest of our country would embrace.

reviews: It was interesting to know more about Ms. Obama's background and early days in Chicago. She's written before about her campaign experiences and actually living in the White House, but it was all here in one place. The only thing I didn't like is that she errs, quite obviously an perhaps wisely, on the side of caution; it isn't possible for her not to have strong opinions on most subjects.

reviews: I had no real expectations when I started reading Becoming but boy was I blown away!  I read a lot and almost never leave a review but this book touched me.  Michelle tells her story with the class and dignity that surrounds the Obamas.  I can’t tell you how profoundly this book affected me.  I will pass it along to my daughters and tell all my friends to read it.  Very impactactful and uplifting even while keenly observing the somewhat sad state of politics.  Left me feeling hopeful - in Michelle’s own words, “change happens slowly” but we can still strive to make it better.

reviews: Michelle Obama brings us through her growing up years on the South Side of Chicago, through her education and early career, her journey as First Lady, her fierce and protective mothering of her own children and the children of the world. She writes with clarity and honesty, her voice authentic and reliable.

reviews: Love Michelle!! The first part of the book was amazing. It was interesting and inspiring t o read about Michelle's early life.  The middle of the book was slow.  The end picked up a bit.  Michelle Obama is such an inspiration and I enjoyed reading about her life.

reviews: This book moved me to tears, had me laughing, depressed and hopeful all at the same time. Being a mixed woman, military beat, active duty Airman, single mother raising a black son, from New Mexico, I can truly say that the American experience is me. And this book touched on so many issues, subjects, thoughts, fears and hopes I have had, continue to have and will face in my lifetime. But, here's to the hopeful and optimistic future that Mrs. Obama dared to have and tried to create. Thank you for all you did and all you represent to us, this nation.

But, here's to the hopeful and optimistic future that Mrs. Obama dared to have and tried to create. Thank you for all you did and all you represent to us, this nation.

reviews: Gives an inside view of politics but from the perspective of an outsider. I have always felt drawn to Michelle Obama, who is, in many ways, even more compelling than her husband.  But if I had somehow  managed to read this memoir without knowing who the author was, or the basic history, it would be impossible to come away without liking her.  Her story rings just as true and sincere as her persona has seemed to be in the public arena over the years. She brought a new level of candor and grace to the role of First Lady. A real pleasure to read her thoughts about and responses to recent historical events as they unfolded.

reviews: Politics aside, this woman is incredible and her story brought me to tears. It’s an amazing story of perseverance, love, and compassion. She’s refreshingly honest about her struggles with infertility and going through marriage counseling, something I think every couple should do regularly. I’ve gotten every female at my office to read it!

reviews: This book should be required reading for every high school student.  It would remove prejudice from our society and inspire each student to give back to our world, making it a much better place in which to live.  Thank you, Michele Obama, from the bottom if my heart.

reviews: Interesting and informative view inside the White House by a family of modest means. Michelle is someone who proves that a better life can be found. Even if she didn’t end up as our First Lady, she is still a shining example of how to live a positive, thoughtful, loving existence.

reviews: Loved this book! An insiders look at Michelle's life growing up, attending schools, meeting Barack along with life at the White House. I also downloaded the Audible edition and felt like I was listening to a friend recount her life as Michelle actually narrates... Wonderful!
text: Loved this book! An insiders look at Michelle's life growing up, attending schools, meeting Barack along with life at the White House. I also downloaded the Audible edition and felt like I was listening to a friend recount her life as Michelle actually narrates... Wonderful!

reviews: Beautifully written memoir filled with optimism and hope.  Although clearly biased towards her husband’s character and policies, as one would expect, Obama maintains a positive focus and treats opponents without bitterness.  An inspirational read.
text: Beautifully written memoir filled with optimism and hope.  Although clearly biased towards her husband’s character and policies, as one would expect, Obama maintains a positive focus and treats opponents without bitterness.  An inspirational read.

reviews: I wondered about reading this, but I shouldn’t have. If only I could read more autobiographies of Black women with strong families of origin, artistic, professional and educational achievements, in a strong and successful marriage, committed to her children, working for social good, and with values I share and work for.  I would be happier. The fact that she was the First Lady and her husband the first Black president is secondary.  If you want to read the book, include the audio track. Hearing the story told by the author is an added benefit.

reviews: This book was truly amazing and riveting.  It was also uplifting, tender, and touching.  It was an authentic and exceptional delving into the intimate details of the development of a truly great lady.  I was moved by every emotional moment and enjoyed and was uplifted and buoyed by much of the narrative.  It is one of the best memoirs I have ever read.

reviews: My favorite genre, living and experiencing life through another person's perspective.Michelle shares her life from childhood through her years in the White House in a very humble way.  She is intelligent, thoughtful and grounded.  She is caring, involved and proud of who she is.She, Barak, Malia and Sasha are an American family that has survived the spotlight and have given us a blueprint for leadership in our great country.

reviews: Michelle Obama will go down in history as one the best First Ladies ever to occupy the White House. In this book she describes those people and events that formed her character. Her account feels honest and sincere, and pulls no punches when describing her life with Barack (not always easy) and the mistakes in judgment she made in her career. Her strength, integrity, dignity and humility come through in this detailed account of her life...so far.

reviews: I’m not a person who enjoys politics, reading about politics, or reading about history. Michelle Obama is a gifted writer. I read every part of this book and didn’t skip over any of it. I found it hard to put down because she pulled me forward through the book. I highly recommend this book to anyone who is at all interested in reading about people’s lives or learning something about the highest office in the United States.

reviews: Really enjoyed the book as it shed much light to the life that Michelle and the rest of the family went through. It has made me appreciate her more as a strong woman. Now I will have to see her the next time she comes to town.

reviews: How does one become First Lady Of The United States? Michelle Obama details her humble roots from the South Side, her personal struggles as a young professional and most importantly shares such an intimate portrayal of the East Wing.This book is incredibly relatable, even her experiences as FLOTUS were weirdly relatable. Well written, thoughtful, and thought provoking.Please read.

reviews: This was my first audiobook purchase.  I have to say, I looked forward to each trip, regardless how short, so that I could hear more from Mrs Obama.  It was a joy to discover her story, but much of the beauty came from hearing it in her own words.  I never thought I would be that excited to hear a book.  I’ve always been a bit of a traditionalist and independent as I have always wanted to read it myself.

reviews: Written (and narrated if you choose the audio book) in a very personal manner this book is engaging and interesting. I never knew the story of Michelle's journey from the south side of Chicago to the white house, and this book really feels like she's there with you telling the who thing as a friend. Well worth reading, especially for those of us with different backgrounds and experiences.

reviews: What a warm and positive look at the first chapters of a probably improbable life story, directly from the eyes and soul of Michelle Obama.  She weaves a powerful tapestry of middle-class family, commitment to excellence in both professional and family life.  Excellent inside story of what she felt and why.

reviews: Don't understand how she remembered so many details. I'm so happy for her and the entire family, love is shown by action and not just the saying. Her entire family showed love beginning with her Uncles who housed and built their separate sleeping quarters. Her parents being their for their children. Although the father was not in the best of health he continued to participate as often as needed. The love displayed by siblings.

reviews: I really enjoyed this book for the optimism and hope it has at its core. Michelle Obama is an excellent example for women and an inspiration for young women. The writing is honest and compelling woven through historical events and accounts of two terms in the White House, and recalling a childhood on the Southside of Chicago.We all need more optimism and hope for the future of our country right now.

reviews: First of all, I enjoyed the book.  I thought it was well-written, insightful, and an overall good read.  The issue I have with the physical book itself, is that pages (about20) were so very poorly printed -very light - as to make them unreadable.  Groups of these pages were scattered throughout the text.  I have never experienced this before.  Would this be the responsibility of the publisher or just the printer?Did anyone else receive a defective copy?Thanks, in advance, for any responses.

reviews: I’m very particular about what I read, I have to be entertained and inspired... I can do fiction but I prefer bio’s... to much trivial detail puts me to sleep and I lose interest if it’s not realistic... Becoming is well written and a good perspective of how a normal life can suddenly become abnormal...

reviews: An intimate portrait of the woman we all believe we know. I love the vulnerability and transparency of this book. She laid it all out there for us, thereby providing a rare glimpse into her childhood, education and life in the White House. I was inspired while reading to do more - more for my community, more for my kids, more for my neighbors. Mrs. Obama is an amazing woman.

reviews: I knew little of the Obama family going into this book, but was interested to learn more. This was an intriguing read, especially the later chapters about their time in the White House.  I found the book entertaining, hopeful, and inspiring. I would definitely recommend it.

reviews: This book was so informative in so many ways.  You learn about Michelle and her life from young to now and her relationship with her husband and children.  She delves into the struggle of being black in America and she discusses life as a daughter, student, worker, political wife, mother.  I learned things about life in the White House that I would never even have thought about.  Very interesting and very well written.  I think it is a must read and I will read it again at some point.  I work at a university and this was a real good lesson in diversity.

reviews: Michelle Obama's account of her growing up surrounded by love but always wondering if she was good enough felt familiar to me.  We have in common coming from a family poor in possessions but rich in love.  Her writing is so open and conveys her feelings in ways not often seen.  She has such love for her family AND her country and was willing to give up a lot to support her husband in his efforts to make the world a better place.  She also gives a lot of insight into her husband and his passion for making change.  I have always admired both of them, and this book reinforces my feelings.

reviews: If you like her, you'll love her story. If you don't like her, you'll probably find it more difficult to hold that up when you understand her story of life, love, hardship and perseverance is very much an American story, a human story full of common ground that connects good people everywhere.

reviews: I loved Michelle's story of growing up with her family, her self-doubt and furious fight to excel at every opportunity, her description of the journey, her love for Barack and her daughters, the real behind-the-scenes story of being the first family (especially the first African-American first family). I highlighted much of her book. I loved how relatable and vulnerable she was in her accounts. I loved the book, and have tons of respect for this brilliant and hard-working and loving woman..

It allowed readers a glimpse of her personal life that she had never shared previously which showed her humanity, love of family and love of country.

reviews: I learned a lot about struggles I didn’t have to face even though I grew up in Illinois with little money. I’m amazed at the strength and courage of Michelle’s parents. Their wisdom was deep and powerful. The book is so well written and informative. So grateful to Michelle for writing it.

reviews: This book took you on a journey, which I'm sure is what Michelle Obama set out to do when writing this book.  It's as if she was sitting next to me telling her story.  When Barack Obama was elected, I cried tears of joy and the next morning on my walk, I felt real hope for our country, and in reading this book, it brought that all back!

reviews: Kindle Edition---eagerly read.  I think MO is an excellent role model for girls/women of all cultures.  I didn't always agree with the policies of her husband's administration, but the grace and class of this entire family is indisputable.  I thoroughly enjoyed this book.  I would suspect, however, if you "hated" this family/administration and/or you are completely "enamoured" with the current administration this book isn't for you.

I loved her as First Lady, and respect her integrity and courage.  Her encouragement for us all to be authentic and invite others into our lives will continue to motivate me,.

reviews: I laughed and cried through out this entire book.  Michelle was really able to Express the joy and the pain she was feeling in each circumstance.  I cried over the tragic losses and rejoiced over the births. I could not wait to find out what would happen next, even when I already knew!

reviews: Great read about a great lady. Reading her book made me laugh, cry, be happy, proud to be an American and more. I would recommend to anyone.

reviews: I finally downloaded this while at home sick and I couldn't be happier I did. It reads like advice from a trusted older friend or mentor, leading readers through moments and stories that everyone can empathize with. It had moments that are private, personal, emotional, and many stories that made me think. Though she's the first to admit in her memoir that she's not a fan of politics, First Lady Michelle Obama's smart, strong, empathetic, and capable voice is needed now more than ever. I'm glad I got to hear her voice through this book.

reviews: This is an easy to read account of the life of Michelle Obama.  It provides insights from her childhood to the present day.  It offers an eyewitness view of what it is like to live in the White House and to serve in the capacity of the First Lady of the US.

reviews: Great read. I've only read one other first lady book, Hillary's, and Michelle Obama's is my absolute favorite. Her story is relatable to women who share similar journeys in life.  This book can be read at any stage of life and helps see the perspective of not only an African American woman, but women in geneal.

reviews: This book is a very well written description of life of President and Mrs. Obama in the white house and before. It provides thoughtful insight into  the challenges of a minority president working for the people while blocked by a republican congress.
text: This book is a very well written description of life of President and Mrs. Obama in the white house and before. It provides thoughtful insight into  the challenges of a minority president working for the people while blocked by a republican congress.

reviews: I enjoyed reading this forthright memoir of Michelle Obama.  She has a tolerant, positive outlook on life and politics, and has a great deal of integrity.

reviews: I am a Norwegian and live in Oslo, Norway, and as I admired BO very much I looked forward to read his wifes book Becoming.I was not disappointed after having read the book and now feel that I «know» Michelle Obama a lot better than after just having followed her as a Flotus for 8 years.BO was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2009 and BO brought his wife with him to the ceremony in Oslo and the norwegian people in general was very happy about this event.But does anyone know why Michelle Obama did not mentioned with a sentence in her book about her husband being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize and their travelling together to Oslo?

reviews: Purchased as a Christmas gift, and confident after reading the reviews as well as an appreciation for what this former FLOTUS accomplished while in office, that it will be a good read.

reviews: Because of the tremendous detail of how Michelle Obama became who she is today and the honesty of the difficulties encountered in many aspects, but without any whining, made this book a reminder of how women--and especially women of color have had to maneuver in a white male dominated world. The most impacting aspect of the book is the stark contrast with the current potus . Nothing intentional in words but one cannot help but do a mental comparison while reading. Well worth my time post holidays.

reviews: Best post-Christmas gift to myself!  I have the hardback book but my eyesight is failing and I have struggled to read it for over a year.  The audible book is read by the delightful and articulate Forever First Lady and it's like settling in with an old and dear friend!

reviews: I would strongly recommend this book . Michelle Obama's  message is one of hope and a belief that we should always strive to remain true to our inner guiding values.  Her story felt real as she shared so many of her insights ,her fears and her hope for the future of our country.It's title - Becoming - is perfect.

reviews: I have always admired her class, obvious intelligence and integrity.  This book explains how she went from a kid in a very working class neighborhood in Chicago to the White House.  She also writes extremely well.  A  fascinating read from start to finish.
text: I have always admired her class, obvious intelligence and integrity.  This book explains how she went from a kid in a very working class neighborhood in Chicago to the White House.  She also writes extremely well.  A  fascinating read from start to finish.

reviews: I absolutely loved this book. It was so inspirational and gave us a glimpse of the life of Michelle Obama from childhood through her college and professional career that I found so relateable. Balancing marriage and motherhood with a demanding career is something that we women deal with (some of us better than others). It's one of those books that I know I will read again. She is beautiful, intelligent humble and kind and a wonderful role model for girls/women all over the world. It was so descriptive that I could picture in my mind everything she described as if I were there and I couldn't put the book down until I finished.  Well done! ☺

reviews: I loved reading Mrs. Obama's gentle prose as she walked us through her life to Becoming. I love the thought of "Becoming"as introduced by the First Lady by not just telling us what has happened through her life so far but sharing the feeling that life journeys don't so much end as help us become who we are and who we will be.

reviews: Michelle Obama captures the hope and she serves as an inspiration for young women in becoming better versions of themselves. I share a very similar background to Michelle and appreciated her putting into words how hard she worked and her singleness of purpose as a young woman. She was driven and hard working but supported by a loving family. Without giving away too much in the book, I will say I loved her honesty and openness in discussing the personal details of her life. Great read and I suggest all young women read it for a great perspective on being a strong modern woman with a family.

reviews: I am not a huge fan of  auto biography's - this one was different.  She is real, there aren't any grandiose memories that make you think that the writer has remembered there past differently than the way it actually was.  Michelle is an excellent writer and I thoroughly enjoyed reading about her life.

reviews: In this wonderful, very personal, story Michelle Robinson Obama focuses on the support she received in life to allow her to use her talents to make this a better world.She also describes how she works to support others so they can also best use their talents.Written in a straight forward Becoming grabs your emotions in so many ways

reviews: There is absolutely too much to say about Michelle's account of her life.  I liked hearing about the mundane as well as the wonderful life that she and her spouse lived and that led to the White House.  Of greater significance is the exploration of Michelle's life for which I gained a newfound appreciation. She was already quite the outstanding person before she ever met Obama. Parts were at time moving me to tears and once in a while some laughter.  Most of all, I wonder why we can't have someone like the two of them in the White House now.  Such intelligence and class!  Not like the uneducated and crass we have now.

reviews: Really did enjoy this book. It was everything you would expect from such a loving, good hearted individual. Republicans and Democrats alike can learn so much about what being a president and first lady’s life is really like. Also parents of young children could learn so much information about how to raise children with character. From the first lady’s parents to her and Barack’s parenting style, the goal was always about preparing the children to be adults.

reviews: An honest, un-sugar coated but inspiring look into the life of Mrs Obama. Many of her struggles, doubts and insecurities will resonate, regardless of your personal story.  I found myself vowing to be a better person myself, while simultaneously grieving for the current situation of our country.  The Obamas still give me hope.

reviews: Michelle Obama bravely shares her life and the inner workings of the White House. She shares her challenges of raising her family in the public eye, especially a family of color. We learn of her climb from an eager South Chicago student to First Lady in the White House.  Michelle takes us along on her journey which makes a fascinating and enjoyable read, written by an incredible woman who will always be becoming.

reviews: I really liked this book for the author’s honesty, and openness, as well as the telling of the smaller stories that fit into the bigger picture of the 44th presidency, via the First Lady’s perspective. I highly recommend it.

reviews: This book is incredible. Michelle Obama is a remarkable woman and human being. Her insights were such good reminders for me. Her words give me hope for the future of our country and help me to realize that cynicism is not helpful. To live his/her best life one must have hope, determination, empathy, grace and positivity!  She has all of these qualities and is a wonderful example for all women (and men!).

reviews: I didn't know what to expect from the former FLOTUS book, and found that her style of writing was outstanding, felt authentic, and kept me wanting to read more. Surprisingly, I felt like I understood and related to many of her stories - even though I have little in common with her life. I would highly recommend this book as an entertaining, well-written glimpse into the life of an interesting, smart, warm and genuine leader who blazed new trails during my lifetime.

As a girl from the south side of Chicago as well I really identified with Michelle’s struggles, challenges, hard work, love of family and music in this book. I listened to the audio and read the book!!

reviews: Michelle Obama embodies what a true First Lady should be.  I love and respect her truth, honesty, ethics and values - placed squarely where they belong.  I aspire to be more like her in thought, word and deed.  Inspiring!  Come on America,  get aboard!

reviews: Michelle Obama has written a wonderful account of her life from childhood, her early relationship with Barack, their growing family, and of course her incite into politics in the US. For a non US citizen this has given me a much better understanding of how the system works. Michelle and her husband come across as an ordinary family, very humble, incredibly capable, and driven to make their country and the world a better place.By the end of the book I felt I knew them. What wonderful role models for young people. Jamie A. NZ

reviews: There are so many inspiring quotes and moments in this book, it is beyond my expectations. A great woman has poured her heart out and I am left astounded at the care of her being, the candor of her words, and the new depths to a story we only think we knew. If it were not true word for word, it would be a modern fairy tale—one grounded in such basic human truths as to make it a story to be told over and over for generations to come. I highly recommend this journey of a woman who very much inspired one of the finest presidents this country will ever know. Her story should motivate the many that will follow in her footsteps and rise until a day when one of them becomes our first woman president.

reviews: An honest, heart felt summation of Michelle Obama's childhood experiences, her nascent relationship with Barak Obama, her IVF experience to enable her to give birth to her two daughters and a bird's eye view of what it is like to live within the walls of the White House.  It contains information I never knew before and is a very engrossing read.  Two wonderful, intelligent people trying and succeeding in doing the best for their family and fellow citizens.  They set a high bar for all those who follow in their footsteps.  Highly recommended.

reviews: Since the shock outcome of the 2016 election, many like me have struggled with family divisions that cannot be reduced to red and blues lines. Michelle outlines in her story a timeline of evolving into herself that is hopeful for us all to become not only the country we could be but  a people whose legacy builds up rather than tears down. This books gives me personal promise. I am, we are... good enough.

reviews: The book offers a personal and realistic portrayal of “becoming”.  I appreciate her sharing a story with which I, and many of my friends can identify. She is human and the only things that differentiate us are, clearly, the limitations society and its cultures (e.g., political, family, neighborhood, school...) impose on each of us.....I love the recognition that “becoming” is the work of a lifetime. Thank you, Mrs. Obama, for your honesty, your service to all of us and for your encouragement. You are an inspiration.

reviews: Michelle Obama gives me hope. As we in the United States are in the midst of struggling through a global pandemic, bullying and ridiculously inept president, fires and hurricanes, unbridled racism and violence, Michelle is our bright star of hope, optimism, practicality, goodwill. Michelle, thank you for sharing your story, your insights, your reminders to keep going high.

reviews: Completely exceeded my expectations - I couldn't put this book down. The First Lady is elegant, empathetic, and has a depth of character that goes far beyond many. She conveys a story of which touches anyone who reads this book - she shares private details and I'm sure this was rather difficult to put in to words. I felt like I could hear her voice as I was reading this book. She is someone just like us - that took chances, suffered, and overcame obstacles.

reviews: Both my wife and I love "Becoming."  I'm 95% through and sorry to see the experience is ending.  I know that many authors append their books with one or more E-Updates and I'm hoping that she will do the same here. I'd love to hear her insights on our current "situation." What a 180° change overnight.  This was my best read this year. Thanks, Michelle, for taking the time and effort to write it.

reviews: Becoming is a reminder of it's not where you are from but about where you go, how you get there and learn and grow along the way. I read this at exactly the right time in my life as I changed careers and started "becoming" the next phase of my life. This book gives me hope and renewed sense of self and determination that I am good enough.

reviews: Overall, Becoming was just ok. The cheap shots she took at the Republican party was annoying and unnecessary. The first eight chapters were difficult to get through, but it does get better about halfway through. The ending was decent, minus, again, all the cheap shots she took at anyone she disagreed with. I doubt she intended to portray herself as such a high maintenance person, but I sensed that on countless occasions. I was hoping for a more encouraging message, with insight into her life as the FLOTUS, (and it did give some), but for the most part, she basically repeated the same thing the entire time: it's hard being black, it's hard being a woman, it's especially hard being black AND a woman, white men are the devil, my husband's never home. I understand it's difficult to open up and be so vulnerable in writing, but she sounded like she had a chip on her shoulder the whole time. I felt put off by the "us versus them" tone she portrayed talking about different ethnicities. She had such a strong message about how oppressed black people are, that she seemed annoyed with anything white or male, and even more annoyed if that subject was both. She mentions a few times about how wrong people were about her, portraying her as an angry black woman. But...that was basically her tone throughout most of the book. Her voice sounded miffed, annoyed, resentful, mad. I wanted to like this book, and I'd hoped it would broaden my mind and views on politics, but it didn't do much of that. It's great that she started a garden, and introduced beekeeping, and started those programs for the children. I wish she'd focused more on that and less on just how difficult she thinks all black people have it. The writing in this book is mostly flat, not at all exceptional. With all due respect, I believe this book is only getting the attention it is because of who she is.

reviews: I thoroughly enjoyed the positive attitude Mrs Obama always put out there while being First Lady. Now I know her back story and see where it comes from . What I liked most about the eight years as the first family is their commitment to high standards and morals with hard work. Miss them!

reviews: I saw a lot of  myself in this book.  Being a  child of the 70s,  having the freedom to make a lot of life choices.  Even though I was able to accomplish a lot of things in  my life, after reading this book, I realize how much more I could have accomplished if I had been given the right tools early on in life. I  was able to do a little more for my children. But if I would have had this book as a guide to some of the advantages available in the educational arena I believe I could have done a whole lot more.  Thank you Mrs Obama!!

reviews: I was a fan of Michele’s before the book. But after reading it, I’m now a bigger fan. Her book takes you through the the years before and during her time as POTUS.  Her telling of her feelings are straight from her heart. Her details of what it’s like to life in the White House were amazing. But the bottom line is she is an awesome woman, mother, wife, and leader and she doesn’t tell her story with bravado but with honesty you’d get if you were having a cup of tea with her.

reviews: I don't usually read books about political figures, although I am vitaly interested in politics-after all they are key to humanity's survival.It is heartening to lean that while  Barack Obama is an exceptional person,  his wife Michelle Obama is equally exceptional.  She is a woman with a voice , a soul and a conscience.  She values her family and the gifts they gave her- love and an identity.  If I met her now, after reading her book, I would feel that I know her and that I really like her!

reviews: What I learned and how much I learned in the process of reading Becoming is what I loved the most about it. There is also no emotion I did not experience in the process. My eyes were opened to realities of which I was unaware. My respect and admiration for Michelle Obama increased a thousand fold. I recommend the book to anyone and everyone who can read, and for those who cannot, there is the audio version. Be uplifted, be inspired, be humbled, be motivated, be instilled with hope by Becoming and be thankful to the amazing woman who wrote it.

reviews: This is a wonderful book.  I am so glad to have the opportunity to see and understand the life of an amazing woman.  She has revealed herself as so very real and human, while loving and caring for all the people in her life, especially children.  I always liked Michelle, even when I hardly knew her. reviews: Michell Obama's book is wonderfully written and inspirational BUT -for some reason, my copy had about 10-12 page spreads where the ink was too light to read or completely blank. Is this an issue with anyone else’s copy??? Where was the quality control person at Crown? How did Craig Robinson decide on Princeton? How did Michelle meet Jessie Jackson’s daughter? How did she become Barack’s mentor in the law firm???????  pgs. 52-53; 60-61; 68-69; 76-77; 84-85; 92-93; 100-101all blank or too light to read.

reviews: A truly inspiring and heartfelt life journey. A story told simply, eloquently, sincerely and with love. I have always admired both Michelle and Barack Obama, but after this book my admiration and respect is not just for what they have achieved, and as a black African woman, that achievement represented for me, but for the kind of heart they both possess and the human beings they are. This is the first book I listened to rather than read and having Mrs Obama telling her own story in her own voice is powerful and fitting.

reviews: Excellent book.  It reads as if you are having a conversation with her.  It shows how resilient she was and is.  It gives a different, more candid perspective of what people of color continue to go through on an almost daily basis.  Even with their differences the Obamas work through their ups and downs together.  They compliment each other. Family is so important to both of them.  Her frustrations about the report on what she is wearing overshadowing the true meaning of the meeting or activity she was attending gives one a better understanding of what it means to "live in a fishbowl."

reviews: I enjoyed Michelle's view and candid sharing of her private thoughts, life experiences and feelings. By reading her book, maybe in a small way we can walk in someone else's shoes vicariously learn something.

reviews: I have found this book very informative and yet down to earth.  I felt like I knew the Obama family personally.  I couldn't wait to read the next page.I have always felt the Obama family had the utmost dignity and self-awareness.  Kindness to everyone they met.  We all have the same color underneath, it doesn't hurt to smile, say hello, or maybe hold the door for someone.I worked for a school District in a poor area, I found all the children to be the same color, not one being different from the other.  We all need to pull together to make this country work.

reviews: I loved how this book felt like a conversation. Mrs. Obama is a great story teller. Her words flowed easily and smoothly and kept me turning the page wanting to know more about each episode of her life. I appreciate the way she made aspects of her life connect. I didn't devour the book like so many people I know did. I took my time and read it carefully so I could get to know this lady. I'm sure she and I would be friends. :)

reviews: Michelle Obama has done an excellent job vividly presenting the many historical, social, behavioral, spiritual and legislative factors that go into our development of a more empathetic, compassionate and supportive country that meets the needs of all of our residents.  Through every experience she shared, one can understand and feel new dimensions of the ongoing internal struggles we continue to go through to “fit” and flourish together.  Thanks for so beautifully sharing with us Michelle.

reviews: I am putting myself through 75 Hard challenge.  75 days of 5 tasks.Reading 10-pages of non-fiction is one of the tasks.I was a book worm growing up.  My love of book has not diminished but my time has....so I thought.10 pages go by quickly.  The book provides a wonderful insight into her life - growing up, meeting her husband and the public life many of are familiar with.  The personal antidotes are heart-warming.

reviews: I am not typically a memoir reader, but I’ve always admired Michelle Obama, and now even more so.  She’s so real and honest and it was fascinating and enjoyable to learn about her and Barack Obama as people.  This book is full of hope and optimism and their desire to see and bring out the best in each other, people all around them, and the country.  “Are you good enough?  Yes, you are.”  That will stick with me.

reviews: This journey was absolutely a magical work of art! I can usually make it through a great book in a day or so but  Becoming took me several weeks. reviews: I am so grateful to have read this book. As a young Latina who is a daughter of immigrants, I strive daily to remain hopeful and optimistic about our country’s future. I pride myself in being the odd voice in the room full of optimism and promoting change even when faced with negative responses. This book really inspired me to keep tru to myself and my ideals no matter how hard it may get, because it all starts with those who are willing to sacrifice to bring about change.Thank you Michelle!Sincerely,A young girls life you’ve touched!

reviews: It was clear Michelle Obama spoke from her heart.  She was honest, vulnerable and poignant.  Her insight into the 44th historical presidency covered the spectrum of what inspired us and shocked us to our core.  She took us on a historical journey of the courage and ugliness of race relations in America like few ever could.  She lived it and it’s her truth to tell.  She inspired me throughout her 8 years as FLOTUS and she inspires me with her story.  Mahalo nui loa

reviews: An intimate look into Michelle Obama's life, career, and most especially, her heart. She gives us a warm, generous, and fair accounting of her and her family's struggles, joys, family, w,ork, and accomplishments. reviews: I like the way she tells about her life from the start; what inspired her, her hopes + goals for the future and also an insight into her personality. I also like the way she tells about meeting her husband and the developing of their relationship. She writes about politics, however we are looking at the world with her eyes. I feel it is a personal book and I like to think that I know Micheele Obama, a strong, clever and enthusiastic woman, somewhat better after reading this book!

reviews: I liked the true stories, especially the one where the Obamas found themselves in Butte, Montana, a city rarely in the news. My parents were born and raised there and our family spent a one-time vacation there on the 4th of July exactly 50 years before the Obamas. This is the most well-written memoir by a "celebrity" that I have ever read. Michelle isn't just tooting her own horn, she is leaving breadcrumbs for future generations of girls and under-privileged others as to how to work and study their way into the American Dream.

reviews: Reading Becoming about the life of Michelle Obama made me long (more than usual) for days gone by. Her strength and dignity shows on every page. She shows her vulnerability and her growth into the position of First Lady. I loved her before but this book gave me an even deeper admiration for Her journey to Becoming who she is today. If you are a fan or someone who would like to know more about our former First Lady then this a book for you.

reviews: One of the best memoirs I have ever read of a First Lady! I have always loved reading about the lives of both the Presidents and the First Ladies and have read about them whether I agreed with their politics or not.  Michelle Obama dug deep to remember some of the details of her youth.  Her family was integral to supporting her in becoming the woman she is today.  A good lesson for us today to support the youth around us and encourage them to reach for the stars.  Cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed reading about her experiences.  You’ll love it if you read it!

reviews: Thank you Michelle Obama for sharing your story. It was truly amazing to see you become such a wonderful source of pride for children, women, and our military families. I proud to have had you as my First Lady for 8 years. You continue to allow me to believe things can change and to always go high even when they go low.

reviews: As always, Mrs. Obama was open, honest while inviting the American public into her extraordinary life. She reminded us of her hard working fathers role model work ethic and her mother serving as the perpetual champion for her and her brother. It reminds me how much I miss The Obama’s in the White House. She’s a vision of class and dare I say...a trailblazer. I was inspired.  I was proud of the platform they represented. America is better when EVERYONE has a seat at the table.

reviews: Always a pleasure to see "history" through the eyes and heart of key participants. Mrs. Obama shares her perspective during some America's highest and lowest times. It is good to be reminded of the values that make our country great; family, community, resilience, dignity, tolerance, excellence, opportunity, laughter, faith, love and hope. What a wonderful First Lady!

reviews: As a woman in the country and of the same generation as Michelle Obama I could relate to many moments in her stories and antidotes. Her work for minorities and women is outstanding, beyond the political, and shows who she truly is as a person. Outstanding memoir!

reviews: I chose to read this book because I admired Mrs. Obama from the first time I heard her speak.  She is a well educated, well spoken woman who told things like it is!  I am 75 years old and have seen a number of First Ladies come and go but none gave more pleasure listening to them than did she.  Of course I also greatly admired her husband and his views for our country. Mrs. Obama is what my mother would have called a "down to earth person."  I was very sad to see the end of their term in the White House especially when Donald Trump was elected!!  God help us all!!

Of course I also greatly admired her husband and his views for our country. Mrs. Obama is what my mother would have called a "down to earth person." reviews: Michelle Obama writes from the heart. She gave an honest and impactful insight into what it was like to grow up as a talented and nurtured black female. It should be encouraging to all females knowing that even the First Lady had ongoing doubts throughout her life that she was 'good enough.' How many times we doubt ourselves thinking we are the only one. I could almost hear her voice reading to me as I read it myself.

reviews: The great part of Michelle Obama’s story telling is how she reflects on the world around her as she writes about her own experiences. From her growing up in a middle class black family in Southside Chicago, to her career, her marriage, her difficulties in getting pregnant and on to FLOTUS, she provides a reflection of contemporary women’s issues, particularly for women of color.

reviews: Eloquent and moving, Michelle Obama "speaks" about her journey in life up until this point (54 years of age at publication). Her love for country, husband, family and people knows no bounds as evidenced in this read-worthy book.Quotes from the epilogue which I admire : "Becoming requires equal parts patience and rigor. Becoming is never giving up on the idea that there's more growing to be done." Truly a lesson therein for us all.

reviews: Reading this took me back in time to a very different reality than we have today. reviews: As a writer and reader of memoir and autobiography, I thoroughly enjoyed this book for its insight and detail about life on the inside of growing up and then finding oneself in the midst of a public life. Some day, I hope she'll write a sequel.
